dhammo suciṇṇo sukham'āvahati,
saccaṃ have sādutaraṃ rasānaṃ,
paññājīviṃ jīvitam'āhu seṭṭhan'ti.
example_2:
ye diṭṭhim'uggayha vivādayanti,

vādamhi jāte paṭisenikattā.
sbs_example_3:
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ.
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

sbs_example_5:

meaning_1: delighted (in); was pleased (with); approved (of); was happy (with); relished
example_1: attamano āyasmā rāhulo bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandi
example_2: atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu, anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamiṃsu, bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā'ti.
sbs_example_3: idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanduṃ.

example_1: uṭṭhehi, āvuso, diṭṭho-asi bhagavatā, n'atthi te bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāso'ti
example_2:
atthakāmo'si me yakkha,
hitakāmo'si devate,
karomi tuyhaṃ vacanaṃ,
tvaṃ'si ācariyo mama.
sbs_example_3:
gahakāraka diṭṭho-asi, puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā, gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ, taṇhānaṃ khayam'ajjhagā.
sbs_example_4:
mutt'āhaṃ sabbapāsehi, ye dibbā ye ca mānusā.
mahābandhanamutto'mhi, nihato tvam'asi antakā'ti.

example_1: upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
example_2: atha kho therā bhikkhū yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ vutte, uttaro māṇavo pārāsiviy'antevāsī tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.
sbs_example_4: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi. sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi. ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca

meaning_1: is dis-enchanted (with); is disinterested (in); is disillusioned (by); loses interest (in); is dispassionate (towards)
example_1: yaṃ kiñci pasavati, asuci'y'eva pasavati, duggandhaṃ'y'eva pasavati, jegucchiyaṃ'y'eva pasavati. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ kāye nibbindathā'ti.

atha nibbindati dukkhe,

example_1: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, na dān'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, ito paraṃ uposathaṃ karissāmi, pātimokkhaṃ uddisissāmi
example_2: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca

example_1:
es'eva maggo n'atth'añño,

etañ'hi tumhe paṭipajjatha,

commentary: (SNa) dhajo rathassā'ti mahantasmiṃ hi saṅgāmasīse dūrato'va dhajaṃ disvā, asukarañño nāma ayaṃ ratho'ti ratho pākaṭo hoti.
example_1:

example_1:

vuyhamāno mah'oghena, buddhaṃ saraṇam'āgamaṃ.

example_1:

example_1: evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, majjhe nadiyā soto vikkhitto visaṭo byādiṇṇo n'eva dūraṅ'gamo assa na sīghasoto na hārahārī .

meaning_1: may they be!; they must be!

example_2: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.

example_1:

meaning_1: is reborn (in); re-arises (in); lit. goes towards
example_1:

aggi ḍahati pāvako,

example_2: yattha nu kho, bhante, na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, sakkā nu kho so, bhante, gamanena lokassa anto ñātuṃ vā daṭṭhuṃ vā pāpuṇituṃ vā'ti?
sbs_example_3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhāṇado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_4: sace kho pana atthi paro loko, atthi sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, ath'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissāmī'ti

meaning_1: homeless spiritual seeker; wandering ascetic; lit. who goes around
commentary: (VIN 2.5.5.1) paribbājako nāma bhikkhuñ'ca sāmaṇerañ'ca ṭhapetvā yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno.
example_1: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti
example_2: sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā
sbs_example_3: atha kho te bhikkhū yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: approached; drew near; went (to); lit. went near
example_1: atha kho āyasmā ānando pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya yena aññataro bhikkhun'upassayo tena-upasaṅkami
example_2: kosambiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā tena-upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.

meaning_1: it is suitable (for); it is proper (for); it is fitting (for); it is allowable
example_1: kappati samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtiyānaṃ jātarūparajataṃ, sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṃ, paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajatan'ti!
example_2: sappi nāma gosappi vā ajikāsappi vā mahiṃsasappi vā yesaṃ maṃsaṃ kappati tesaṃ sappi.
sbs_example_3: alaṃ, āvuso, mā socittha, mā paridevittha, sumuttā mayaṃ tena mahāsamaṇena. upaddutā ca homa, idaṃ vo kappati, idaṃ vo na kappatī'ti.

example_1:
kadā aniccaṃ vadharoganīḷaṃ,
kāyaṃ imaṃ maccujarāy'upaddutaṃ,
vipassamāno vītabhayo vihassaṃ,
eko vane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.
example_2:
nagā samuddā saritā vasun'dharā,
disā catasso vidisā adho divā,
sabbe aniccā tibhavā upaddutā,
kuhiṃ gato citta sukhaṃ ramissasi.
sbs_example_3: alaṃ, āvuso, mā socittha, mā paridevittha, sumuttā mayaṃ tena mahāsamaṇena. upaddutā ca homa, idaṃ vo kappati, idaṃ vo na kappatī'ti.

example_1:
abhivādanasīlissa,
niccaṃ vuḍḍh'āpacāyino,
cattāro dhammā vaḍḍhanti,
āyu vaṇṇo sukhaṃ balaṃ.
example_2: etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.
sbs_example_3: ahaṃ kho pubbe ābādhiko ahosiṃ dukkhito bāḷhagilāno, bhattañ'ca me nacchādesi, na ca me āsi kāye balamattā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, abhikkhaṇaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, dīgharattam'idaṃ cittaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ rāgena dosena mohenā'ti. cittasaṃkilesā, bhikkhave, sattā saṃkilissanti. cittavodānā sattā visujjhanti.
example_2:
kummo aṅgāni sake kapāle,
samodahaṃ bhikkhu manovitakke,
anissito aññam'aheṭhayāno,
parinibbuto n'ūpavadeyya kañcī'ti.
sbs_example_3: ahaṃ kho sakamhā gāmā amuṃ gāmaṃ agacchiṃ
sbs_example_4: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?

example_1: tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi
example_2: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca
sbs_chant_eng_2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

example_1:
yāya mātu bhato poso,

example_2: santi idh'ekacce khattiyā, brāhmaṇā'ti bhaṇati

example_1:
pare ca na vijānanti,
mayam'ettha yamāmase,
ye ca tattha vijānanti,

example_2: yesañ'ca mayaṃ cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāma, tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā
sbs_example_3: mayañ'hi, bho gotama, antevāsiṃ labhitvā paṭhamaṃ evaṃ gaṇāpema, ekaṃ ekakaṃ, dve dukā, tīṇi tikā, cattāri catukkā, pañca pañcakā, cha chakkā, satta sattakā, aṭṭha aṭṭhakā
sbs_example_4: tam'mayaṃ bhagavantaṃ sadhammaṃ sasaṅghaṃ, imehi sakkārehi yath'ārahaṃ āropitehi abhipūjayāma
sbs_example_5: sacc'ānurakkhaṇaṃ mayaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ apucchimha, sacc'ānurakkhaṇaṃ bhavaṃ gotamo byākāsi

example_1:
gahakāraka diṭṭho'si,

example_2: ahañ'hi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhī, yo koci diṭṭhaṃ bhāsati, evaṃ me diṭṭhan'ti, n'atthi tato doso
sbs_example_3:

example_1: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.
example_2: daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā majjhe gaṇṭhiṃ karitvā ossajjeyya. atha kho, te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ
sbs_example_3: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

meaning_1: truth of the Buddha; noble truth
example_1: tasmā evaṃ samannāgato bhikkhu iminā paramena sacc'ādhiṭṭhānena samannāgato hoti. etañ'hi, bhikkhu, paramaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yadidaṃ, amosadhammaṃ nibbānaṃ.
example_2:
tapo ca brahmacariyañ'ca,
ariyasaccāna dassanaṃ,
nibbānasacchikiriyā ca,
etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.

sbs_example_4: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati catūsu ariyasaccesu.
sbs_example_5: api c'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sahā'va sukhena, sahā'va somanassena catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ abhisamayaṃ vadāmi.

example_1: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso odātena vatthena sasīsaṃ pārupetvā nisinno assa
example_2:

khādanīyānaṃ atho'pi vatthānaṃ,
laddhā na sannidhiṃ kayirā,

example_1: idha cunda ekacco anabhijjhālu hoti. yaṃ taṃ parassa paravitt'ūpakaraṇaṃ taṃ anabhijjhitā hoti, aho vata yaṃ parassa taṃ mamassā'ti
example_2:

commentary: (SNa) ekodi nipakā'ti ekaggacittā c'eva paññānepakkena ca samannāgatā.
example_1: tesaṃ pahānā ajjhattam'eva cittaṃ santiṭṭhati sannisīdati ekodi hoti samādhiyati.
example_2:
kaṃ so sikkhaṃ samādāya,
ekodi nipako sato,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malam'attano.
sbs_example_3: vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

example_1:
yassa n'atthi idaṃ me'ti,
paresaṃ v'āpi kiñcanaṃ,
mamattaṃ so asaṃvindaṃ,
n'atthi me'ti na socati.
example_2: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.
sbs_example_3:
virūpakkhehi me mettaṃ, mettaṃ erāpathehi me.

sbs_example_4: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā. rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na'y'idaṃ rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī'ti.

example_1:

example_2:
akiñcanaṃ anādānaṃ,

example_1: taggha'si, tāta kumma, khato, taggha upahato. etena hi te, tāta kumma, suttakena pitaro ca pitāmahā ca anayaṃ āpannā byasanaṃ āpannā. gaccha dāni tvaṃ, tāta kumma, na dāni tvaṃ amhākan'ti.
example_2: hivibhatti lopam'āpajjate vā. gaccha, gacchāhi, gama, gamāhi, gamaya, gamayāhi. hī'ti kim'atthaṃ? gacchati, gamayati.

meaning_1: approaches; goes (to); visits; lit. goes near
example_1: sace bhavaṃ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissati, bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa yaso hāyissati, samaṇassa gotamassa yaso abhivaḍḍhissati.

example_1: taṇhā hi naṃ sibbati tassa tass'eva bhavassa abhinibbattiyā.

meaning_1: helps to reach; brings (to); leads (to); lit. causes to reach
example_1:
tasmā pattapuṭass'eva,
ñatvā sampākam'attano,
asante n'upaseveyya,
sante seveyya paṇḍito,
asanto nirayaṃ nenti,
santo pāpenti suggatin'ti.
example_2: so lābhasakkāraṃ jigucchanto pabbajjaṃ anupagantvā, pahomi c'āhaṃ lābh'ālābh'ādīsu nibbikāro hotun'ti attānaṃ takkento, visesato paraparibhavasahanādipaṭipadaṃ pūrento upekkhāpāramiṃ matthakaṃ pāpessāmī'ti
sbs_example_3:

meaning_1: false teaching; something opposed to the teaching
example_1:
evaṃ dhammā apakkamma,
adhammam'anuvattiya,
mando maccumukhaṃ patto,
akkhacchinno'va jhāyatī'ti.
example_2: kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desitaṃ, ājānantehi dhammā'pi vo pahātabbā pag'eva adhammā.

na hi dhammo adhammo ca, ubho samavipākino.

meaning_1: neutral; neither unpleasant nor pleasant; neither comfortable nor uncomfortable
commentary: (VINa) adukkham'asukhan'ti dukkh'ābhāvena adukkhaṃ, sukh'ābhāvena asukhaṃ. eten'ettha dukkhasukhapaṭipakkhabhūtaṃ tatiyavedanaṃ dīpeti, na dukkhasukhābhāvamattaṃ. tatiyavedanā nāma, adukkhamasukhā, upekkhā'ti'pi vuccati. sā iṭṭh'āniṭṭhaviparīt'ānubhavanalakkhaṇā, majjhattarasā, avibhūtapaccupaṭṭhānā, sukhanirodhapadaṭṭhānā'ti veditabbā.
example_1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, sukhā, āvuso, vedanā eko anto, dukkhā vedanā dutiyo anto, adukkham'asukhā vedanā majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
example_2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb'eva somanassadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā, adukkham'asukhaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
sbs_example_3: n'eva tasmiṃ samaye dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti, na adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti
sbs_example_4: sukham'pi vedayati, dukkham'pi vedayati, adukkham'asukham'pi vedayati. vedayatī'ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā vedanā'ti vuccati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: pamuditassa pīti jāyati pītimanassa kāyo passambhati passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedeti sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati
example_2: so tattha dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedeti, na ca tāva kālaṅ'karoti yāva na taṃ pāpakammaṃ byantīhoti.
sbs_example_3: n'eva tasmiṃ samaye dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti, na adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti
sbs_example_4:
rūpaṃ disvā sati muṭṭhā, piyaṃ nimittaṃ manasi karoto.
sārattacitto vedeti, tañ'ca ajjhosa tiṭṭhati.
sbs_example_5: yaṃ vedeti taṃ sañjānāti, yaṃ sañjānāti taṃ vijānāti. tasmā ime dhammā saṃsaṭṭhā no visaṃsaṭṭhā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: then; on that occasion; at that time
example_1: eko'va bhagavā tasmiṃ samaye viharitu'kāmo hoti na bhagavā tasmiṃ samaye kenaci anubandhitabbo hotī'ti
example_2: yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.
sbs_example_3: n'eva tasmiṃ samaye dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti, na adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti
sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, yadā te vīṇāya tantiyo accāyatā honti, api nu te vīṇā tasmiṃ samaye saravatī vā hoti kammaññā vā'ti?
sbs_example_5: satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, satisambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?
example_2:
ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.
sbs_example_3:
n'atthi loke raho nāma, pāpakammaṃ pakubbato,
attā te purisa jānāti, saccaṃ vā yadi vā musā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: makes stable; steadies; establishes; lit. causes to stand
example_1: moggallāna, moggallāna, mā, brāhmaṇa, ariyaṃ tuṇhībhāvaṃ pamādo, ariye tuṇhībhāve cittaṃ saṇṭhapehi, ariye tuṇhībhāve cittaṃ ekodibhāvaṃ karohi, ariye tuṇhībhāve cittaṃ samādahā'ti.
example_2: so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, tassā'y'eva kathāya pariyosāne, tasmiṃ'y'eva purimasmiṃ samādhinimitte ajjhattam'eva cittaṃ saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodiṃ karomi samādahāmi, yena sudaṃ niccakappaṃ viharāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: mā, brāhmaṇa, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ pamādo, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ saṇṭhapehi, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ ekodiṃ karohi, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ samādahā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: bad; wicked; evil; wrong; worthless; harmful
example_1:
sānuṃ pabuddhaṃ vajjāsi,
yakkhānaṃ vacanaṃ idaṃ,
m'ākāsi pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.
example_2: so sabbehi imehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi visuddham'attānaṃ samanupassati, vimuttam'attānaṃ samanupassati.
sbs_example_3:
kiñ'c'āpi so kammaṃ karoti pāpakaṃ, kāyena vācā'uda cetasā vā.
abhabbo so tassa paṭicchadāya, abhabbatā diṭṭhapadassa vuttā.
sbs_example_4: yatv'ādhikaraṇam'enaṃ cakkhu'ndriyaṃ asaṃvutaṃ viharantaṃ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssaveyyuṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

notes: (PED) deed what have the potential effect for doer
example_1: iti kho, ānanda, kammaṃ khettaṃ, viññāṇaṃ bījaṃ, taṇhā sneho.
example_2: cetan'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, kammaṃ vadāmi. cetayitvā kammaṃ karoti, kāyena vācāya manasā.
sbs_example_3:
kiñ'c'āpi so kammaṃ karoti pāpakaṃ, kāyena vācā'uda cetasā vā.
abhabbo so tassa paṭicchadāya, abhabbatā diṭṭhapadassa vuttā.
sbs_example_4:
sānuṃ pabuddhaṃ vajjāsi,
yakkhānaṃ vacanaṃ idaṃ,

āvi vā yadi vā raho.

iminā puññakammena ‒ mā me bālasamāgamo.

example_1:
saccaṃ bhaṇe na kujjheyya,
dajjā appam'pi yācito,
etehi tīhi ṭhānehi,
gacche devāna santike.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pāsāṇe lekhā na khippaṃ lujjati vātena vā udakena vā, ciraṭṭhitikā hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco puggalo abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati. so ca khv'assa kodho dīgharattaṃ anuseti.
sbs_example_3: kiṃ nu kujjhasi mā kujjhi, akkodho tissa te varaṃ

example_1: aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde acchariyā abbhutā dhammā, ye disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti. katame aṭṭha?
example_2:
ek'āsanassa sikkhetha,
samaṇ'ūpāsanassa ca,
ekattaṃ monam'akkhātaṃ,
eko ce abhiramissasi,
atha bhāhisi dasadisā.
sbs_example_3: kacci nu kho'haṃ suññ'āgāre abhiramāmī'ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_3: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth
sbs_example_4: ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā'ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānanti, te jātisaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu abhiramanti
sbs_example_5: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde chaṭṭho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṃ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satthāraṃ upanissāya viharati aññataraṃ vā garuṭṭhāniyaṃ sabrahmacāriṃ, yatth'assa tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti pemañ'ca gāravo ca.
example_2:
cudito vacībhi satim'ābhinande,
sabrahmacārīsu khilaṃ pabhinde,
vācaṃ pamuñce kusalaṃ n'ātivelaṃ,
janavādadhammāya na cetayeyya.
sbs_example_3: kacci nu kho maṃ anuvicca viññū sabrahmacārī sīlato na upavadantī'ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_3: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth
sbs_example_4: bhikkhu ye te lābhā dhammikā dhammaladdhā antamaso pattapariyāpannamattam'pi, tathārūpehi lābhehi appaṭivibhattabhogī hoti sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogī.
sbs_example_5: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū paccattaññ'eva satiṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti, kin'ti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyun'ti

example_1:
akkocchi maṃ avadhi maṃ,
ajini maṃ ahāsi me,
ye ca taṃ upanayhanti,
veraṃ tesaṃ na sammati.
example_2:
dukkhassa ve maṃ pabhavaṃ apucchasi,
taṃ te pavakkhāmi yathā pajānaṃ,
upadhinidānā pabhavanti dukkhā,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.

sbs_example_5:

example_1: iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo gūthabhāṇī.
example_2: idha, potaliya, ekacco puggalo avaṇṇ'ārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca kho vaṇṇ'ārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
sbs_example_3: iti bhinnānaṃ vā sandhātā sahitānaṃ vā anuppadātā samagg'ārāmo samaggarato samagganandī samaggakaraṇiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti

meaning_1: looking (at); observing; following; noticing; witnessing; watching
example_1: katamā ca, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattati? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbaya-anupassī viharati
example_2:
yo ve avidvā upadhiṃ karoti,
punappunaṃ dukkham'upeti mando,
tasmā pajānaṃ upadhiṃ na kayirā,
dukkhassa jātippabhava-anupassī.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāya-anupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ
sbs_example_4: anicca-anupassī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, anicca-anupassī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati
sbs_example_5:
paravajja-anupassissa, niccaṃ ujjhānasaññino,
āsavā tassa vaḍḍhanti, ārā so āsavakkhayā.

example_1: evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto
example_2: sabbakāyapaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, sabbakāyapaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati.
sbs_example_3: idha pana, upavāṇa, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā rūpappaṭisaṃvedī ca hoti rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī ca.

example_1: kāya nu'ttha, licchavī, eta'r'ahi kathāya sannisinnā, kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā'ti
example_2: kassa nu kho, bhante, subhāsitan'ti? sabbesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, subhāsitaṃ pariyāyena, api ca yaṃ mayā sandhāya bhāsitaṃ pārāyane metteyyapañhe
sbs_example_3: idaṃ vo ñātīnaṃ hotu, sukhitā hontu ñātayo.

example_1:
tathā tu kassāmi yathā'pi issaro,
yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
na t'āhaṃ kassāmi yathā atandito,
biḷārabhastaṃ'va yathā sumadditaṃ.
example_2: upanikkhittaṃ vā sādiyeyyā'ti idaṃ ayyassa hotū'ti upanikkhittaṃ sādiyati, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.
sbs_example_3:
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ.
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
sbs_example_4: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā. rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na'y'idaṃ rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī'ti.

example_1:
ayaṃ loko paro loko,
brahmaloko sadevako,
diṭṭhiṃ te n'ābhijānāti,
gotamassa yasassino.
example_2: puriso ca te ukkhitt'āsiko piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhissati. yatth'eva naṃ thokam'pi chaḍḍessati tatth'eva te siro pātessatī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
gahakāraka diṭṭho'si, puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā, gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ, taṇhānaṃ khayam'ajjhagā.

example_1: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, lokena vivadāmi, loko'va mayā vivadati. na, bhikkhave, dhammavādī kenaci lokasmiṃ vivadati.
example_2:
attadaṇḍā bhayaṃ jātaṃ,
janaṃ passatha medhagaṃ,
saṃvegaṃ kittayissāmi,
yathā saṃvijitaṃ mayā.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ svākkhāto, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo uttāno vivaṭo pakāsito chinnapilotiko.
sbs_example_4: yo vo, ānanda, mayā dhammo ca vinayo ca desito paññatto, so vo mam'accayena satthā.
sbs_example_5:
aniccā hi calā saddhā, evaṃ diṭṭhā hi sā mayā.
rajjanti'pi virajjanti, tattha kiṃ jiyyate muni.

example_1: etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhu, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
example_2: idha, bhante, amhākaṃ yo paṭhamaṃ gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati so āsanāni paññapeti, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, avakkārapātiṃ upaṭṭhāpeti
sbs_example_3: evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ pabbajjā avaṅkatā avañjhā bhavissati saphalā saudrayā.
sbs_example_4: dhammavādī c'eso bhikkhu vinayavādī c'eso bhikkhu amhākañ'c'eso bhikkhu chandañ'ca ruciñ'ca ādāya voharati, jānāti no bhāsati amhākam'p'etaṃ khamatī'ti

example_1: ekam'antaṃ nisinnā kho therā bhikkhū yāvatako ahosi sabbeh'eva saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo, taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesuṃ.
example_2: atha kho te bhikkhū yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu
sbs_example_3: evaṃ me sutaṃ ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi

meaning_1: name of a park outside Bārāṇasī; lit. deer park

example_1:

esā me anusāsanī,

sbs_example_4: ye kho te, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhū sekkhā apattamānasā anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamānā viharanti tesu me ayaṃ evarūpī anusāsanī hoti.

meaning_1: to you all; for you all
example_1: alañ'hi vo, kālāmā, kaṅkhituṃ alaṃ vicikicchituṃ
example_2: tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ, yā samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadā taṃ paṭipajjissāma. evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.
sbs_example_3: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
sbs_example_4: yo vo, ānanda, mayā dhammo ca vinayo ca desito paññatto, so vo mam'accayena satthā.

example_1: sāvatthinidānaṃ. yaṃ, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ, taṃ pajahatha. taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati
example_2: ovadatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā, anusāsatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā, yaṃ mam'assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: byāpādapadosaṃ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī, byāpādapadosā cittaṃ parisodheti
sbs_example_4: yadā tumhe attanā'va jāneyyātha, ime dhammā kusalā, ime dhammā anavajjā, ime dhammā viññuppasatthā, ime dhammā samattā samādinnā hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantī'ti, atha tumhe upasampajja vihareyyātha.

example_1:
andhabhūto ayaṃ loko,
tanuk'ettha vipassati,
sakuṇo jālamutto'va,
appo saggāya gacchati.
example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma pakkhī sakuṇo yena yen'eva ḍeti sapattabhāro'va ḍeti
sbs_example_3: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, sakuṇagghi lāpaṃ sakuṇaṃ sahasā ajjhappattā aggahesi.

meaning_1: by you all; with you all
example_1: sāvatthinidānaṃ. yaṃ, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ, taṃ pajahatha. taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati
example_2: tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā, amhākañ'c'ev'āyaṃ pabbajjā avañjhā bhavissati saphalā saudrayā'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.

example_1:
pheṇapiṇḍ'ūpamaṃ rūpaṃ,
vedanā bubbuḷ'ūpamā,
marīcik'ūpamā saññā,
saṅkhārā kadal'ūpamā,
māy'ūpamañ'ca viññāṇaṃ,
desita-ādiccabandhunā.
example_2: imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī'ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṃkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī'ti. iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttan'ti.

example_1:
sukhakāmāni bhūtāni,
yo daṇḍena vihiṃsati,
attano sukham'esāno,
pecca so na labhate sukhaṃ.
example_2: tassa sabbehi imehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi visuddham'attānaṃ samanupassato, vimuttam'attānaṃ samanupassato, pāmojjaṃ jāyati, pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedeti, sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.
sbs_example_3: bhārā have pañcakkhandhā, bhārahāro ca puggalo. bhār'ādānaṃ dukhaṃ loke, bhāranikkhepanaṃ sukhaṃ.
sbs_example_4: yaṃ, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ, taṃ pajahatha. taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
sbs_example_5: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti, upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

example_1:
yathā'pi ruciraṃ pupphaṃ,
vaṇṇavantaṃ agandhakaṃ,
evaṃ subhāsitā vācā,
aphalā hoti akubbato.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.
sbs_example_3:
bāhusaccañ'ca sippañ'ca, vinayo ca susikkhito.
subhāsitā ca yā vācā, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ
sbs_example_4: samphappalāpaṃ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī, nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ
sbs_example_5: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgatā vācā subhāsitā hoti, no dubbhāsitā, anavajjā ca ananuvajjā ca viññūnan'ti.

meaning_1: abandoned; dispelled; eliminated; removed; given up
example_1: kathañ'ca, thera, ekavihāro vitthārena paripuṇṇo hoti. idha, thera, yaṃ atītaṃ taṃ pahīnaṃ, yaṃ anāgataṃ taṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, paccuppannesu ca attabhāvapaṭilābhesu chandarāgo suppaṭivinīto.
example_2:
abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ,
bhāvetabbañ'ca bhāvitaṃ,
pahātabbaṃ pahīnaṃ me,
tasmā buddho'smi brāhmaṇa.
sbs_example_3: āṇaṇyaṃ yathā ārogyaṃ yathā bandhanāmokkhaṃ yathā bhujissaṃ yathā khem'antabhūmiṃ, evam'eva bhikkhu ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahīne attani samanupassati
sbs_example_4: yaṃ, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ, taṃ pajahatha. taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
sbs_example_5: yathā ca uppannassa uddhaccakukkuccassa pahānaṃ hoti tañ'ca pajānāti, yathā ca pahīnassa uddhaccakukkuccassa āyatiṃ anuppādo hoti tañ'ca pajānāti.

example_1: bhaggesu suṃsumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye antarahito cetīsu pācīnavaṃsadāye āyasmato anuruddhassa sammukhe pāturahosi
example_2: evam'eva, suddh'āvāsesu devesu antarahitā bhagavato purato pāturahesuṃ. atha kho tā devatā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.
sbs_example_3: ayañ'ca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkam'pi sampakam'pi sampavedhi, appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pāturahosi atikkamm'eva devānaṃ devānubhāvan'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on  Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

example_1:
na antalikkhe na samuddamajjhe,
na pabbatānaṃ vivaraṃ pavissa,
na vijjati so jagatippadeso,
yatthaṭṭhito mucceyya pāpakammā.
example_2:
majjhe yathā samuddassa,
ūmi no jāyatī ṭhito hoti,
evaṃ ṭhito anejassa,
ussadaṃ bhikkhu na kareyya kuhiñci.

sbs_example_4:

meaning_1: titan; enemy of the devas; lit. anti-hero
example_1: tena sudaṃ, bhante, devatā tāvatiṃsā attamanā honti pamuditā pītisomanassajātā dibbā vata bho kāyā paripūrenti, hāyanti asurakāyā'ti
example_2:
eko'va indo asure jināti,
eko'va seno hanti dije pasayha,

meaning_1: livelihood; mode of living; way of life; way of earning a living
example_1: parisuddho no ājīvo bhavissati uttāno vivaṭo na ca chiddavā saṃvuto ca
example_2: amhākam'pi hi, bho gotama, gaṇakānaṃ gaṇan'ājīvānaṃ dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṃ, saṅkhāne.
sbs_example_3: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo seyyath'īdaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
sbs_example_4: idha bhikkhave ariyasāvako micchāājīvaṃ pahāya sammāājīvena jīvitaṃ kappeti, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammāājīvo.
sbs_example_5: siyā kho pana te, nigrodha, evam'assa, ājīvā no cāvetu'kāmo samaṇo gotamo evam'āhā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, nigrodha, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. yo eva vo ājīvo, so eva vo ājīvo hotu.

example_1: aññātavāde na saṇṭhātī'ti aññātavāde jānitavāde na saṇṭhāti. kathaṃ? ekacco pañhaṃ pucchati, taṃ itaro, manāpo tayā pañho pucchito, kahaṃ te esa uggahito'ti vadati.
example_2: sādh'āvuso'ti kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ uttariṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.
sbs_example_3: atthi bhikkhave pañho ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho vibhajjabyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho ṭhapanīyo.
sbs_example_4: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

example_1:
satiyā taṃ nibandhissaṃ,
payutto te damessāmi,
vīriyadhuraniggahito,
na yito dūraṃ gamissase cittā'ti.
example_2:

kacche vāmakase magā,
jhānāni upasampajja,

sbs_example_3: atha kho aññe imaṃ bhogaṃ paṭipajjissanti, ahaṃ pana yathākammaṃ gamissāmī'ti.

example_1: app'eva nāma mayaṃ kadāci karahaci tena bhotā gotamena samāgaccheyyāma? app'eva nāma siyā koci'd'eva kathāsallāpo'ti!

meaning_1: far side; far shore; bank on the other side; epithet of Nibbāna
example_1:
oraṃ samuddassa atittarūpo,
pāraṃ samuddassa'pi patthayetha,
rājā ca aññe ca bahū manussā,
avītataṇhā maraṇaṃ upenti,
ūnāva hutvāna jahanti dehaṃ,
kāmehi lokamhi na hatthi titti.
example_2:
yaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ vedagum'ābhijaññā,
akiñcanaṃ kāmabhave asattaṃ,
addhā hi so ogham'imaṃ atāri,
tiṇṇo ca pāraṃ akhilo akaṅkho.
sbs_example_3:
appakā te manussesu, ye janā pāragāmino.
ath'āyaṃ itarā pajā, tīram'ev'ānudhāvati.
sbs_example_4:

meaning_1: complete comprehension (of); total understanding (of); completely getting (of); breakthrough (to); lit. arriving
example_1:

nicchātā parinibbutā'ti.

example_2: sace pana te, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā pāṇinā pahāraṃ dassanti, tatra pana te, puṇṇa, kinti bhavissatī'ti?
sbs_example_3: ahaṃ te aparimitaṃ dhanaṃ dassāmi, buddho na buddho, dhammo na dhammo, saṅgho na saṅgho, alaṃ me buddhena, alaṃ me dhammena, alaṃ me saṅghenā'ti vadehī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: like; as; as per; according to; how; in whatever way
example_1:
yathā ahaṃ tathā ete,
yathā ete tathā ahaṃ,
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā,
na haneyya na ghātaye.
example_2: tena hi, gahapati, taññ'ev'ettha paṭipucchissāmi, yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsi.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
sbs_example_4: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocessāma. yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.
sbs_example_5:
muhuttam'api ce viññū, paṇḍitaṃ payirupāsati.
khippaṃ dhammaṃ vijānāti, jivhā sūparasaṃ yathā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: having approached; having gone (to); having drawn near (to)
example_1: ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?
example_2: upasaṅkamitvā kummaṃ kacchapaṃ paccupaṭṭhito ahosi, yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
sbs_example_4: tatra ce so bhikkhu, pubbe appavārito, upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya
sbs_example_5: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi. sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi. ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
supupphit'aggaṃ upagamma bhikkhuni,
ekā tuvaṃ tiṭṭhasi sālamūle,
na c'atthi te dutiyā vaṇṇadhātu,
bāle na tvaṃ bhāyasi dhuttakānan'ti.
example_2:
diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno,
samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā,
ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ,
tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.
sbs_example_3:
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: him; her; one; that person; that thing
example_1:
taṃ brūmi upasanto'ti,
kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
ganthā tassa na vijjanti,
atarī so visattikaṃ.
example_2: tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ, yā samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadā taṃ paṭipajjissāma.
sbs_example_3: tam'mayaṃ bhagavantaṃ sadhammaṃ sasaṅghaṃ, imehi sakkārehi yath'ārahaṃ āropitehi abhipūjayāma
sbs_example_4: yaṃ, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ, taṃ pajahatha. taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
sbs_example_5: yathā ca pana kāmehi visaṃyuttaṃ viharantaṃ taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ akathaṃkathiṃ chinnakukkuccaṃ bhav'ābhave vītataṇhaṃ saññā n'ānusenti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: delight; heart-felt joy; pleasure; feeling of love; lit. lovely feeling
example_1: vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
example_2:
paññaṃ purakkhatvā kalyāṇapīti,
vikkhambhaye tāni parissayāni,
aratiṃ sahetha sayanamhi pante,
caturo sahetha paridevadhamme.
sbs_example_3: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti, upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
sbs_example_4: pītipaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, pītipaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati,
sbs_example_5: tassa kismiñci'd'eva pasādanīye nimitte cittaṃ paṇidahato pāmojjaṃ jāyati pamuditassa pīti jāyati pītimanassa kāyo passambhati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary:
(MNa) pañcasu kāmaguṇesu cittavossaggalakkhaṇo pamādo, vossagg'ānuppadānaraso, sativippavāsapaccupaṭṭhāno'ti
(MNa) pamādan'ti vissaṭṭhasatibhāvaṃ.
(SNa) pamādā cā'ti ... sati-vippavāsa-lakkhaṇena pamādena ca.
(SNa) pamādo'ti niddāya vā kilesavasena vā pamādo.
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.
example_2:
appamādo amatapadaṃ,
pamādo maccuno padaṃ,
appamattā na mīyanti,
ye pamattā yathā matā.
sbs_example_3:
pamādo rajo pamādo, pamād'ānupatito rajo,
appamādena vijjāya, abbahe sallam'attano'ti.
sbs_example_4: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamādoattha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ārogyaparamā lābhā,
santuṭṭhiparamaṃ dhanaṃ,
vissāsaparamā ñāti,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.
example_2: ye me petā ñātī sālohitā kālaṅ'katā pasannacittā anussaranti tesaṃ taṃ mahapphalaṃ assa mah'ānisaṃsan'ti
sbs_example_3: ñātibyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, bhogabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, rogabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, sīlabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, diṭṭhibyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa
sbs_example_4: idaṃ vo ñātīnaṃ hotu, sukhitā hontu ñātayo.
sbs_example_5: annakathaṃ pānakathaṃ vatthakathaṃ sayanakathaṃ mālākathaṃ gandhakathaṃ ñātikathaṃ yānakathaṃ gāmakathaṃ nigamakathaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
kiṃ nu santaramāno'va,
rāhu candaṃ pamuñcasi,
saṃviggarūpo āgamma,
kiṃ nu bhīto'va tiṭṭhasī'ti.
example_2:
catuppado ahaṃ samma,
tvam'pi samma catuppado,
ehi samma nivattassu,
kiṃ nu bhīto palāyasi.
sbs_example_3: kiṃ nu kujjhasi mā kujjhi, akkodho tissa te varaṃ
sbs_example_4: kiṃ nu kho bhoto gotamassa sāvakā bhotā gotamena evaṃ ovadīyamānā evaṃ anusāsīyamānā sabbe accantaṃ niṭṭhaṃ nibbānaṃ ārādhenti udāhu ekacce n'ārādhentī'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) jhāyathā'ti ārammaṇ'ūpanijjhānena aṭṭhatiṃs'ārammaṇāni, lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānena ca anicc'ādito khandh'āyatan'ādīni upanijjhāyatha, samathañ'ca vipassanañ'ca vaḍḍhethā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
example_1: etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhu, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
example_2:
sa jhānapasuto dhīro,
van'ante ramito siyā,
jhāyetha rukkhamūlasmiṃ,
attānam'abhitosayaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
jhāya bhikkhu mā pamādo, mā te kāmaguṇe bhamassu cittaṃ,
mā lohaguḷaṃ gilī pamatto, mā kandi dukkham'idan'ti ḍayhamāno.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: at one time; on one occasion
example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
example_2: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, ārādhayiṃsu vata me, bhikkhave, bhikkhū ekaṃ samayaṃ cittaṃ. idh'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū āmantesiṃ, ahaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjāmi.
sbs_example_3: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghosit'ārāme
sbs_example_4: evaṃ me sutaṃ ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so tattha dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedeti, na ca tāva kālaṅ'karoti yāva na taṃ pāpakammaṃ byantīhoti.
example_2: n'eva tasmiṃ samaye dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti, na adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti
sbs_example_3: dukkhaṃ vā vedanaṃ vedayamāno dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: who speaks about Dhamma; who speaks according to the teaching
example_1: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, lokena vivadāmi, loko'va mayā vivadati. na, bhikkhave, dhammavādī kenaci lokasmiṃ vivadati.
example_2: kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ
sbs_example_3: dhammavādī c'eso bhikkhu vinayavādī c'eso bhikkhu amhākañ'c'eso bhikkhu chandañ'ca ruciñ'ca ādāya voharati, jānāti no bhāsati amhākam'p'etaṃ khamatī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yv'āyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā'ti.
example_2: katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ? cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ.
sbs_example_3: catunnaṃ dhammānaṃ ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evam'idaṃ dīgham'addhānaṃ sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritaṃ mamañ'c'eva tumhākañ'ca
sbs_example_4: api c'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sahā'va sukhena, sahā'va somanassena catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ abhisamayaṃ vadāmi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: chasu kho, nāgita, phass'āyatanesu anicc'ānupassino viharato phasse pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti, eso tassa nissando.
example_2: so kāye ca sukhāya ca vedanāya anicc'ānupassī viharati, vay'ānupassī viharati, virāg'ānupassī viharati, nirodh'ānupassī viharati, paṭinissagg'ānupassī viharati.
sbs_example_3: anicc'ānupassī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, anicc'ānupassī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati
sbs_example_4: iti imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu anicc'ānupassī viharati. ayaṃ vuccat'ānanda, aniccasaññā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: name of the Buddha's chief lay disciple; lit. feeder of the destitute
example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
example_2: atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati pañcamattehi upāsakasatehi parivuto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.
sbs_example_3: anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yāvatako ahosi tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so evaṃ vadeyya, alaṃ me, bho, tāya vīṇāya, tam'eva me saddaṃ āharathā'ti. tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ayaṃ kho, bhante, vīṇā nāma anekasambhārā mahāsambhārā
example_2: alaṃ, vakkali, kiṃ te iminā pūtikāyena diṭṭhena? yo kho, vakkali, dhammaṃ passati so maṃ passati, yo maṃ passati so dhammaṃ passati
sbs_example_3: alaṃ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi, nanu etaṃ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacc'eva akkhātaṃ – sabbeh'eva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: alañ'ca pana vo, bhikkhave, tuṭṭhiyā, alaṃ attamanatāya, alaṃ somanassāya, sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto dhammo, suppaṭipanno saṅgho'ti.
example_2: siyā kho pana bhikkhave tumhākaṃ evam'assa, hir'ottappen'amha samannāgatā, alam'ettāvatā katam'ettāvatā, anuppatto no sāmaññ'attho, n'atthi no kiñci uttariṃ karaṇīyan'ti
sbs_example_3: alam'eva saddhāpabbajitena kulaputtena vīriyaṃ ārabhituṃ
sbs_example_4:
alattakakatā pādā, mukhaṃ cuṇṇakamakkhitaṃ.
alaṃ bālassa mohāya, no ca pāragavesino.
sbs_example_5: alam'ettāvatā katam'ettāvatā, anuppatto no sāmaññ'attho, n'atthi no kiñci uttariṃ karaṇīyan'ti tāvataken'eva tuṭṭhiṃ āpajjeyyātha.

example_1: saṃyogāya saṃvattanti no visaṃyogāya
example_2: cattāro'me, bhikkhave, visaṃyogā. katame cattāro? kāmayogavisaṃyogo, bhavayogavisaṃyogo, diṭṭhiyogavisaṃyogo, avijjāyogavisaṃyogo.

example_1: naccagītavāditavisūkadassanā paṭivirato ahosiṃ. mālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhānā paṭivirato ahosiṃ.
example_2: bhojane mattaññuno bhavissāma paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya

meaning_1: remorseful; regretful; repentant; sorry; lit. remembering back negatively
example_1: etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhu, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.

meaning_1: attachment; association; involvement; lit. yoking together

meaning_1: personal name of an arahant monk; lit. protector of the country
example_1: atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo sakapitu nivesane n'eva dānaṃ alattha na paccakkhānaṃ, añña'd'atthu akkosam'eva alattha

commentary:
(SNa) yasassinan'ti parivārasaṅkhātena yasena sampannānaṃ.
(SNa) app'icchā santuṭṭhā app'icchatāya vattham'pi na nivāsentī'ti evaṃ samuggato yaso etesaṃ atthī'ti yasassino
example_1: atha kho sabhiyo paribbājako tassā devatāya santike te pañhe uggahetvā ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇ'ācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa ... te upasaṅkamitvā te pañhe pucchati.
example_2:
ayaṃ loko paro loko,
brahmaloko sadevako,
diṭṭhiṃ te n'ābhijānāti,
gotamassa yasassino.

example_1: hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākamm'ūpage satte pajānāti
example_2: atha kho aññe imaṃ bhogaṃ paṭipajjissanti, ahaṃ pana yathākammaṃ gamissāmī'ti.

meaning_1: you (all) mustn't be careless; don't be negligent
example_1: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.

meaning_1: don't have remorse later!; don't regret it later
commentary: (SNa) mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvatthā'ti ye hi pubbe daharakāle arogakāle sattasappāy'ādisampattikāle satthu sammukhībhāvakāle ca yonisomanasikārarahitā rattin'divaṃ maṅkulabhattaṃ hutvā seyyasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anubhontā pamajjanti, te pacchā jarākāle rogakāle maraṇakāle vipattikāle satthu parinibbutakāle ca taṃ pubbe pamādavihāraṃ anussarantā sappaṭisandhikālakiriyañ'ca bhāriyaṃ sampassamānā vippaṭisārino honti.
example_1: etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhu, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.

meaning_1: don't let this person defeat you
example_1: mā kho tumhe, āyasmanto, eso ajesi.

meaning_1: let it not be; may it not exist
example_1: yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ anattā, tasmā rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvattati, na ca labbhati rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

meaning_1: may they not be; may they not exist
commentary: (MNa) mā vā ahesun'ti kiñci'pi mā ahesuṃ. idhā'pi kopamattakena kammapathabhedo na hoti. haññantū'tiādicintanen'eva hoti, tasmā evaṃ vuttaṃ.
example_1: byāpannacitto hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo, ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun'ti.
example_2: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.

example_1:

example_1: ajānam'evaṃ āvuso avacaṃ jānāmi, apassaṃ passāmi, tucchaṃ musā vilapin'ti, aññatra adhimānā, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

meaning_1: woman; female; women in general; womankind; lit. collection of mothers

notes: masc in grammar, fem in meaning
example_1: idha, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakamm'anto hoti, saṅgahitaparijano, bhattu manāpaṃ carati, sambhataṃ anurakkhati.
example_2: so tattha passati mātugāmaṃ dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā. tassa mātugāmaṃ disvā dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti.

meaning_1: being; living being; entity; lit. become
commentary: (MNa) bhūtasaddo pañcakkhandh'āmanussa-dhātu-vijjamāna-khīṇ'āsava-satta-rukkh'ādīsu dissati ... sabb'eva nikkhipissanti bhūtā loke samussayan'ti ettha sattesu.

sbs_example_3:

example_2: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, ye keci mūlagandhā, kālānusāri tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati, ... evam'eva bhoto gotamassa ovādo param'ajjadhammesu.

example_1: ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekaccassa bhikkhuno evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata mam'eva bhikkhū sakkareyyuṃ garuṃ kareyyuṃ māneyyuṃ pūjeyyuṃ, na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ bhikkhū sakkareyyuṃ garuṃ kareyyuṃ māneyyuṃ pūjeyyun'ti.

example_1:

meaning_1: wise; intelligent; insightful; percipient; lit. having wisdom quality
commentary:
(SNa) paññavatā'ti tam'pi sappaññen'eva paṇḍitena.
(ANa) paññavanto ... ettha kammassakatapaññā, jhānapaññā vipassanāpaññā, maggapaññā, phalapaññā'ti etāhi samannāgatā paññavanto nāma
example_1:
na attahetu na parassa hetu,
na puttam'icche na dhanaṃ na raṭṭhaṃ,
na iccheyya adhammena samiddhim'attano,
sa sīlavā paññavā dhammiko siyā.
example_2: ye pana te kulaputtā ... āraddhavīriyā pahit'attā upaṭṭhitassatino sampajānā samāhitā ekaggacittā paññavanto aneḷamūgā, tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.
sbs_example_3: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū paññavanto bhavissanti
sbs_example_4: ariyasāvako paññavā hoti uday'atthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā.
sbs_example_5:
yo sīlavā paññavā bhāvit'atto,
samāhito jhānarato satīmā,
sabbassa sokā vigatā pahīnā,
khīṇ'āsavo antimadehadhārī.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: and then; or; after that; because of
example_1:
pubbenivāsaṃ yo vedi,
sagg'āpāyañ'ca passati,
atho jātikkhayaṃ patto,
abhiññā vosito muni.
example_2:
kadā nu'haṃ dubbacanena vutto,
tatonimittaṃ vimano na hessaṃ,
atho pasattho'pi tatonimittaṃ,
tuṭṭho na hessaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.
sbs_example_3:
yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni, bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe.
sabb'eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu, atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
byādhidhammā jarādhammā, atho maraṇadhammino.
yathā dhammā tathā sattā, jigucchanti puthujjanā.
sbs_example_5: mātari pitari c'āpi, atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari. ācariye catutthamhi, tesu na mānaṃ kayirātha.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno yaṃ nimittaṃ āgamma yaṃ nimittaṃ manasikaroto uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā vitakkā chand'ūpasaṃhitā'pi dos'ūpasaṃhitā'pi moh'ūpasaṃhitā'pi, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tamhā nimittā aññaṃ nimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ kusal'ūpasaṃhitaṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso sakamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā ciravippavuttho assa. so aññataraṃ purisaṃ passeyya tamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā acirapakkantaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa
sbs_example_4: ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena m'idh'ekacce sattā tamhā kāyā cutā āgāmino honti āgantāro itthattaṃ?
sbs_example_5: atha kho tamhā'va udakarahadā sītā vāridhārā ubbhijjitvā tam'eva udakarahadaṃ sītena vārinā abhisandeyya parisandeyya paripūreyya paripphareyya, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato udakarahadassa sītena vārinā apphuṭaṃ assa.

example_1: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ pajānāti evaṃ passati, ayaṃ vuccati, sot'āpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano'ti.
example_2:
sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.

meaning_1: by the teacher; with the master
example_1: yañ'hi taṃ, āvuso, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti, mamaṃ taṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti.
example_2: so satthārā dinnanaye ṭhatvā satthāraṃ vanditvā, ajja ādiṃ katvā mama santakaṃ dasikasuttamattam'pi maṃ abhibhavitvā anekasatā'pi rājāno vā corā vā gaṇhituṃ samatthā nāma mā hontu, aggināpi mama santakaṃ mā ḍayhatu, udakenapi mā vuyhatū'ti patthanaṃ akāsi.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit'esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.

meaning_1: dresses; clothes; give clothes (to); lit. covers
example_1: bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī'ti
example_2: sādhu vata maṃ āyasmā iminā cīvaracetāpannena evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādehī'ti kalyāṇakamyataṃ upādāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamat'āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī'ti.

example_1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.
example_2:
satiyā taṃ nibandhissaṃ,
payutto te damessāmi,
vīriyadhuraniggahito,
na yito dūraṃ gamissase cittā'ti.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamat'āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī'ti.
sbs_example_4: so taṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti.
sbs_example_5:

na taṃ bhāyāmi āvuso'ti.

meaning_1: before; previously; formerly; in the past
example_1: tassa evaṃ hoti, mayaṃ kho pubbe agāriyabhūtā samānā aññe ovadāma'pi anusāsāma'pi. ime pan'amhākaṃ puttamattā maññe nattamattā maññe ovaditabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññantī'ti.
example_2:

pacchā so nappamajjati,

sbs_example_5: uposatha-karaṇato pubbe navavidhaṃ pubbakiccaṃ kātabbaṃ hoti

example_1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, phasso kho, āvuso, eko anto, phassasamudayo dutiyo anto, phassanirodho majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
example_2: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho bhikkhave dukkhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi.

commentary: (SNa) puññan'ti puññacetanā, sā hi arūpattā pariharituṃ na sakkā'ti.
example_1:

pāpā cittaṃ nivāraye,

example_2:

saddhā sādhu patiṭṭhitā,

sbs_example_4:

example_1:
na hi verena verāni,

sbs_example_3: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa

meaning_1: thus; like this; this is; and so
example_1: iti kho, bhikkhave, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ lābhasakkārasilok'ānisaṃsaṃ na sīlasampad'ānisaṃsaṃ na samādhisampad'ānisaṃsaṃ na ñāṇadassan'ānisaṃsaṃ
example_2:
akiñcanaṃ anādānaṃ,

nibbānaṃ iti naṃ brūmi,

sbs_example_3: vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti, khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānāti

meaning_1: not deteriorating; not decreasing; non-declining; non-regressing
example_1:
yo ve kilesāni pahāya pañca,

cetovasippatto samāhit'indriyo,

sbs_example_3: veditabbam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā, na parihāyāmi kusalehi dhammehi'. aparihānañ'h'etaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā'ti

example_1: ekaṃ ekakaṃ, dve dukā, tīṇi tikā, cattāri catukkā, pañca pañcakā, cha chakkā, satta sattakā, aṭṭha aṭṭhakā, nava navakā, dasa dasakā'ti, satam'pi mayaṃ, bho gotama, gaṇāpema, bhiyyo'pi gaṇāpema.
example_2: divasaṃsantatte ayokaṭāhe dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni nipāteyya
sbs_example_3: tattha katamo upādānapaccayā bhavo? bhavo du'vidhena, atthi kammabhavo, atthi upapattibhavo.
sbs_example_4: idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā
sbs_example_5: so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo

example_1:
tato malā malataraṃ,

example_2:
araññe rukkhamūle vā,
suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo,
anussaretha sambuddhaṃ,
bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.
sbs_example_3: tatra kho bhagavā pañcavagg'iye bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca.

example_1: yam'pi no saddhā gahapatikā divā vikāle paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā denti, tatra'p'ime mukh'āvaraṇaṃ maññe karontī'ti.
example_2:
papañ'ca udapānañ'ca,

meaning_1: by day and night; all day and night
example_1:

papañ'ca udapānañ'ca,
ye dadanti upassayaṃ,

tasmā hi bhūtā nisāmetha sabbe, mettaṃ karotha mānusiyā pajāya.
divā ca ratto ca haranti ye baliṃ, tasmā hi ne rakkhatha appamattā.

meaning_1: impermanent; inconstant; not lasting; discontinuous; disordered; unstable; unreliable; irregular
example_1: yaṃ rūpaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, ayaṃ rūpassa assādo. yaṃ rūpaṃ aniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, ayaṃ rūpassa ādīnavo.
example_2:

atha nibbindati dukkhe,

meaning_1: permanent; lasting; continuous; ordered; stable; reliable; regular; immutable
example_1:
buddho ce me varaṃ dajjā,
so ca labbhetha me varo,
gaṇhe'haṃ sabbalokassa,
niccaṃ kāyagataṃ satiṃ.
example_2: anicce, bhikkhave, niccan'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso. dukkhe, bhikkhave, sukhan'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso.

meaning_1: by wisdom; with intelligence; by understanding; with insight
example_1:
yāni sotāni lokasmiṃ,

sotānaṃ saṃvaraṃ brūmi,
paññāya-ete pidhiyyare.
example_2: te taṃ dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā tesaṃ dhammānaṃ paññāya atthaṃ na upaparikkhanti. tesaṃ te dhammā paññāya atthaṃ anupaparikkhataṃ na nijjhānaṃ khamanti.

atha nibbindati dukkhe, esa maggo visuddhiyā.

meaning_1: with him; by him; with that; by that
example_1: atha te, jarasakko amhe matte katvā mahāsamuddapiṭṭhe khipitvā amhākaṃ devanagaraṃ gaṇhi, te mayaṃ tena saddhiṃ yujjhitvā amhākaṃ devanagaram'eva gaṇhissāmā'ti kipillikā viya thambhaṃ sineruṃ anusañcaramānā uṭṭhahiṃsu.
example_2: sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.
sbs_example_3: so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā tathāgate saddhaṃ paṭilabhati. so tena saddhāpaṭilābhena samannāgato iti paṭisañcikkhati
sbs_example_4:
ajj'eva kiccam'ātappaṃ,
ko jaññā maraṇaṃ suve,
na hi no saṅgaraṃ tena,
mahāsenena maccunā.
sbs_example_5: ye tattha anumodanti, veyyāvaccaṃ karonti vā. na tena dakkhiṇā ūnā, te'pi puññassa bhāgino.

example_1:
uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha,
ko attho supitena vo,
āturānañ'hi kā niddā,
sallaviddhāna ruppataṃ.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā
sbs_example_3: so pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

meaning_1: monk; fully ordained monk; mendicant; lit. beggar
example_1:
kāmesu n'ābhigijjheyya,
manas'ānāvilo siyā,
kusalo sabbadhammānaṃ,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.
example_2: idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇ'ātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato hoti
sbs_example_4: puna caparaṃ bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ uddhaṃ pādatalā, adho kesamatthakā, tacapariyantaṃ pūraṃ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati
sbs_example_5: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā nisīdati, pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

commentary: (MNa) pabbajitā'ti upagatā, evaṃ sabbathā'pi anagāriyasaṅkhātaṃ pabbajjaṃ bhikkhubhāvaṃ vā upagatā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
example_1: atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ pukkusātiṃ etadavoca, kaṃ'si tvaṃ, bhikkhu, uddissa pabbajito? ko vā te satthā? kassa vā tvaṃ dhammaṃ rocesī'ti?
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇ'ātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato hoti
sbs_example_4: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā te sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti tesañ'ca sotabbaṃ maññissanti
sbs_example_5: alam'eva saddhāpabbajitena kulaputtena vīriyaṃ ārabhituṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: person with sight; who can see; lit. having eyes quality
example_1: so suṇeyya cakkhumato bhāsamānassa, chekaṃ vata, bho, odātaṃ vatthaṃ abhirūpaṃ nimmalaṃ sucī'ti!
example_2: cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti, evam'evaṃ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti.

example_1: atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ bāhāyaṃ gahetvā bahidvārakoṭṭhakā nikkhāmetvā sūcighaṭikaṃ datvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami
example_2: so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ bhoge vā naṅguṭṭhe vā gaṇheyya. tassa so alagaddo paṭiparivattitvā hatthe vā bāhāya vā aññatarasmiṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅge ḍaṃseyya.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, ānanda, balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya.
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ dve balavanto purisā nānābāhāsu gahetvā taṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ upakaḍḍheyyuṃ. atha kho tassa purisassa ārakā'v'assa cetanā ārakā patthanā ārakā paṇidhi.

meaning_1: strong; powerful; lit. having strength quality
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, balavā puriso dubbalataraṃ purisaṃ sīse vā gale vā khandhe vā gahetvā abhiniggaṇheyya abhinippīḷeyya abhisantāpeyya.
example_2: so vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ime pañca āvaraṇe nīvaraṇe cetaso ajjhāruhe paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe pahāya, balavatiyā paññāya att'atthaṃ vā ñassati par'atthaṃ vā ñassati ubhay'atthaṃ vā ñassati
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, ānanda, balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya.

example_1:
abhivādanasīlissa,
niccaṃ vuḍḍh'āpacāyino,
cattāro dhammā vaḍḍhanti,
āyu vaṇṇo sukhaṃ balaṃ.
example_2: katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ? cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ.
sbs_example_3: satta'p'āhaṃ bojjh'aṅge sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre. ko c'āhāro sattannaṃ bojjh'aṅgānaṃ? cattāro satipaṭṭhānā'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

example_1: bhārañ'ca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi bhārahārañ'ca bhār'ādānañ'ca bhāranikkhepanañ'ca. taṃ suṇātha. katamo ca, bhikkhave, bhāro?
example_2: ussādanañ'ca jaññā, apasādanañ'ca jaññā, ussādanañ'ca ñatvā apasādanañ'ca ñatvā n'ev'ussādeyya, na apasādeyya, dhammam'eva deseyya.
sbs_example_3: satta vo bhikkhave aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi. katame ca bhikkhave satta aparihāniyā dhammā?
sbs_example_4: sādhu me bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā ekā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpinī pahit'attā vihareyyan'ti
sbs_example_5: yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseyya, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, pācittiyaṃ.

example_1:
anicce niccasaññino,
dukkhe ca sukhasaññino,
anattani ca attā'ti,
asubhe subhasaññino,
micchādiṭṭhihatā sattā,
khittacittā visaññino.
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye manussesu paccājāyanti. atha kho ete'y'eva bahutarā sattā ye aññatra manussehi paccājāyanti.
sbs_example_3:
sabbe sattā sabbe pāṇā, sabbe bhūtā ca kevalā.
sabbe bhadrāni passantu, mā kiñci pāpam'āgamā.
sbs_example_4:

example_1:
hitvā ratiñ'ca aratiñ'ca,
sītibhūtaṃ nirūpadhiṃ,
sabbaloka-abhibhuṃ vīraṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
example_2:
abhibhū hi so anabhibhūto,
sakkhidhammam'anītiham'adassī,
tasmā hi tassa bhagavato sāsane,
appamatto sadā namassam'anusikkhe'ti.
sbs_example_3:
sabba-abhibhū sabbavidū'ham'asmi, sabbesu dhammesu anūpalitto,
sabbañ'jaho taṇhakkhaye vimutto, sayaṃ abhiññāya kam'uddiseyyaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
so'haṃ evaṃ viharanto, ñatvā dhammaṃ nirūpadhiṃ.
ārogye yobbanasmiñ'ca, jīvitasmiñ'ca ye madā.
sabbe made abhibho'smi, nekkhammaṃ daṭṭhu khemato

example_1:
tasmā have lokavidū sumedho,
lok'antagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
lokassa antaṃ samitāvi ñatvā,
n'āsiṃsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.
example_2:
okañ'jahaṃ taṇhacchidaṃ anejaṃ,
nandiñ'jahaṃ oghatiṇṇaṃ vimuttaṃ,
kappañ'jahaṃ abhiyāce sumedhaṃ,
sutvāna nāgassa apanamissanti ito.
sbs_example_3:
sabb'ābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ,
sabbesu dhammesu anūpalittaṃ,
sabbañ'jahaṃ taṇhākkhaye vimuttaṃ,

example_1: āraddhavīriyo viharati, kāmaṃ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsalohitaṃ, yaṃ taṃ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṃ, na taṃ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa saṇṭhānaṃ bhavissatī'ti.
example_2: yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ ākāsaṃ ākāsagataṃ, aghaṃ aghagataṃ, vivaraṃ vivaragataṃ, asamphuṭṭhaṃ maṃsalohitehi upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.

kāmaṃ kāmayamānassa,
tassa ce taṃ samijjhati,
addhā pītimano hoti,
laddhā macco yadicchati.
sbs_example_3:
kayirā ce, kayirāth'enaṃ, daḷham'enaṃ parakkame.
sithilo hi paribbājo, bhiyyo ākirate rajaṃ.
sbs_example_4: tatra ce so bhikkhu, pubbe appavārito, upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya
sbs_example_5: ettha ce n'atthi abhinanditabbaṃ abhivaditabbaṃ ajjhositabbaṃ. es'ev'anto rāg'ānusayānaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: venerable; reverend; lit. having age quality
example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu gāmagato vā araññagato vā labhati vattāraṃ, ayañ'ca kho āyasmā evaṃkārī evaṃsamācāro asucigāmakaṇṭako'ti.
example_2: ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?
sbs_example_3: karomi āyasmato okāsaṃ
sbs_example_4: atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etad'ahosi, acchariyaṃ vata bho, abbhutaṃ vata bho, mahā vatāyaṃ bhūmicālo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati
example_2:
n'atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa,
paññā n'atthi ajhāyato,
yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.
sbs_example_3:
karaṇīyam'atthakusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca,
sakko ujū ca suhujū ca, suvaco c'assa mudu, anatimānī.
sbs_example_4:
āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, yadā kāyaṃ jahant'imaṃ,
apaviddho tadā seti, parabhattaṃ acetanaṃ.
sbs_example_5: pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo ca.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary:
(VIN 2.5.1.7) viññū nāma purisaviggaho, paṭibalo hoti subhāsitadubbhāsitaṃ duṭṭhull'āduṭṭhullaṃ ājānituṃ.
(MNa) viññūnan'ti ... paṇḍitehi sabrahmacārīhi ca sambhāvito'ti attho.
example_1: evarūpaṃ te, rāhula, kāyakammaṃ satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu desetabbaṃ, vivaritabbaṃ, uttānīkātabbaṃ, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.
example_2: yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.
sbs_example_3: kacci nu kho maṃ anuvicca viññū sabrahmacārī sīlato na upavadantī'ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_3: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseyya, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, pācittiyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paccavekkhaṇā bahukārā hoti kusalesu dhammesu
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti
sbs_example_3: ime bhikkhave dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: mindful; fully present; attentive; lit. having memory quality
example_1: avitakkomhi avicāro ajjhattaṃ satimā sukhamasmī'ti pajānāti
example_2:
ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāy'ānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ
sbs_example_4: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti, upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit'esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya
example_2:
eso hi bhagavā buddho,
nadiṃ nerañjaraṃ pati,
sabbadukkhappahānāya,
dhammaṃ deseti pāṇinaṃ,
tass'āhaṃ santikaṃ gacchaṃ,
so me satthā bhavissati.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, sammukhā m'etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan'ti.
sbs_example_4:
udar'āvadehakaṃ bhutvā, sayant'uttānaseyyakā.
kathaṃ vattenti paṭibuddhā, yā kathā satthugarahitā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tasmā't'iha bhikkhave attadīpā viharatha
example_2: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
sbs_example_3: handadāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā, appamādena sampādetha. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā
sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā'ti? aniccaṃ, bhante.
sbs_chant_eng_4: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_5: satiñ'ca khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabb'atthikaṃ vadāmī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: timely; at the right moment; at a suitable time; at the proper time
example_1: kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ
example_2:
etesu dhammesu vineyya chandaṃ,
bhikkhu satimā suvimuttacitto,
kālena so sammā dhammaṃ parivīmaṃsamāno,
ekodibhūto vihane tamaṃ so'ti.
sbs_example_3:
gāravo ca nivāto ca, santuṭṭhi ca kataññutā.
kālena dhammassavanaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_4: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamat'āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī'ti.
sbs_example_5: kālena ca bhāsitā hoti, saccā ca bhāsitā hoti, saṇhā ca bhāsitā hoti, atthasaṃhitā ca bhāsitā hoti, mettacittena ca bhāsitā hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
mādisā ve jinā honti,
ye pattā āsavakkhayaṃ,
jitā me pāpakā dhammā,
tasm'āham'upaka jino'ti.
example_2: bhūtaṃ kho pana tacchaṃ tathaṃ paṭipadaṃ paññapentassa dhammaṭṭhitataṃ dhammaniyāmataṃ, kathañ'hi nāma mādiso viññū samaṇassa gotamassa subhāsitaṃ subhāsitato n'ābbhanumodeyyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: etadaggaṃ, bhagini, pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ, sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ, etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti, methun'ūpasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: virtuous; ethical; moral; lit. having conduct quality
commentary: (VIN 1.2.4) sīlavantan'ti pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirataṃ, adinn'ādānā paṭivirataṃ, musāvādā paṭivirataṃ.
example_1:
diṭṭhiñ'ca anupaggamma,
sīlavā dassanena sampanno,
kāmesu vineyya gedhaṃ,
na hi jātu gabbhaseyya punar'etī'ti.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
sbs_example_3: etad'aggaṃ, bhagini, pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ, sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ, etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti, methun'ūpasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.
sbs_example_4: evam'eva kho brāhmaṇa tathāgato purisadammaṃ labhitvā paṭhamaṃ evaṃ vineti, ehi tvaṃ bhikkhu sīlavā hohi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, phasso kho, āvuso, eko anto, phassasamudayo dutiyo anto, phassanirodho majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
example_2: idh'āhaṃ, bhante, yen'aññataro bhikkhu ten'upasaṅkamiṃ, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocaṃ, kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno dassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ hotī'ti?
sbs_example_3: ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā mahāpajāpatī gotamī bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca
sbs_example_4: tatra kho bhagavā pañcavaggiye bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etad'avoca.
sbs_chant_eng_4: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

notes: archaic form of etaṃ found in compounds and idiom
example_1:
etad'aññāya ye satā,
diṭṭhadhamm'ābhinibbutā,
na te māravas'ānugā,
na te mārassa paddhagū'ti.
example_2:
aññāt'atthaṃ pasād'atthaṃ,
sataṃ ve hoti mantanā,
evaṃ kho ariyā mantenti,
esā ariyāna mantanā,
etad'aññāya medhāvī,
na samusseyya mantaye'ti.
sbs_example_3: ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā mahāpajāpatī gotamī bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca
sbs_example_4: etad'aggaṃ paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṃ paññapentānaṃ yad'idaṃ channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: knowing the correct measure (in); knowing the limit (in); moderate (in); lit. measure knowing
example_1:
asubh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu susaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi ca mattaññuṃ,
saddhaṃ āraddhavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve nappasahati māro,
vāto selaṃ'va pabbataṃ.
example_2: bhojane mattaññuno bhavissāma paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ bhikkhu bhojane mattaññū hohi. paṭisankhā yoniso āhāraṃ āhāreyyāsi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
subh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu asaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi c'āmattaññuṃ,
kusītaṃ hīnavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve pasahati māro,
vāto rukkhaṃ'va dubbalaṃ.
example_2: acelako ce'pi, kassapa, hoti, mutt'ācāro, hatth'āpalekhano ... iti evarūpaṃ addhamāsikam'pi pariyāyabhattabhojana-anuyogam'anuyutto viharati.
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ bhikkhu bhojane mattaññū hohi. paṭisankhā yoniso āhāraṃ āhāreyyāsi
sbs_example_4: so bījagāmabhūtagāmasamārambhā paṭivirato hoti, ekabhattiko hoti ratt'ūparato virato vikālabhojanā

example_1: yato kho tvaṃ anuruddha ime aṭṭha mahāpurisavitakke vitakkessasi, tato tvaṃ anuruddha yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhissasi …
example_2: tam'enaṃ mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā jātam'eva naṃ saṅghāṭikaṃ kareyyuṃ, saṅghāṭikattam'eva samādapeyyuṃ, ehi tvaṃ, bhadramukha, saṅghāṭiko hohi, saṅghāṭikassa te sato saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena abhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīyissati
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti
sbs_example_4:
viseni'katvā pana ye caranti, diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,
tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra, yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.

example_1:
sānuṃ pabuddhaṃ vajjāsi,
yakkhānaṃ vacanaṃ idaṃ,
m'ākāsi pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
diṭṭhā vā ye ca adiṭṭhā, ye сa dūre vasanti avidūre
bhūtā vā sambhav'esī vā, sabbe sattā bhavantu sukhit'attā.
sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā'ti? aniccaṃ, bhante.
sbs_chant_eng_4: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_5:
araññe rukkhamūle vā,
suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo,
anussaretha sambuddhaṃ,
bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.

meaning_1: (object of the eye) form; material form; shape; sight; lit. form
example_1: andho hi, uttara, cakkhunā rūpaṃ na passati, badhiro sotena saddaṃ na suṇātī'ti
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā paṭikūlā honti
sbs_example_3: cakkhuṃ bhikkhave ādittaṃ, rūpā ādittā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ, cakkhusamphasso āditto.
sbs_example_4: cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti, evam'evaṃ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
sbs_example_5: idha yassa te honti aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā, ye vā panassa te honti anatthakāmā ahitakāmā aphāsukakāmā ayogakkhemakāmā

example_1:
passaṃ naro dakkhati nāmarūpaṃ,
disvāna vā ñassati tāni'm'eva,
kāmaṃ bahuṃ passatu appakaṃ vā,
na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.
example_2:
paṭisotagāmiṃ nipuṇaṃ,
gambhīraṃ duddasaṃ aṇuṃ,
rāgarattā na dakkhanti,
tamokhandhena āvuṭā'ti.
sbs_example_3: cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti, evam'evaṃ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
sbs_example_4: ye'pi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ taṃ aniccato dakkhissanti dukkhato dakkhissanti anattato dakkhissanti rogato dakkhissanti bhayato dakkhissanti, te taṇhaṃ pajahissanti.
sbs_example_5: suṇāti na vijānāti, āloketi na passati. dhammasmiṃ bhaññamānasmiṃ, atthaṃ bālo na bujjhati. sace'pi dasa pajjote, dhārayissasi, kassapa. n'eva dakkhati rūpāni, cakkhu hi'ssa na vijjatī'ti.

example_1:
ye diṭṭhim'uggayha vivādayanti,
idam'eva saccan'ti ca vādayanti,
te tvaṃ vadassū na hi te'dha atthi,
vādamhi jāte paṭisenikattā.
example_2: ye kho te, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhū sekkhā apattamānasā anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamānā viharanti tesu me ayaṃ evarūpī anusāsanī hoti.
sbs_example_3: bhikkhave, ye te mayā dhammā abhiññā desitā, te vo sādhukaṃ uggahetvā āsevitabbā bhāvetabbā bahulīkātabbā
sbs_example_4:
ye keci pāṇabhūt'atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,
dīghā vā ye mahantā vā, majjhimā rassak'āṇukathūlā.
sbs_example_5: ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ rūpaṃ abhiññāya ... rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā.

example_1:
dhammapīti sukhaṃ seti,
vippasannena cetasā,
ariyappavedite dhamme,
sadā ramati paṇḍito.
example_2:
suññato lokaṃ avekkhassu,
mogharāja sadā sato,
att'ānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhacca,
evaṃ maccutaro siyā,
evaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ,
maccurājā na passatī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
bhavatu sabbamaṅgalaṃ, rakkhantu sabbadevatā,
sabbadhamm'ānubhāvena, sadā sotthi bhavantu te
sbs_example_4:
papañ'ca udapānañ'ca,
ye dadanti upassayaṃ,
tesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati.
sbs_example_5:
kāmesu brahmacariyavā, vītataṇho sadā sato,
saṅkhāya nibbuto bhikkhu, tassa no santi iñjitā.

meaning_1: gets to; attains; finds; acquires; obtains; lit. arrives at
example_1:
sārañ'ca sārato ñatvā,
asārañ'ca asārato,
te sāraṃ adhigacchanti,
sammāsaṅkappagocarā.
example_2: so, bhogā me atthi uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā'ti adhigacchati sukhaṃ, adhigacchati somanassaṃ.
sbs_example_3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhānado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_4: appamattako so, bhikkhave, kaṭaggaho yaṃ so akkhadhutto paṭhamen'eva kaṭaggahena mahantaṃ bhogakkhandhaṃ adhigaccheyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: intelligent man; wise man; who has good judgment; lit. who has wisdom
example_1:
nidhīnaṃ'va pavattāraṃ,
yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ,
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ,
tādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
tādisaṃ bhajamānassa,
seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.
example_2:
anupubbena medhāvī,
thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malamattano.
sbs_example_3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhānado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.

example_1: dātā ca ahosi sukhumānaṃ mudukānaṃ attharaṇānaṃ pāvuraṇānaṃ khomasukhumānaṃ kappāsikasukhumānaṃ koseyyasukhumānaṃ kambalasukhumānaṃ
example_2:
sa pattapāṇi vicaranto,
amūgo mūgasammato,
appaṃ dānaṃ na hīḷeyya,
dātāraṃ n'āvajāniyā.
sbs_example_3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhānado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_4: so h'āvuso, bhagavā jānaṃ jānāti, passaṃ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto, vattā pavattā, atthassa ninnetā, amatassa dātā, dhammassāmī tathāgato.

example_1: tassa mayhaṃ āvuso, etadahosi, idha bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
example_2: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ. yaṃnūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti.
sbs_example_3: atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etad'ahosi, acchariyaṃ vata bho, abbhutaṃ vata bho, mahā vatāyaṃ bhūmicālo.
sbs_example_4: pubb'eva me, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattass'eva sato etad'ahosi
sbs_example_5: tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etad'ahosi, kimhi nu kho sati jarāmaraṇaṃ hoti, kiṃpaccayā jarāmaraṇan'ti ?

example_1: manussānaṃ piyo hoti, amanussānaṃ piyo hoti, devatā rakkhanti, n'āssa aggi vā visaṃ vā satthaṃ vā kamati, tuvaṭaṃ cittaṃ samādhiyati, mukhavaṇṇo vippasīdati
example_2:
anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.
sbs_example_3: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami
sbs_example_4: sukhaṃ supati, sukhaṃ paṭibujjhati, na pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passati, manussānaṃ ca amanussānaṃ piyo hoti, devatā rakkhanti
sbs_example_5: ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca, kathaṃ nu tvaṃ, mārisa, ogham'atarī'ti?

meaning_1: sage; intelligent person; wise man; smart person
commentary: (MNa) bāle ca paṇḍite cā'ti bālā ca paṇḍitā ca.
example_1:
selo yathā ekaghano,
vātena na samīrati,
evaṃ nindāpasaṃsāsu,
na samiñjanti paṇḍitā.
example_2:
yaṃ taṃ apucchimha akittayī no,
aññaṃ taṃ pucchāma tadiṅgha brūhi,
ettāvat'aggaṃ nu vadanti h'eke,
yakkhassa suddhiṃ idha paṇḍitāse,
udāhu aññam'pi vadanti etto.
sbs_example_3:
asevanā ca bālānaṃ, paṇḍitānañ'ca sevanā.
pūjā ca pūjanīyānaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
nidhīnaṃ'va pavattāraṃ, yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ,
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ, tādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
tādisaṃ bhajamānassa, seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.
sbs_example_5:
kalyāṇamittatā muninā, lokaṃ ādissa vaṇṇitā.
kalyāṇamitte bhajamāno, api bālo paṇḍito assa.
