meaning_1: Sublime One; Blessed One; Fortunate One; Auspicious One; epithet of the Buddha; lit. having good fortune quality
example_1:
anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.
example_2: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā
sbs_example_4: ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā mahāpajāpatī gotamī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca
sbs_example_5: evaṃsampadam'idaṃ āyasmantānaṃ satthari sammukhībhūte, taṃ bhagavantaṃ atisitvā, amhe etam'atthaṃ paṭipucchitabbaṃ maññatha.

example_1:
eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,
anissito no visahāmi tārituṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ brūhi samantacakkhu,
yaṃ nissito ogham'imaṃ tareyyaṃ.
example_2:
idh'eva suddhi iti vādayanti,
n'āññesu dhammesu visuddhim'āhu,
yaṃ nissitā tattha subhaṃ vadānā,
paccekasaccesu puthū niviṭṭhā.
sbs_example_3: appiyehi sampayogo dukkho, piyehi vippayogo dukkho, yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamat'āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī'ti.
sbs_example_5:
karaṇīyam'atthakusalena yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca,

example_1: idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā
example_2: rañño ālambananaṅgalaṃ rattasuvaṇṇaparikkhittaṃ hoti. balibaddānaṃ siṅgāni'pi rasmipatodā'pi suvaṇṇaparikkhittā honti.
sbs_example_3:
appassut'āyaṃ puriso, balibaddho'va jīrati,
maṃsāni tassa vaḍḍhanti, paññā tassa na vaḍḍhati.

example_1: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvitindriyassa upacchedo, idaṃ vuccati maraṇaṃ.
example_2:
aṭṭhīnaṃ nagaraṃ kataṃ,
maṃsalohitalepanaṃ,
yattha jarā ca maccu ca,
māno makkho ca ohito.
sbs_example_3:
ajj'eva kiccam'ātappaṃ,
ko jaññā maraṇaṃ suve,

example_1:
uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha,
ko attho supitena vo,
āturānañ'hi kā niddā,
sallaviddhāna ruppataṃ.
example_2: idha no, āvuso, ko viseso, ko adhippayāso, kiṃ nānākaraṇaṃ samaṇassa vā gotamassa amhākaṃ vā, yadidaṃ dhammadesanāya vā dhammadesanaṃ, anusāsaniyā vā anusāsanin'ti?
sbs_example_3: ajj'eva kiccam'ātappaṃ, ko jaññā maraṇaṃ suve. na hi no saṅgaran'tena, mahāsenena maccunā.
sbs_example_4: Ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yaṁ tiṭṭhateva nibbānaṁ, tiṭṭhati nibbānagāmī maggo, tiṭṭhati bhavaṁ gotamo samādapetā

meaning_1: effort; exertion; lit. to be burned
commentary:
(MNa) ātappāyā'ti kilesasantāpakavīriyakaraṇ'atthāya.
(MNa) ajj'eva kiccam'ātappan'ti kilesānaṃ ātāpanaparitāpanena ātappan'ti laddhanāmaṃ vīriyaṃ ajj'eva kātabbaṃ.
example_1:
tumhehi kiccam'ātappaṃ,
akkhātāro tathāgatā,
paṭipannā pamokkhanti,
jhāyino mārabandhanā.
example_2:
tenaha-atappaṃ karohi,

ito sutvāna nigghosaṃ,

example_1:
yogā ve jāyatī bhūri,
ayogā bhūrisaṅkhayo,
etaṃ dvedhāpathaṃ ñatvā,
bhavāya vibhavāya ca,
tath'āttānaṃ niveseyya,
yathā bhūri pavaḍḍhati.
example_2:
papañ'ca udapānañ'ca,
ye dadanti upassayaṃ,
tesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati.
sbs_example_3: aggasmiṃ dānaṃ dadataṃ, aggaṃ puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati. aggaṃ āyu ca vaṇṇo ca, yaso kitti sukhaṃ balaṃ.
sbs_example_4: ayoniso manasikaroto anuppannā c'eva āsavā uppajjanti, uppannā ca āsavā pavaḍḍhanti, yoniso ca kho, bhikkhave, manasikaroto anuppannā c'eva āsavā na uppajjanti, uppannā ca āsavā pahīyanti.

meaning_1: is completely freed (from); is totally liberated (from); escapes (from)
example_1:

attano sukham'icchati.
verasaṃsaggasaṃsaṭṭho,
verā so na parimuccati.

sbs_example_3: addhā imāya paṭipadāya jātijarābyādhimaraṇamhā parimuccissāmi

meaning_1: celibate man; who abstains from sexual intercourse
example_1: etadaggaṃ bhagini pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti methun'upasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.
example_2: idha ekacco dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asucisaṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakamm'anto assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño antopūti avassuto kasambujāto – antopūtibhāvo'ti.

example_1: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā te sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti tesañ'ca sotabbaṃ maññissanti
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, cakkhu niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā'ti? aniccaṃ, bhante.

meaning_1: whatever; any whatsoever; everything; all; all those
example_1:
dukkhassa ve maṃ pabhavaṃ apucchasi,
taṃ te pavakkhāmi yathā pajānaṃ,
upadhinidānā pabhavanti dukkhā,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.
example_2: ye hi keci, rāhula, atītam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyakammaṃ parisodhesuṃ, … sabbe te evam'evaṃ paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā kāyakammaṃ parisodhesuṃ
sbs_example_3:
ye keci pāṇabhūt'atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,

example_1: yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.
example_2: yasmiṃ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako sīlaṃ anussarati n'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti.

example_1:
sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.
example_2: yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭheyyuṃ, upanisīdeyyuṃ, upanipajjeyyuṃ.
sbs_example_3: yadā tumhe attanā'va jāneyyātha, ime dhammā kusalā, ime dhammā anavajjā, ime dhammā viññuppasatthā, ime dhammā samattā samādinnā hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantī'ti, atha tumhe upasampajja vihareyyātha.

meaning_1: what do you think about that?; what's your opinion on this?
example_1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim'atthiyo ādāso'ti? paccavekkhaṇattho, bhante'ti.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇaphalaṃ paritte udakamallake pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu taṃ parittaṃ udakaṃ amunā loṇaphalena loṇaṃ assa apeyyan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, cakkhu niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā'ti? aniccaṃ, bhante.
sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññasi ye te cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā adiṭṭhā adiṭṭhapubbā, na ca passasi, na ca te hoti passeyyan'ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā'ti?
sbs_example_5: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, api nu so puriso allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ, udake nikkhittaṃ, uttar'āraṇiṃ ādāya abhimanthento aggiṃ abhinibbatteyya, tejo pātukareyyā'ti?

meaning_1: just like; as if; imagine if

example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo tatra aggam'akkhāyati.

example_1: sabrahmakāni, bhikkhave, tāni kulāni yesaṃ puttānaṃ mātāpitaro ajjhāgāre pūjitā honti.
example_2: samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo akāmakānaṃ mātāpitūnaṃ assumukhānaṃ rudantānaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito

meaning_1: should be done; must be done; ought to be made; to be observed; lit. to be done
example_1: tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃ'y'eva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca karaṇīyaṃ.
example_2: ye pana te bhikkhū arahanto khīṇ'āsavā vusitavanto katakaraṇīyā ohitabhārā anuppattasadatthā parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojanā sammadaññā vimuttā tesaṃ ime dhammā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya c'eva saṃvattanti, satisampajaññāya cā'ti.

sbs_example_5: akusalaṃ idaṃ kāyakammaṃ dukkh'udrayaṃ dukkhavipākan'ti, evarūpaṃ te, rāhula, kāyena kammaṃ sasakkaṃ na karaṇīyaṃ.

example_1: tam'enaṃ tathāgato uttariṃ vineti, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī
example_2: yo'pi hetu yo'pi paccayo cakkhuviññāṇassa uppādāya, so'pi hetu so'pi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī. aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ cakkhuviññāṇaṃ kuto niccaṃ bhavissati!
sbs_example_3: cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, sotaviññāṇaṃ, ghānaviññāṇaṃ, jivhāviññāṇaṃ, kāyaviññāṇaṃ, manoviññāṇaṃ. idaṃ vuccati saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ.

example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, sace so puriso taṃ ādittaṃ tiṇ'ukkaṃ na khippam'eva paṭinissajjeyya tassa sā ādittā tiṇ'ukkā hatthaṃ vā daheyya bāhuṃ vā daheyya aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ daheyya

sbs_example_4: na bāhuppacālakaṃ antaraghare nisīdissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

meaning_1: then; also; and so; after that
example_1:
sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,

example_2: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama ... ye keci pupphagandhā, vassikaṃ tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati, evam'eva bhoto gotamassa ovādo param'ajjadhammesu.

sbs_example_5: no ca khv'assa evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti, ettakaṃ vata me ajja vāsijaṭassa khīṇaṃ, ettakaṃ hiyyo, ettakaṃ pare'ti. atha khv'assa khīṇe khīṇan'tv'eva ñāṇaṃ hoti.

example_1: tatra ce so bhikkhu pubbe appavārito upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya, sādhu vata maṃ āyasmā iminā cīvaracetāpannena evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādehī'ti
example_2: bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpeyya, tatra ce so bhikkhu pubbe appavārito tantavāye upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya

meaning_1: ordained long ago; of long standing as a monastic

meaning_1: good-natured; upright nature; of solid character; virtuous
commentary: (VIN 1.2.4) kalyāṇadhammo nāma tena ca sīlena tena ca brahmacariyena kalyāṇadhammo hoti.
example_1: etadaggaṃ bhagini pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti methun'upasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.
example_2: katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo? idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: gone to the forest; gone to the woods

example_2:

example_2: seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto āvilo luḷito kalalībhūto andhakāre nikkhitto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.

meaning_1: how then?; what then?; in what way?
commentary:
(VINa) kin'ti ... upāyapucchā.

example_1: so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin'ti me bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun'ti
example_2: evaṃ puṭṭhā tumhe, bhikkhave, tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ kin'ti byākareyyāthā'ti?

meaning_1: establishes; sets up; causes to be present; makes sure one has; lit. causes to stand near
example_1: no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ cittaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu anāghātaṃ, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā sabrahmacārīsu mettaṃ cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpehī'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro.

example_2: tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ, yā samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadā taṃ paṭipajjissāma. evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.

sabb'eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu, atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.

example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udak'aṇṇavaṃ, orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayaṃ, pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayaṃ.

meaning_1: may be; could be; should be

example_1:

meaning_1: home (of); dwelling (of); abode (of); lit. resting place
example_1:

meaning_1: suitable (for); proper (for); appropriate (for); lit. with same form

example_2: yāni ca kho tāni sikkhāpadāni ādibrahmacariyakāni brahmacariyasāruppāni tattha dhuvasīlo ca hoti ṭhitasīlo ca, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

meaning_1: because of that; on that account; for that reason; lit. from that reason

meaning_1: could do; would do; could make

kiṃ kayirā udapānena,

meaning_1: highest; most extreme; very best; ultimate; superior; sublime; lit. furthest
example_1: yo kho, ānanda, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī so tathāgataṃ sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti apaciyati paramāya pūjāya
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama ... ye keci pupphagandhā, vassikaṃ tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati, evam'eva bhoto gotamassa ovādo param'ajjadhammesu.
sbs_example_3: vanappagumbe yathā phussit'agge, gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe. tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi, nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya.

meaning_1: they should be; they may be; they would be; may they be

meaning_1: thereby; because of that; on that account; lit. by that; with that
example_1: tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃ'y'eva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca karaṇīyaṃ.

example_1:

meaning_1: wishing; wanting; covetousness; greed; lit. over thinking

example_1: so abhijjhaṃ loke pahāya vigat'ābhijjhena cetasā vihāsiṃ, abhijjhāya cittaṃ parisodhesiṃ.

meaning_1: could come; would come along; could approach; would arrive
example_1: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, āvuso, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ
example_2: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū paccattaññ'eva satiṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti, kin'ti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyun'ti
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.

example_1: puna caparaṃ, ānanda, bhikkhuno jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā uppajjati manāpaṃ uppajjati amanāpaṃ uppajjati manāp'āmanāpaṃ
example_2: jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā piyarūpe rase adhimuccati, appiyarūpe rase byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.
sbs_example_3: sotena saddaṃ sutvā … ghānena gandhaṃ ghāyitvā ... jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā … kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṃ phusitvā

commentary: (VINa) dutiyapadaṃ aññesaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ harantassa gacchato vasena
example_1:

aggi ḍahati nassati.

commentary: (VIN 1.1.2) rājāno nāma pathabyārājā padesarājā maṇḍalikā antarabhogikā akkhadassā mahāmattā, ye vā pana chejjabhejjaṃ karontā anusāsanti. ete rājāno nāma.
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya, yathārūpe adinn'ādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā
example_2: kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

meaning_1: could get; would experience; would come across; lit. could arrive at
example_1: evaṃ vutte āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, seyyathā'pi, bhante, puriso jighacchādubbalyapareto madhupiṇḍikaṃ adhigaccheyya, so yato yato sāyeyya, labheth'eva sādurasaṃ asecanakaṃ
example_2: na kho, āvuso gotama, sukhena sukhaṃ adhigantabbaṃ, dukkhena kho sukhaṃ adhigantabbaṃ. sukhena c'āvuso gotama, sukhaṃ adhigantabbaṃ abhavissa, rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro sukhaṃ adhigaccheyya, rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro sukhavihāritaro āyasmatā gotamenā'ti.
sbs_example_3: so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ
sbs_example_4: so tassa pattavaṭṭiṃ vinibbhujanto pheggum'pi na-adhigaccheyya, kuto sāraṃ!

example_1: man'indriyaṃ asaṃvutassa, bhikkhave, viharato cittaṃ byāsiñcati manoviññeyyesu dhammesu, tassa byāsittacittassa pāmojjaṃ na hoti. pāmojje asati pīti na hoti. pītiyā asati passaddhi na hoti. passaddhiyā asati dukkhaṃ hoti.
example_2: tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati, pāmojjaṃ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
sbs_example_3: so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ
sbs_example_4: tassa kismiñci'd'eva pasādanīye nimitte cittaṃ paṇidahato pāmojjaṃ jāyati. pamuditassa pīti jāyati. pītimanassa kāyo passambhati. passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedayati. sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.

example_1:

example_2:

meaning_1: I could be; I might be; may I be; I could become
example_1: so sace ākaṅkhati, anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhaveyyaṃ, eko'pi hutvā bahudhā assaṃ, bahudhā'pi hutvā eko assaṃ, āvibhāvaṃ tirobhāvaṃ
example_2: saddho ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti, no ca sīlavā. evaṃ so ten'aṅgena aparipūro hoti. tena taṃ aṅgaṃ paripūretabbaṃ, kin't'āhaṃ saddho ca assaṃ, sīlavā cā'ti!

meaning_1: grasping; holding (onto); clinging (to); taking possession (of); lit. taking near
notes: passive in form, active in meaning.
example_1: sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto vihareyyan'ti. upādiyamāno kho, bhikkhu, baddho mārassa, anupādiyamāno mutto pāpimato'ti.
example_2: ahañ'hi rūpaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, vedanaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saññaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saṅkhāreyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, viññāṇaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ.

commentary: (ANa) abhijjhāya cittaṃ parisodhetī'ti abhijjhāto cittaṃ parimoceti, yathā naṃ sā muñcati c'eva muñcitvā ca na puna gaṇhāti, evaṃ karotī'ti attho.
example_1: divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhessāma
example_2: ye'pi hi keci, rāhula, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyakammaṃ parisodhessanti … sabbe te evam'evaṃ paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā kāyakammaṃ parisodhessanti
sbs_example_3: so abhijjhaṃ loke pahāya vigat'ābhijjhena cetasā viharati, abhijjhāya cittaṃ parisodheti.

meaning_1: he would (think) thus; this would occur to him
example_1: tassā evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti.
example_2: tassa purisassa uttiṇṇassa pāraṅ'gatassa evam'assa, bahukāro kho me ayaṃ kullo, im'āhaṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttiṇṇo.
sbs_example_3: siyā kho pan'ānanda, tumhākaṃ evam'assa, atītasatthukaṃ pāvacanaṃ, n'atthi no satthā'ti.
sbs_example_4: tassa evam'assa, ayaṃ kho mahāudak'aṇṇavo, orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayaṃ, pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayaṃ, n'atthi ca nāvā santāraṇī uttarasetu vā apārā pāraṃ gamanāya.

meaning_1: even some; just some; some or other
example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso yamaka, gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo, so ca ārakkhasampanno. tassa koci'd'eva puriso uppajjeyya anatthakāmo ahitakāmo ayogakkhemakāmo jīvitā voropetu'kāmo.
example_2: siyā kho pana bhoto rañño mahāyaññaṃ yajamānassa koci'd'eva vippaṭisāro, mahā vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchatī'ti, so bhotā raññā vippaṭisāro na karaṇīyo
sbs_example_3: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya, dirattatirattaṃ tena bhikkhunā senāya vasitabbaṃ. tato ce uttariṃ vaseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo tena cīvarena vippavāsāya, chārattaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tena cīvarena vippavasitabbaṃ.
sbs_example_5: yathā, mahārāja, koci'd'eva puriso visaṃ abhisaṅkharitvā attanā ca piveyya, pare ca pāyeyya, so attanā'pi dukkhito bhaveyya, pare'pi dukkhitā bhaveyyuṃ.

meaning_1: is free (from); becomes free (from); is released (from)
example_1:
na antalikkhe na samuddamajjhe,
na pabbatānaṃ vivaraṃ pavissa,
na vijjatī so jagatippadeso,
yatthaṭṭhito mucceyya pāpakammā.
example_2:
ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,

tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi puriso ābādhiko assa dukkhito bāḷhagilāno, bhattañ'ca'ssa nacchādeyya, na c'assa kāye balamattā. so aparena samayena tamhā ābādhā mucceyya

meaning_1: (vinaya) ordination; renunciation; becoming a monastic; lit. exile
example_1: tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā, amhākañ'c'ev'āyaṃ pabbajjā avañjhā bhavissati saphalā saudrayā'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.
example_2: es'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca, labheyyāhaṃ bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadan'ti.

meaning_1: name of a forest outside Vesālī; lit. great forest
example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ
example_2: atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena mahāvanaṃ kūṭ'āgārasālā ten'upasaṅkami.

example_1:

meaning_1: as much as; only as much as; only as far as
example_1: kā upanisā savanāyā'ti iti ce, bhikkhave, pucchitāro assu, te evam'assu vacanīyā, yāva'd'eva dvayatānaṃ dhammānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇāyā'ti. kiñ'ca dvayataṃ vadetha?
example_2: bhojane mattaññuno bhavissāma paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya

meaning_1: does not tolerate; does not accept; does not endure

example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ ... byāpādavitakkaṃ ... vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ ... uppann'uppanne pāpake akusale dhamme n'ādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hantā hoti.

meaning_1: way of saying things; mode of expression; manner of speech
example_1: khamā bhavissāma sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīsapa-samphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ

example_2: appamattikā esā, bhikkhave, parihāni yadidaṃ bhogaparihāni. etaṃ patikiṭṭhaṃ, bhikkhave, parihānīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāparihānī'ti.

meaning_1: moreover; and so; but; or; however

example_2: samaṇā samaṇā'ti vo, bhikkhave, jano sañjānāti. tumhe ca pana, ke tumhe'ti puṭṭhā samānā, samaṇ'āmhā'ti paṭijānātha.

meaning_1: we could be; we may be; we might be; we should be
example_1: idha no, āvuso sāriputta, bhagavā kiṃvādī kim'akkhāyī, kathaṃ byākaramānā ca mayaṃ vuttavādino c'eva bhagavato assāma, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkheyyāma
example_2: yathā kathaṃ pana kho, kosiya, bhagavā saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttiṃ abhāsi? sādhu mayam'pi etissā kathāya bhāgino assāma savanāyā'ti.

example_2: idha cunda ekacco anabhijjhālu hoti. yaṃ taṃ parassa paravitt'ūpakaraṇaṃ taṃ anabhijjhitā hoti, aho vata yaṃ parassa taṃ mamassā'ti

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya, yathārūpe adinn'ādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā

meaning_1: with mind; by mind; with thought; with intention
example_1:

vippasannena cetasā,

sadā ramati paṇḍito.
example_2: so mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.

commentary: (ANa) phāsuṃ'y'evā'ti iminā arahattaṃ dasseti. arahattappatto hi sabb'iriyāpathesu phāsu viharati nāma.
example_1: yaṃnūna mayaṃ yena gosiṅgasālavanadāyo ten'upasaṅkameyyāma. tattha mayaṃ appasaddā app'ākiṇṇā phāsuṃ vihareyyāmā'ti.
example_2: yena yen'eva gagghasi phāsuṃ'y'eva gagghasi, yattha yattha ṭhassasi phāsuṃ'y'eva ṭhassasi, yattha yattha nisīdissasi phāsuṃ'y'eva nisīdissasi, yattha yattha seyyaṃ kappessasi phāsuṃ'y'eva seyyaṃ kappessasī'ti.

meaning_1: looking for; searching for; on a quest for
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso alagaddatthiko alagaddagavesī alagaddapariyesanaṃ caramāno. so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ bhoge vā naṅguṭṭhe vā gaṇheyya.
example_2: atha puriso āgaccheyya phal'atthiko phalagavesī phalapariyesanaṃ caramāno. so taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ ajjhogāhetvā taṃ rukkhaṃ passeyya sampannaphalañ'ca upapannaphalañ'ca.

meaning_1: is not; it is not; there is not; there is no; there is nothing
example_1:

yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.
example_2: atthi, bhikkhave, dakkhiṇesu janapadesu dhovanaṃ nāma. tattha hoti annam'pi pānam'pi khajjam'pi bhojjam'pi leyyam'pi peyyam'pi naccam'pi gītam'pi vāditam'pi. atth'etaṃ, bhikkhave, dhovanaṃ, n'etaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

meaning_1: in the future; lit. future time
example_1: bhavissāmi nu kho ahaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ? na nu kho bhavissāmi anāgatam'addhānaṃ? kiṃ nu kho bhavissāmi anāgatam'addhānaṃ? kathaṃ nu kho bhavissāmi anāgatam'addhānaṃ? kiṃ hutvā kiṃ bhavissāmi nu kho ahaṃ anāgatam'addhānan'ti?
example_2: ye'pi hi keci, rāhula, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyakammaṃ parisodhessanti … sabbe te evam'evaṃ paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā kāyakammaṃ parisodhessanti
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti? idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
sbs_example_4: ye'pi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ taṃ aniccato dakkhissanti dukkhato dakkhissanti anattato dakkhissanti rogato dakkhissanti bhayato dakkhissanti, te taṇhaṃ pajahissanti.

example_1: evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu bhikkhusaṅghaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandho hoti, aham'pi bhikkhu, aham'pi bhikkhū'ti.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa appamattakam'pi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tam'enaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti? idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
sbs_example_4: tādisikāya āpattiyā ekaccaṃ pabbājenti ekaccaṃ na pabbājentī'ti, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo
sbs_example_5: idha ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

meaning_1: here; in this regard; in this case
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāy'ānupassī viharati
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti, caṇḍālakule vā venakule vā nesādakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde app'annapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati.
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti? idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
sbs_example_4:
tiṭṭhaṃ, caraṃ, nisinno vā, sayāno vā, yāvatā'ssa vigatamiddho,

example_1: avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ
example_2:
yassa darathajā na santi keci,
oraṃ āgamanāya paccayāse,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.
sbs_example_3: jhānapaccayo, maggapaccayo, sampayuttapaccayo, vippayuttapaccayo, atthipaccayo, n'atthipaccayo, vigatapaccayo, avigatapaccayo.
sbs_example_4: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya, dirattatirattaṃ tena bhikkhunā senāya vasitabbaṃ. tato ce uttariṃ vaseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_5: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo tena cīvarena vippavāsāya, chārattaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tena cīvarena vippavasitabbaṃ.

meaning_1: polite; pleasant; charming; (comm) fit to be remembered; lit. to be desired
commentary:
(MNa) sāraṇīyā'ti saritabbayuttā addhāne atikkante'pi na pamussitabbā.
(SNa) saritabbabhāvato ca sāraṇīyaṃ.
(ANa) sāraṇīyā'ti saritabbayuttakā.
notes: see PED for discussion on disputed etymology
example_1: sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā daṇḍam'olubbha ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi
example_2: cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattanti.
sbs_example_3: ime ce tumhe, ānanda, cha sāraṇīye dhamme samādāya vatteyyātha, passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?

example_1: yato tumhe, bhikkhave, indriyesu guttadvārā viharissatha, atha tumhehipi māro pāpimā nibbijja pakkamissati, otāraṃ alabhamāno, kummamhāva siṅgālo'ti.
example_2: samaṇā samaṇā'ti vo, bhikkhave, jano sañjānāti. tumhe ca pana, ke tumhe'ti puṭṭhā samānā, samaṇ'āmhā'ti paṭijānātha.
sbs_example_3: ime ce tumhe, ānanda, cha sāraṇīye dhamme samādāya vatteyyātha, passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?

ese'va maggo natth'añño, dassanassa visuddhiyā,
etañ'hi tumhe paṭipajjatha, mārass'etaṃ pamohanaṃ.
sbs_example_5: tumhe'pi tena ādissā bhaveyyātha, āmisadāy'ādā satthusāvakā viharanti, no dhammadāy'ādā'ti

meaning_1: thrown away; discarded; abandoned; disposed of
example_1: puna caparaṃ bhikkhave bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ ek'āhamataṃ vā dvī'hamataṃ vā tī'hamataṃ vā uddhumātakaṃ vinīlakaṃ vipubbakajātaṃ
example_2: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ udak'āvasesaṃ chaḍḍetvā āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, passasi no tvaṃ, rāhula, parittaṃ udak'āvasesaṃ chaḍḍitan'ti? evaṃ, bhante

imañ'ca kāyaṃ ārabbha, bhūripaññena desitaṃ,

meaning_1: face to face (with); in front (of); in the presence (of); lit. with face
example_1: kiṃ nu kho mayaṃ āyasmato anuruddhassa evam'ārocimha, imāsañ'ca imāsañ'ca vihārasamāpattīnaṃ mayaṃ lābhino'ti yaṃ no āyasmā anuruddho bhagavato sammukhā yāva āsavānaṃ khayā pakāsetī'ti?
example_2: tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi koci sammukhā avaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, sammukhā m'etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan'ti.
sbs_example_4: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ sammukhā sāruppāya gāthāya abhitthaveyyan'ti.
sbs_example_5: yañ'ca kho jaññā sammukhā khīṇavādaṃ bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ tatra kālaññū assa tassa sammukhā khīṇavādassa vacanāya

meaning_1: female disciple; laywomen; female devotee; lit. sitting near
commentary: (VIN 1.3.1) upāsikā nāma buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā.
example_1: yo kho, ānanda, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī so tathāgataṃ sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti apaciyati paramāya pūjāya.
example_2:
saddhāya sīlena ca yā'dha vaḍḍhati,
paññāya cāgena sutena c'ūbhayaṃ,
sā tādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
ādīyati sāram'idh'eva attano'ti.

sbs_example_5: yañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhave, cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvaraṃ asaṃvutassa viharato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvaraṃ saṃvutassa viharato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti

meaning_1: pleased; happy; delighted; satisfied; lit. own mind
example_1:

saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
abhibhuyya sabbāni parissayāni,
careyya tena-attamano satīmā.
example_2: purimen'ev'āhaṃ, bhante, opammena bhagavato attamano abhiraddho. api c'āhaṃ imāni bhagavato vicitrāni pañhapaṭibhānāni sotu'kāmo, ev'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ paccanīkaṃ kātabbaṃ amaññissaṃ

ñāṇ'ūpapannaṃ no muniṃ vadanti,
udāhu ve jīviten'ūpapannaṃ.

meaning_1: building with a peaked roof; lit. peaked building
example_1: seyyathā'pi nāma gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā kūṭ'āgāraṃ ullitt'āvalittaṃ nivātaṃ phusit'aggaḷaṃ pihitavātapānaṃ
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kūṭ'āgāre vā kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ vā pācīnavātapānā sūriye uggacchante vātapānena rasmi pavisitvā kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan'ti.

commentary: (SNa) pavivitto'ti kāyaviveko ca vivekaṭṭhakāyānaṃ nekkhamm'ābhiratānaṃ, cittaviveko ca parisuddhacittānaṃ paramavodānappattānaṃ, upadhiviveko ca nirupadhīnaṃ puggalānaṃ visaṅkhāragatānan'ti, imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ vivekānaṃ lābhī.

example_2: nibbedhikapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. app'iccho, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. santuṭṭho, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. pavivitto, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. asaṃsaṭṭho, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.
sbs_example_3: āraddhavīriyo ca kho, bhikkhave, sukhaṃ viharati pavivitto pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañ'ca sadatthaṃ paripūreti.

sbs_example_5: tatra bhikkhu vivekaninnena cittena vivekapoṇena vivekapabbhārena vivekaṭṭhena nekkhamm'ābhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttaṃy'eva kathaṃ kattā hoti. pavivittassa-ayaṃ

meaning_1: for you all; to you all
example_1: siyā kho pana bhikkhave tumhākaṃ evam'assa
example_2:

bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.

example_1: alaṃ, vakkali, kiṃ te iminā pūtikāyena diṭṭhena? yo kho, vakkali, dhammaṃ passati so maṃ passati, yo maṃ passati so dhammaṃ passati
example_2:
yo ve avidvā upadhiṃ karoti,
punappunaṃ dukkham'upeti mando,
tasmā pajānaṃ upadhiṃ na kayirā,
dukkhassa jātippabhav'ānupassī.
sbs_example_3: yo vo, ānanda, mayā dhammo ca vinayo ca desito paññatto, so vo mam'accayena satthā.

meaning_1: a monk who; but whichever monk
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu yāvatatiyaṃ anusāviyamāne saramāno santiṃ āpattiṃ n'āvikareyya, sampajānamusāvād'assa hoti.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno sikkhaṃ appaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pi, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

meaning_1: what if I were to; let me; I shall; perhaps I
example_1: tassā evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti.
example_2: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ saṃkaḍḍhitvā, kullaṃ bandhitvā, taṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttareyyan'ti.

sbs_example_5: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ yathābhūtaṃ yathābhūtassa me taṃ bhayabheravaṃ āgacchati, tathābhūtaṃ tathābhūtova taṃ bhayabheravaṃ paṭivineyyan'ti

example_1: ye kho te, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhū sekkhā apattamānasā anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamānā viharanti tesu me ayaṃ evarūpī anusāsanī hoti.
example_2: yesañ'ca mayaṃ cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāma, tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā
sbs_example_3: te tāvataken'eva attamanā assu, alam'ettāvatā, katam'ettāvatā, anuppatto no sāmaññ'attho, n'atthi no kiñci uttarikaraṇīyan'ti.
sbs_example_4: att'ūpamā hi te sattā, attā hi paramo piyo, hanti kuddho puthu'ttānaṃ, nānārūpesu mucchito.
sbs_example_5: te ce me evaṃ puṭṭhā, āmā'ti paṭijānanti, ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ jānaṃ passaṃ viharathā'ti? iti puṭṭhā, no'ti vadanti.

example_1: app'eva nāma mayaṃ kadāci karahaci tena bhotā gotamena samāgaccheyyāma? app'eva nāma siyā koci'd'eva kathāsallāpo'ti!

meaning_1: subject to death; liable to die; of the nature to die; lit. death nature
example_1: maraṇadhammo'mhi, maraṇaṃ anatīto'ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
example_2: maraṇadhammaṃ mā mīyī'ti n'atthi koci pāṭibhogo, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ
sbs_example_3: maraṇadhammānaṃ sattānaṃ evaṃ icchā uppajjati aho vata mayaṃ na maraṇadhammā assāma, na ca vata no maraṇaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ icchāya pattabbaṃ, idam'pi yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ

example_1: mā, bhikkhave, viggāhikakathaṃ katheyyātha, na tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāsi, ahaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāmi. kiṃ tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānissasi!
example_2:
kiṃ kayirā udapānena,
āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ,
taṇhāya mūlato chetvā,

example_1:

udare saññato siyā.
example_2:
muhuttam'api ce viññū,

sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa, kupito anattamano, pahāraṃ dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato … dantehi'pi kammaṃ karoti, naṅguṭṭhena'pi kammaṃ karoti, rakkhat'eva soṇḍaṃ.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato rakkhati purimaṃ kāyaṃ, rakkhati pacchimaṃ kāyaṃ, rakkhati purime pāde, rakkhati pacchime pāde, rakkhati sīsaṃ, rakkhati kaṇṇe, rakkhati dante, rakkhati soṇḍaṃ, rakkhati vāladhiṃ, rakkhati hatth'āruhaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo rakkhitā hoti.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu aṭṭhimayaṃ vā dantamayaṃ vā visāṇamayaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ kārāpeyya, bhedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

example_1:
anejassa vijānato,
n'atthi kāci nisaṅkhati,
virato so viyārabbhā,
khemaṃ passati sabbadhi.
example_2:
sabbaṃ lokaṃ abhiññāya,
sambuddhena pajānatā,
vivaṭaṃ amatadvāraṃ,
khemaṃ nibbānapattiyā.
sbs_example_3: yo cakkhumā mohamal'āpakaṭṭho, sāmaṃ va buddho sugato vimutto, mārassa pāsā vinimocayanto, pāpesi khemaṃ janataṃ vineyyaṃ
sbs_example_4: ye kho te, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhū sekkhā apattamānasā anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamānā viharanti tesu me ayaṃ evarūpī anusāsanī hoti.

example_1: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekanikāyam'pi samanupassāmi evaṃ cittaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā, te'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā citten'eva cittitā, tehi'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatehi pāṇehi cittaññ'eva cittataraṃ.
example_2:
pāṇaṃ na haññe na c'adinnam'ādiye,
musā na bhāse na ca majjapo siyā,
abrahmacariyā virameyya methunā,
rattiṃ na bhuñjeyya vikālabhojanaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
ye keci pāṇabhūt'atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,
dīghā vā ye mahantā vā, majjhimā rassak'āṇukathūlā.
sbs_example_4: evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi
sbs_example_5:
sabbe sattā sabbe pāṇā, sabbe bhūtā ca kevalā.
sabbe bhadrāni passantu, mā kiñci pāpam'āgamā.

meaning_1: state of existence; form of becoming
example_1: kati pan'āvuso, bhavā'ti? tayo'me, āvuso, bhavā, kāmabhavo, rūpabhavo, arūpabhavo'ti.
example_2:
passāmi loke pariphandamānaṃ,
pajaṃ imaṃ taṇhagataṃ bhavesu,
hīnā narā maccumukhe lapanti,
avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.
sbs_example_3:
ye ariyasaccāni vibhāvayanti, gambhīrapaññena sudesitāni.
kiñ'c'āpi te honti bhusaṃ pamattā, na te bhavaṃ aṭṭhamam'ādiyanti.

notes: (MW) misfortune, want of luck in dice
example_1: na tāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno idh'ekacce ādīnavā saṃvijjanti yāva na ñatt'ajjhāpanno hoti yasappatto. yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ñatt'ajjhāpanno hoti yasappatto, ath'assa idh'ekacce ādīnavā saṃvijjanti.
example_2:
kāmā hi citrā madhurā manoramā, virūparūpena mathenti cittaṃ.
ādīnavaṃ kāmaguṇesu disvā, tasmā ahaṃ pabbajito'mhi rāja.
sbs_example_3: yāvakīvañ'c'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ evaṃ assādañ'ca assādato ādīnavañ'ca ādīnavato nissaraṇañ'ca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṃ n'ābbhaññāsiṃ
sbs_example_4: no ce'daṃ, bhikkhave, rūpassa ādīnavo abhavissa na'y'idaṃ sattā rūpasmiṃ nibbindeyyuṃ. yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi rūpassa ādīnavo, tasmā sattā rūpasmiṃ nibbindanti.

example_1: yato kho, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti
example_2: yaṃ rūpaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, ayaṃ rūpassa assādo. yaṃ rūpaṃ aniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, ayaṃ rūpassa ādīnavo.
sbs_example_3: yāvakīvañ'c'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ evaṃ assādañ'ca assādato ādīnavañ'ca ādīnavato nissaraṇañ'ca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṃ n'ābbhaññāsiṃ

example_1:
sukhaṃ yāva jarā sīlaṃ,
sukhā saddhā patiṭṭhitā,
sukho paññāya paṭilābho,
pāpānaṃ akaraṇaṃ sukhaṃ.
example_2: so mah'iccho samāno vighātavā asantuṭṭho itarītara-cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārena pāpikaṃ icchaṃ paṇidahati anavaññappaṭilābhāya lābhasakkārasilokappaṭilābhāya
sbs_example_3: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhi tamhi sattanikāye jāti sañjāti okkanti abhinibbatti khandhānaṃ pātubhāvo āyatanānaṃ paṭilābho, ayaṃ vuccati jāti.
sbs_example_4: cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ lok'āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato
sbs_example_5: ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.

meaning_1: man; mortal man; lit. to be killed
example_1:
accayanti ahorattā,
jīvitaṃ uparujjhati,
āyu khīyati maccānaṃ,
kunnadīnaṃ'va odakaṃ.
example_2:
ubho puññañ'ca pāpañ'ca,
yaṃ macco kurute idha,
tañ'hi tassa sakaṃ hoti,
tañ'ca ādāya gacchati,
tañ'c'assa anugaṃ hoti,
chāyā'va anapāyinī.
sbs_example_3:
yathā'pi puppharāsimhā, kayirā mālāguṇe bahū,
evaṃ jātena maccena, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ bahuṃ.
sbs_example_4:
na naggacariyā na jaṭā na paṅkā, n'ānāsakā thaṇḍilasāyikā vā,
rajojallaṃ ukkuṭikappadhānaṃ, sodhenti maccaṃ avitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ.

example_1:
ehi sārathi gacchāhi,
rathaṃ niyyādayāh'imaṃ,
ārogyaṃ brāhmaṇiṃ vajja,
pabbaji dāni brāhmaṇo,
sujāto tīhi rattīhi,
tisso vijjā aphassayi.
example_2: yānaṃ nāma vayhaṃ ratho sakaṭaṃ sandamānikā sivikā pāṭaṅkī.
sbs_example_3:
yathā hi aṅgasambhārā, hoti saddo ratho iti.
evaṃ khandhesu santesu, hoti satto'ti sammuti
sbs_example_4: jīno rath'assaṃ maṇikuṇḍale ca, putte ca dāre ca tath'eva jīno.

example_1:
subh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu asaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi c'āmattaññuṃ,
kusītaṃ hīnavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve pasahati māro,
vāto rukkhaṃ'va dubbalaṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pathaviyā lekhā khippaṃ lujjati vātena vā udakena vā, na ciraṭṭhitikā hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco puggalo abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati. so ca khv'assa kodho na dīgharattaṃ anuseti.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
sbs_example_4: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā yāguyā. katame pañca? khuddaṃ paṭihanati, pipāsaṃ paṭivineti, vātaṃ anulometi, vatthiṃ sodheti, ām'āvasesaṃ pāceti. ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ānisaṃsā yāguyā'ti.
sbs_example_5:
sītañ'ca uṇhañ'ca khudaṃ pipāsaṃ, vāt'ātape ḍaṃsasarīsape ca.
sabbāni'p'etāni abhisambhavitvā, eko care khaggavisāṇakappo.

example_1:
migo yathā seri sucittakānane,
rammaṃ giriṃ pāvus'ābbhamāliniṃ,
anākule tattha nage ramissaṃ,
asaṃsayaṃ citta parābhavissasi.
example_2: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati suṃsumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye
sbs_example_3: yassa passena migo palāyati, tass'eva gīvā'ti

example_1:
uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha,
ko attho supitena vo,
āturānañ'hi kā niddā,
sallaviddhāna ruppataṃ.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim'atthiyo ādāso'ti? paccavekkhaṇ'attho, bhante'ti.
sbs_example_3: yassa khv'āhaṃ atthāya cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ so me attho abhinipphanno.
sbs_example_4: ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā assaddhā jīvik'atthā na saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitā saṭhā māyāvino ketabino uddhatā unnaḷā capalā ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

example_1:
viññāṇassa nirodhena,
taṇhākkhayavimuttino,
pajjotass'eva nibbānaṃ,
vimokkho hoti cetaso'ti.
example_2:
yasmiṃ kāmā na vasanti,
taṇhā yassa na vijjati,
kathaṃkathā ca yo tiṇṇo,
vimokkho tassa n'āparo.
sbs_example_3:
yass'āsavā parikkhīṇā, āhāre ca anissito,
suññato animitto ca, vimokkho yassa gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ, padaṃ tassa durannayaṃ.
sbs_example_4: channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ viditvā anupādā vimokkho.

example_1:
na vedanaṃ vedayati sapañño,
sukham'pi dukkham'pi bahussuto'pi,
ayañ'ca dhīrassa puthujjanena,
mahā viseso kusalassa hoti.
example_2: idha no, āvuso, ko viseso, ko adhippayāso, kiṃ nānākaraṇaṃ samaṇassa vā gotamassa amhākaṃ vā, yadidaṃ dhammadesanāya vā dhammadesanaṃ, anusāsaniyā vā anusāsanin'ti?
sbs_example_3: yañ'ca khv'assa tatra sappi vā telaṃ vā taṃ uddhagāmi assa visesagāmi.

example_1: atthi nu kho bhante kiñci rūpaṃ yaṃ rūpaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati
example_2:
gāth'ābhigītaṃ me abhojaneyyaṃ,
sampassataṃ brāhmaṇa n'esa dhammo,
gāth'ābhigītaṃ panudanti buddhā,
dhamme satī brāhmaṇa vutti'r'esā.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ pan'āniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ, etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti?

example_1:
āyuṃ arogiyaṃ vaṇṇaṃ,
saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ,
ratiyo patthayantena,
uḷārā apar'āparā.
example_2: brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udak'orohakā aggiparicārakā. te mataṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.
sbs_example_3:
yaṃ kiñci vittaṃ idha vā huraṃ vā, saggesu vā yaṃ ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ.
na no samaṃ atthi tathāgatena
sbs_example_4:
sīlaṃ rakkheyya medhāvī,

pasaṃsaṃ vittalābhañ'ca,

example_1:
māse māse kus'aggena,
bālo bhuñjeyya bhojanaṃ,
na so saṅkhātadhammānaṃ,
kalaṃ agghati soḷasiṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ṭhite majjh'anhike kāle marīcikā phandati.
sbs_example_3: vanappagumbe yathā phussit'agge, gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe. tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi, nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vassānaṃ pacchime māse saradasamaye kiṭṭhasambādhe gopālako gāvo rakkheyya. so tā gāvo tato tato daṇḍena ākoṭeyya paṭikoṭeyya sannirundheyya sannivāreyya.

meaning_1: (any sharp pointed object which causes pain) arrow; spike; dagger; dart; barb
example_1:
pamādo rajo pamādo,
pamād'ānupatito rajo,
appamādena vijjāya,
abbahe sallam'attano'ti.
example_2: ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekaccassa bhikkhuno evam'assa, taṇhā kho sallaṃ samaṇena vuttaṃ, avijjāvisadoso, chandarāgabyāpādena ruppati.

example_1:

example_2: vadho h'eso, kesi, ariyassa vinaye, yaṃ na tathāgato vattabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññati, n'āpi viññū sabrahmacārī vattabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññantī'ti.

meaning_1: effort; exertion; undertaking; task; lit. yoking
example_1:

atthaṃ hitvā piyaggāhī,
pihet'att'ānuyoginaṃ.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, idaṃ dukkhan'ti yogo karaṇīyo, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti yogo karaṇīyo, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho'ti yogo karaṇīyo, ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā'ti yogo karaṇīyo'ti.

example_1:

navena toyena sacīvaraṃ vane,
isippayātamhi pathe vajantaṃ,
ovassate taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.
example_2: na uppathena gacchanto pathena gacchantassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

sbs_example_5: seyyathā'pi dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā gāviṃ vadhitvā catumahāpathe bilaso vibhajitvā nisinno assa.

meaning_1: turn; detour; roundabout way; lit. going around
example_1: etu kho, bhante, bhagavā. svāgataṃ, bhante, bhagavato. cirassaṃ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṃ pariyāyam'akāsi, yadidaṃ idh'āgamanāya
example_2: ehi kho, mārisa, svāgataṃ, mārisa! cirassaṃ kho, mārisa, imaṃ pariyāyam'akāsi yadidaṃ idh'āgamanāya.
sbs_example_3: tividh'āhaṃ kammānaṃ vipākaṃ vadāmi, diṭṭh'eva dhamme, upapajjaṃ vā, apare vā pariyāye. ayaṃ vuccati kammānaṃ vipāko.

example_1: atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yena so vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno ālindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā bahu'd'eva rattiṃ abbhokāse nisajjāya vītināmetvā pāde pakkhāletvā vihāraṃ pāvisi. āyasmā'pi kho soṇo bahu'd'eva rattiṃ abbhokāse nisajjāya vītināmetvā pāde pakkhāletvā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
sbs_example_3:

sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_5: yaṃ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṃkhittena uddesaṃ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṃ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā vihāraṃ paviṭṭho

example_1: imesaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, samaṇamalānaṃ samaṇadosānaṃ samaṇakasaṭānaṃ āpāyikānaṃ ṭhānānaṃ duggativedaniyānaṃ appahānā, na samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadaṃ paṭipanno'ti vadāmi.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.
example_2: kiṃ nu kho me ayyā santaṃ'y'eva nu kho ajjhattaṃ kopaṃ na pātukaroti udāhu asantaṃ udāhu mayham'ev'ete kammantā susaṃvihitā yena me ayyā santaṃ'y'eva ajjhattaṃ kopaṃ na pātukaroti, no asantaṃ?
sbs_example_3: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ, tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.
example_2: alaṃ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi nanu etaṃ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacc'eva akkhātaṃ sabbeh'eva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo
sbs_example_3: sabbehi me piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo
sbs_example_4: cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattanti.
sbs_example_5: uppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ṭhitiyā asammosāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yassa loke sakaṃ n'atthi,
asatā ca na socati,
dhammesu ca na gacchati,
sa ve santo'ti vuccatī'ti.
example_2: manasā dhammaṃ viññāya piyarūpe dhamme adhimuccati, appiyarūpe dhamme byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.
sbs_example_3: rūpataṇhā, saddataṇhā, gandhataṇhā, rasataṇhā, phoṭṭhabbataṇhā, dhammataṇhā. ayaṃ vuccati vedanāpaccayā taṇhā.
sbs_example_4: manasā dhammaṃ viññāya mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī.

example_1:
nanu dubbhissasi maṃ punappunaṃ,
muhuṃ muhuṃ cāraṇikaṃ'va dassayaṃ,
ummattaken'eva mayā palobhasi,
kiñ'c'āpi te citta virādhitaṃ mayā.
example_2: saññasaññino vuccanti ye pakatisaññāya ṭhitā, na'pi so pakatisaññāya ṭhito. visaññasaññino vuccanti ummattakā ye ca khittacittā, na'pi so ummattako, no'pi khittacitto'ti.
sbs_example_3: ruṇṇam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yad'idaṃ gītaṃ. ummattakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yad'idaṃ naccaṃ.

example_1:
vivekaññ'eva sikkhetha,
etadariyānam'uttamaṃ,
na tena seṭṭho maññetha,
sa ve nibbānasantike.
example_2: idha, gahapati, sutavā ariyasāvako ariyānaṃ dassāvī ariyadhammassa kovido ariyadhamme suvinīto sappurisānaṃ dassāvī sappurisadhammassa kovido sappurisadhamme suvinīto na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati
sbs_example_3: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti, upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

commentary: (VIN 1.2.10) bhedāya parakkameyyā'ti, kathaṃ ime nānā assu, vinā assu, vaggā assū'ti pakkhaṃ pariyesati, gaṇaṃ bandhati.
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkameyya, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha tiṭṭheyya, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo
example_2: sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññam'aññaṃ kāressāma, siyā'pi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
sbs_example_3: pisuṇaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: balavā puriso jivh'agge kheḷapiṇḍaṃ saṃyūhitvā appakasirena vameyya
example_2: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.
sbs_example_3:
pheṇapiṇḍ'ūpamaṃ rūpaṃ, vedanā bubbuḷ'ūpamā.
marīcik'ūpamā saññā, saṅkhārā kadal'ūpamā.
māy'ūpamañ'ca viññāṇaṃ, desit'ādicca'bandhunā.

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghe vinicchayakathāya vattamānāya chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkameyya, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_3: pānīyaparibhojanīy'ūpaṭṭhapanañ'ca, chandaarahānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ chandaāharaṇañ'ca, tesaññ'eva akat'uposathānaṃ pārisuddhiyā'pi āharaṇañ'ca
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: agilānena bhikkhunā catumāsappaccayapavāraṇā sāditabbā aññatra punapavāraṇāya, aññatra niccapavāraṇāya. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilāna-ppaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ
sbs_example_3: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva uppannānaṃ veyyābādhikānaṃ vedanānaṃ paṭighātāya abyāpajjhaparamatāyā
sbs_example_4:
jīvitānaṃ parikkhāre, bhesajje atha paccaye.
na bāḷhaṃ ussukā āsuṃ, yathā te āsavakkhaye
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: addasā kho aññataro upāsako taṃ bhikkhuṃ kīṭāgirismiṃ piṇḍāya carantaṃ. disvāna yena so bhikkhu ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ abhivādetvā etadavoca, api, bhante, piṇḍo labbhatī'ti?
example_2:
sa piṇḍacāraṃ caritvā,
vanantam'abhihāraye,
upaṭṭhito rukkhamūlasmiṃ,
āsan'ūpagato muni.
sbs_example_3: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso piṇḍapātaṃ paṭisevāmi n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya vihiṃsūparatiyā brahmacariyānuggahāya
sbs_example_4: so pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

example_1: evaṃ vutte purimāni, bhante, divasāni purimatarāni, nānātitthiyānaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ kotūhalasālāya sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ abhisaññānirodhe kathā udapādi, kathaṃ nu kho, bho, abhisaññānirodho hotī'ti?
example_2: so tāya dhammapariyattiyā divasaṃ atināmeti, riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, n'ānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu, bhikkhu pariyattibahulo, no dhammavihārī.
sbs_example_3: niṭṭhite ca pubbakicce, sace so divaso cātuddasīpaṇṇarasīsāmaggīnam'aññataro, yath'ājja uposatho paṇṇaraso.
sbs_example_4: idha bhikkhu divase nikkhante rattiyā patihitāya iti paṭisañcikkhati, bahukā kho me paccayā maraṇassa:

meaning_1: related to an offence requiring suspension; lit. related to an offence requiring involvement of the community from start to finish
commentary: (VINa) vacan'attho pan'ettha saṅgho ādimhi c'eva sese ca icchitabbo assā'ti saṅghādiseso.
example_1: ime kho pan'āyasmanto terasa saṅghādisesā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
example_2: saṅghādiseso'ti saṅgho'va tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ deti, mūlāya paṭikassati, mānattaṃ deti, abbheti, na sambahulā, na ekapuggalo. tena vuccati, saṅghādiseso'ti.
sbs_example_3: nisajjaṃ bhikkhu paṭijānamāno tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena kāretabbo pārājikena vā saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā, yena vā sā saddheyyavacasā upāsikā vadeyya, tena so bhikkhu kāretabbo, ayaṃ dhammo aniyato.

example_1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, akusalamūlāni. katamāni tīṇi? lobho akusalamūlaṃ, doso akusalamūlaṃ, moho akusalamūlaṃ
example_2:
piyā su lokasmiṃ kutonidānā,
ye v'āpi lobhā vicaranti loke,
āsā ca niṭṭhā ca kutonidānā,
ye samparāyāya narassa honti.

example_1: devassa kho dānaṃ dīyati, amhākaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati. sādhu mayam'pi devaṃ nissāya dānāni dadeyyāma, puññāni kareyyāmā'ti.
example_2: sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.
sbs_example_3: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, coraṃ āgucāriṃ gahetvā rañño dasseyyuṃ, ayaṃ te, deva, coro āgucārī, imassa yaṃ icchasi taṃ daṇḍaṃ paṇehī'ti.

commentary:
(MNa) tattha kujjhanalakkhaṇo kodho, caṇḍikkalakkhaṇo vā, āghātakaraṇaraso, dussanapaccupaṭṭhāno.
(ANa) paresu kujjhanalakkhaṇo kodho.
example_1:
kodhaṃ jhatvā sukhaṃ seti,
kodhaṃ jhatvā na socati,
kodhassa visamūlassa,
madhur'aggassa devate,
vadhaṃ ariyā pasaṃsanti,
tañ'hi jhatvā na socatī'ti.
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti
sbs_example_3:
māno hi te brāhmaṇa khāribhāro, kodho dhūmo bhasmani mosavajjaṃ.
jivhā sujā hadayaṃ jotiṭhānaṃ, attā sudanto purisassa joti.
sbs_example_4: byāpannacittassa byāpādo pahīyetha, kodhanassa kodho pahīyetha, upanāhissa upanāho pahīyetha, makkhissa makkho pahīyetha, paḷāsissa paḷāso pahīyetha
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan'āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār'addhānamaggaṃ
example_2: yo'pi c'ettha katakusalo hoti, tam'pi ñātirogabhogabyasan'ādīnaṃ aññatarena byasanena samannāgataṃ disvā vā sutvā vā tesaṃ abhāve'pi vaṭṭadukkhaṃ anatikkantattā, dukkhito'va ayan'ti.
sbs_example_3: maññitaṃ, bhikkhave, rogo, maññitaṃ gaṇḍo, maññitaṃ sallaṃ. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, amaññamānena cetasā viharissāmā'ti, evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: fool; worthless man; useless person; stupid person; lit. empty man
example_1: acchariyaṃ, moggallāna, abbhutaṃ, moggallāna! yāva bāhāgahaṇā'pi nāma so moghapuriso āgamessatī'ti
example_2: atha ca pan'idh'ekacce moghapurisā pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharitvā abhisaṅkharitvā tathāgataṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchanti.
sbs_example_3: kīva dūr'ev'ime, bhikkhave, moghapurisā apakkantā imamhā dhammavinayā.
sbs_example_4: idha ekacce moghapurisā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti—suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.

meaning_1: name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost monk in the divine eye; cousin of the Buddha
commentary: (AN 1.192) etad'aggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dibbacakkhukānaṃ yad'idaṃ anuruddho.
example_1: āyasmatā ca mahācundena āyasmatā ca anuruddhena āyasmatā ca revatena āyasmatā ca ānandena, aññehi ca abhiññātehi abhiññātehi therehi sāvakehi saddhiṃ.
example_2: yato kho tvaṃ anuruddha ime aṭṭha mahāpurisavitakke vitakkessasi, tato tvaṃ anuruddha yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhissasi …
sbs_example_3: kiṃ nu kho mayaṃ āyasmato anuruddhassa evam'ārocimha, imāsañ'ca imāsañ'ca vihārasamāpattīnaṃ mayaṃ lābhino'ti

meaning_1: battle; war; fight; lit. going together
example_1:
tass'eva tena pāpiyo,
yo kuddhaṃ paṭikujjhati,
kuddhaṃ appaṭikujjhanto,
saṅgāmaṃ jeti dujjayaṃ.
example_2:
yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.
sbs_example_3:
kileseh'ābhibhūtā te, tena tena vidhāvitā.
narā kilesavatthūsu, sasaṅgāme'va ghosite.

example_1:
pamādaṃ appamādena,
yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha,
asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe,
dhīro bāle avekkhati.
example_2:
ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ,
phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yadattagarahī tadakubbamāno,
na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.
sbs_example_3:
khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ navaṃ n'atthi sambhavaṃ, virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ.
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā, nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo.
sbs_example_4:
na dīgham'āyuṃ labhate dhanena, na c'āpi vittena jaraṃ vihanti.
appaṃ h'idaṃ jīvitam'āhu dhīrā, asassataṃ vippariṇāmadhammaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
yamhi saccañ'ca dhammo ca, ahiṃsā saṃyamo damo.
sa ve vantamalo dhīro, thero iti pavuccatī'ti.

example_1: santi, bhante, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kesamuttaṃ āgacchanti. te sakaṃ'y'eva vādaṃ dīpenti jotenti, parappavādaṃ pana khuṃsenti vambhenti paribhavanti omakkhiṃ karonti.
example_2: te pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharonti, imaṃ mayaṃ pañhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchissāma. evaṃ ce no puṭṭho evaṃ byākarissati, evam'assa mayaṃ vādaṃ āropessāma.
sbs_example_3: kām'upādānaṃ, diṭṭh'upādānaṃ, sīlabbat'upādānaṃ, attavād'upādānaṃ. idaṃ vuccati taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
yehi vivitto vicareyya loke,
na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo,
jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā,
jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ,
evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho,
kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.
sbs_example_5: pacchā vacanīyaṃ pure avaca. sahitaṃ me, asahitaṃ te. adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattaṃ. āropito te vādo
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
kodhaṃ jhatvā sukhaṃ seti,
kodhaṃ jhatvā na socati,
kodhassa visamūlassa,
madhur'aggassa devate,
vadhaṃ ariyā pasaṃsanti,
tañ'hi jhatvā na socatī'ti.
example_2: kathañ'ca bhikkhu ariyo hoti? ārak'āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, saṃkilesikā, ponobbhavikā, sadarā, dukkhavipākā, āyatiṃ, jātijarāmaraṇiyā.

notes: (PED) perhaps identical with mādisa (lit. like me)
example_1: yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati
example_2: añña'd'atthu pañjaliko'va naṃ yācati, dehi me, mārisa, urabbhaṃ vā urabbhadhanaṃ vā'ti.
sbs_example_3: kathaṃ nu tvaṃ, mārisa, ogham'atarī'ti? appatiṭṭhaṃ khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, anāyūhaṃ ogham'atarin'ti.

meaning_1: truth; reality; principle; truth behind the teaching
example_1: alaṃ, vakkali, kiṃ te iminā pūtikāyena diṭṭhena? yo kho, vakkali, dhammaṃ passati so maṃ passati, yo maṃ passati so dhammaṃ passati
example_2:
na hi verena verāni,
sammant'īdha kudācanaṃ,
averena ca sammanti,
esa dhammo sanantano.
sbs_example_3: katame ca bhikkhave satta aparihāniyā dhammā?
sbs_example_4: ime kho, bhikkhave, dve sukkā dhammā lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti vā. sambhedaṃ loko agamissa, yathā ajeḷakā kukkuṭasūkarā soṇasiṅgālā.

example_1: na'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati janakuhana-atthaṃ, na janalapana-atthaṃ, na lābhasakkārasilok'ānisaṃsa-atthaṃ, na itivādappamokkh'ānisaṃsa-atthaṃ, na iti maṃ jano jānātū'ti
example_2:
ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,

saggaṃ sugatino yanti,

example_2: tena saccena sotthi te hotu sotthi gabbhassā'ti
sbs_example_3:
diṭṭhiṃ ca anupaggamma, sīlavā dassanena sampanno,
kāmesu vineyya gedhaṃ, na hi jātu gabbhaseyyaṃ punar'etī' ti.
sbs_example_4:
yathā balākayonimhi,
na vijjati pumo sadā,
meghesu gajjamānesu,
gabbhaṃ gaṇhanti tā sadā.

example_1:
pakappitā saṅkhatā yassa dhammā,
purakkhatā santi avīvadātā,
yadattani passati ānisaṃsaṃ,
taṃ nissito kuppapaṭicca santiṃ.
example_2: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.
sbs_example_3:
dhammo have rakkhati dhammacāriṃ,
dhammo suciṇṇo sukham'āvahati.
esa-ānisaṃso dhamme suciṇṇe,
na duggatiṃ gacchati dhammacārī.
sbs_example_4: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā yāguyā. katame pañca? khuddaṃ paṭihanati, pipāsaṃ paṭivineti, vātaṃ anulometi, vatthiṃ sodheti, ām'āvasesaṃ pāceti. ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ānisaṃsā yāguyā'ti.
sbs_example_5: evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, addasaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṃkilesaṃ, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ vodānapakkhaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: kin; kinsman; relative; relation; family member; lit. who is known
example_1:
na taṃ mātā pitā kayirā,
aññe v'āpi ca ñātakā,
sammāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ,
seyyaso naṃ tato kare.
example_2: so ñātakehi nīyamāno appatvā'va ñātake antarāmagge kālaṃ karoti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco yodh'ājīvo hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo yodh'ājīvo santo saṃvijjamāno lokasmiṃ.
sbs_example_3:
dānañ'ca dhammacariyā ca, ñātakānañ'ca saṅgaho.
anavajjāni kammāni, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_4: iminā puññakammena upajjhāyā guṇ'uttarā, ācariy'ūpakārā ca mātāpitā ca ñātakā, suriyo candimā rājā, guṇavantā narā'pi ca
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: katamā ca, bhikkhave, taṇhā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, taṇhākāyā, rūpataṇhā, saddataṇhā, gandhataṇhā, rasataṇhā, phoṭṭhabbataṇhā, dhammataṇhā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, taṇhā.
example_2: cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, vedanākāyā, cakkhusamphassajā vedanā, sotasamphassajā vedanā, ghānasamphassajā vedanā, kāyasamphassajā vedanā, manosamphassajā vedanā.
sbs_example_3: chayime, bhikkhave, phassakāyā, cakkhusamphasso, sotasamphasso, ghānasamphasso, jivhāsamphasso, kāyasamphasso, manosamphasso. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, phasso.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: paṇḍitā h'āvuso manussā vīmaṃsakā kismiṃ pan'āyasmantānaṃ chandarāgavinayakkhāyī satthā'ti
example_2:
ath'āparaṃ pañca rajāni loke,
yesaṃ satīmā vinayāya sikkhe,
rūpesu saddesu atho rasesu,
gandhesu phassesu sahetha rāgaṃ.
sbs_example_3: chandajaṃ aghaṃ chandajaṃ dukkhaṃ, chandavinayā aghavinayo, aghavinayā dukkhavinayo'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: state of loss; state of misery; lit. going away
commentary: (ANa) apāyo'ti niraya-tiracchānayoni-pettivisaya-asurakāyā. sabbe'pi hi te vaḍḍhisaṅkhātassa āyassa abhāvato apāyā'ti vuccanti.
example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa evaṃ icchati, aho vat'āyaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti! taṃ kissa hetu?
example_2: ayaṃ varāko kiñ'c'āpi idāni sukhito susajjito bhoge paribhuñjati, atha kho tīsu dvāresu ekenā'pi katassa kalyāṇakammassa abhāvā idāni apāyesu anappakaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedissatī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
catūha-apāyehi ca vippamutto,
cha cābhiṭhānāni abhabbo kātuṃ
sbs_example_4: micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: way; means; method; figure of speech; way of saying; method of presentation; lit. going around
example_1: atthi kho, āvuso, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma ime dhammā nān'ātthā c'eva nānābyañjanā ca, atthi ca kho, āvuso, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma ime dhammā ek'atthā, byañjanam'eva nānaṃ.
example_2: siyā pan'āvuso aññopi pariyāyo yathā ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti
sbs_example_3: cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti, evam'evaṃ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
sbs_example_4: evam'evaṃ, bho gotama, anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
mitte bhajassu kalyāṇe,
suddhājīve atandite,
paṭisanthāravuty'assa,
ācārakusalo siyā,
tato pāmojjabahulo,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.
example_2:
yādisaṃ kurute mittaṃ,
yādisaṃ c'ūpasevati,
sa ve tādisako hoti,
sahavāso hi tādiso.
sbs_example_3: brahmamārā ca indā ca lokapālā ca devatā, yamo, mittā manussā ca majjhattā verikā'pi ca, sabbe sattā sukhī hontu.
sbs_example_4: adāsi me akāsi me, ñātimittā sakhā ca me. petānaṃ dakkhiṇaṃ dajjā, pubbe katam'anussaraṃ.
sbs_example_5: yathārūpe anāsane nisinnaṃ yathārūpe agocare carantaṃ, yathārūpe pāpake mitte bhajantaṃ viññū sabrahmacārī pāpakesu ṭhānesu okappeyyuṃ.

meaning_1: (either protective or malevolent) spirit; supernatural being; demon
example_1: sace vijānāsi vadehi yakkhā'ti.
example_2:
annam'ev'ābhinandanti,
ubhaye devamānusā,
atha ko nāma so yakkho,
yaṃ annaṃ n'ābhinandatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: bhummā c'āyantu devā jalathalavisame yakkhagandhabbanāgā tiṭṭhantā santike, yaṃ munivaravacanaṃ sādhavo me suṇantu
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ārogyaparamā lābhā,
santuṭṭhiparamaṃ dhanaṃ,
vissāsaparamā ñāti,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.
example_2:
āsīsanti thomayanti abhijappanti juhanti,
kām'ābhijappanti paṭicca lābhaṃ,
te yājayogā bhavarāgarattā,
n'ātariṃsu jātijaran'ti brūmi.
sbs_example_3: bhikkhu ye te lābhā dhammikā dhammaladdhā antamaso pattapariyāpannamattam'pi, tathārūpehi lābhehi appaṭivibhattabhogī hoti sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogī.
sbs_example_4: kiṃ nu kho mayaṃ āyasmato anuruddhassa evam'ārocimha, imāsañ'ca imāsañ'ca vihārasamāpattīnaṃ mayaṃ lābhino'ti
sbs_example_5:
upaṭṭhāpenti parisaṃ, kammato no ca dhammato.
dhammaṃ paresaṃ desenti, lābhato no ca atthato.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ayaṃ loko paro loko,
brahmaloko sadevako,
diṭṭhiṃ te n'ābhijānāti,
gotamassa yasassino.
example_2:
pāpāni parivajjeti,
sa munī tena so muni,
yo munāti ubho loke,
muni tena pavuccati.
sbs_example_3: bhagavā pana, bhante, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pahoti tathā kātuṃ yathā sabbo loko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
rājato vā upasaggaṃ,
abbhakkhānañ'ca dāruṇaṃ,
parikkhayañ'ca ñātīnaṃ,
bhogānañ'ca pabhaṅguraṃ.
example_2: taṃ vā pana anabhisambhavaṃ appaṭivijjhaṃ pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti.
sbs_example_3: balavā puriso divasaṃsantatte ayokaṭāhe dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni nipāteyya. dandho, ānanda, udakaphusitānaṃ nipāto, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya.

meaning_1: family name; lit. descendant of Kassapa
example_1: ye'pi te, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa, seyyath'idaṃ, pūraṇo kassapo, makkhali gosālo, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto, sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto, pakudho kaccāyano, ajito kesakambalo
example_2: abhijānām'ahaṃ, bho gotama, pūraṇaṃ kassapaṃ vādena vādaṃ samārabhitā. so'pi mayā vādena vādaṃ samāraddho aññen'aññaṃ paṭicari, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmesi, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātvākāsi.
sbs_example_3: āyasmatā ca sāriputtena āyasmatā ca mahāmoggallānena āyasmatā ca mahākassapena āyasmatā ca mahākaccāyanena āyasmatā ca mahākoṭṭhikena āyasmatā ca mahākappinena
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā daṇḍam'olubbha ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi
example_2: alaṃ, āvuso dāsaka, kiṃ imāya sandhāvanikāya! āhar'āvuso, daṇḍaṃ, aham'eva yena therā bhikkhū ten'upasaṅkamissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyaṇaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati
example_2: ayañ'hi dīp'obhāsaṃ vā aggi'obhāsaṃ vā adisvā maṇiāloken'eva bhuñjati ca nisīdati ca nipajjati ca, devo pana dīp'ālokena nisinno bhavissatī'ti?
sbs_example_3: ayañ'ca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampi sampakampi sampavedhi appamāṇo ca oḷāro obhāso loke pāturahosi atikkamm'eva devānaṃ dev'ānubhāvaṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on  Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4:
obhāsajātaṃ phalagaṃ, cittaṃ yassa abhiṇhaso.
tādisaṃ bhikkhum'āsajja, kaṇha dukkhaṃ nigacchasī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā, ananto ākāso'ti ākāsa-anañc'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma
example_2:
anusāsa brahme karuṇāyamāno,
vivekadhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
yath'āhaṃ ākāso'va abyāpajjamāno,
idh'eva santo asito careyyaṃ.
sbs_example_3: atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhā ākās'ānañc'āyatananissitā, atthi viññāṇ'añc'āyatananissitā, atthi ākiñcaññ'āyatananissitā, atthi n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatananissitā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: cattāro'me, bhikkhave, kālā sammā bhāviyamānā sammā anuparivattiyamānā anupubbena āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpenti
example_2: sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.
sbs_example_3: atthi nu kho me uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso adhigato, so'haṃ pacchime kāle sabrahmacārīhi puṭṭho na maṅku bhavissāmī'ti
sbs_chant_eng_3: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth

meaning_1: mansion; stately home; palace; building with pillars
example_1: tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?
example_2: tena kho pana samayena bārāṇasiyaṃ yaso nāma kulaputto seṭṭhiputto sukhumālo hoti. tassa tayo pāsādā honti, eko hem'antiko, eko gimhiko, eko vassiko.
sbs_example_3: atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa tayo pāsāde kārāpesi, ekaṃ vassikaṃ ekaṃ hem'antikaṃ ekaṃ gimhikaṃ, pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi
sbs_example_4:
pamādaṃ appamādena, yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha, asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe, dhīro bāle avekkhati.

example_1:
āyuṃ arogiyaṃ vaṇṇaṃ,
saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ,
ratiyo patthayantena,
uḷārā apar'āparā.
example_2: tesaṃ taṃ vaṇṇāya c'eva hoti balāya ca, na ca tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigacchanti maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ.
sbs_example_3: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami
sbs_example_4: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhāṇado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_5:
abhivādanasīlissa, niccaṃ vuḍḍh'āpacāyino,
cattāro dhammā vaḍḍhanti, āyu vaṇṇo sukhaṃ balaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: name of a former monk; lit. good star sign
example_1: assosi kho āyasmā sāriputto sunakkhattassa licchaviputtassa vesāliyaṃ parisati evaṃ vācaṃ bhāsamānassa, n'atthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu tassa purisassa tasmiṃ vante puna bhottu'kamyatā assā'ti?
sbs_example_3: atha kho sunakkhatto licchaviputto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
sare hatthehi bhañjitvā,
katvāna kuṭim'acchisaṃ,
tena me sarabhaṅgo'ti,
nāmaṃ sammutiyā ahu.
example_2: tassa kusakaṇṭakā c'eva pāde vijjheyyuṃ, sarapattāni ca gattāni vilekheyyuṃ.
sbs_example_3: asītivassasahass'āyukesu, bhikkhave, manussesu ayaṃ jambudīpo avīci maññe phuṭo bhavissati manussehi, seyyathā'pi naḷavanaṃ vā saravanaṃ vā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yattha nu kho, bhante, na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, sakkā nu kho so, bhante, gamanena lokassa anto ñātuṃ vā daṭṭhuṃ vā pāpuṇituṃ vā'ti?
example_2:
es'ūpamā dāmali brāhmaṇassa,
khīṇ'āsavassa nipakassa jhāyino,
pappuyya jātimaraṇassa antaṃ,
n'āyūhatī pāragato hi so'ti.
sbs_example_3: appevanām'imassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa antakiriyā paññāyethā'ti
sbs_example_4: na c'āhaṃ, āvuso, appatvā'va lokassa antaṃ dukkhassa antakiriyaṃ vadāmi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, balavā puriso dubbalataraṃ purisaṃ sīse vā gale vā khandhe vā gahetvā abhiniggaṇheyya abhinippīḷeyya abhisantāpeyya.
example_2: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ kullaṃ sīse vā āropetvā khandhe vā uccāretvā yena kāmaṃ pakkameyyan'ti.
sbs_example_3: aññena hatth'aṭṭhikaṃ, aññena pād'aṭṭhikaṃ, gopphak'aṭṭhikaṃ, jaṅgh'aṭṭhikaṃ, ūru'ṭṭhikaṃ, kaṭi'ṭṭhikaṃ, phāsuk'aṭṭhikaṃ, piṭṭhi'ṭṭhikaṃ, khandha-aṭṭhikaṃ, gīv'aṭṭhikaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
na pupphagandho paṭivātam'eti,
na candanaṃ tagaramallikā,
satañ'ca gandho paṭivātam'eti,
sabbā disā sappuriso pavāyati.
example_2: nacca-gīta-vādita-visūka-dassanā paṭivirato hoti mālā-gandha-vilepana-dhāraṇa-maṇḍana-vibhūsana-ṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti
sbs_example_3: annakathaṃ pānakathaṃ vatthakathaṃ sayanakathaṃ mālākathaṃ gandhakathaṃ ñātikathaṃ yānakathaṃ gāmakathaṃ nigamakathaṃ
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, ye keci mūlagandhā, kālānusāri tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati, ... evam'eva bhoto gotamassa ovādo param'ajjadhammesu.

example_1:
yo appaduṭṭhassa narassa dussati,
suddhassa posassa anaṅgaṇassa,
tam'eva bālaṃ pacceti pāpaṃ,
sukhumo rajo paṭivātaṃ'va khitto.
example_2:
itthī'pi hi ekacciyā,
seyyā posa janādhipa,
medhāvinī sīlavatī,
sassudevā patibbatā.
sbs_example_3:
anaṅgaṇassa posassa, niccaṃ sucigavesino.
vāl'aggamattaṃ pāpassa, abbhamattaṃ'va khāyati.

example_1: tasmiṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, yaññe n'eva gāvo haññiṃsu, na aj'eḷakā haññiṃsu, na kukkuṭasūkarā haññiṃsu, na vividhā pāṇā saṃghātaṃ āpajjiṃsu, na rukkhā chijjiṃsu yūpatthāya, na dabbhā lūyiṃsu barihisatthāya
example_2:
te ce n'ātariṃsu yājayogā,
yaññehi jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
atha ko carahi devamanussaloke,
atāri jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.
sbs_example_3: aj'eḷakā ca gāvo ca, vividhā yattha haññare. na taṃ sammaggatā yaññaṃ, upayanti mah'esino.

meaning_1: family name; lit. descendant of Kati
example_1: ayam'pi kho pakudho kaccāno saṅghī c'eva gaṇī ca gaṇ'ācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.
example_2: dvayanissito khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena, atthitañ'c'eva natthitañ'ca.

example_1: kīdiso, bho purisa, kiṃsuko'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, bahalapattapalāso sandacchāyo kho, ambho purisa, kiṃsuko, seyyathā'pi nigrodho'ti.
example_2: khandhabījaṃ nāma, assattho, nigrodho, pilakkho, udumbaro, kacchako, kapitthano, yāni vā pan'aññāni'pi atthi khandhe jāyanti, khandhe sañjāyanti, etaṃ khandhabījaṃ nāma.

example_1:

bahubheravaṃ ratanagaṇānam'ālayaṃ,

example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno codakaṃ'y'eva paṭippharati, kiṃ nu kho tuyhaṃ bālassa abyattassa bhaṇitena!
example_2: codakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetu'kāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitvā pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo
sbs_example_3: codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetu'kāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, parisuddhakāyasamācāro nu kho'mhi?' parisuddhavacīsamācāro nu kho'mhi?'

meaning_1: dislike; ill-will; hatred; hostility; enmity; malevolence; lit. going wrong
commentary: (ANa) byāpajjati iminā cittaṃ pūtikummās'ādayo viya purimapakatiṃ pajahatī'ti byāpādo.
example_1: mettaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. mettañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yo byāpādo so pahīyissati.
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti
sbs_example_3: byāpādapadosaṃ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī, byāpādapadosā cittaṃ parisodheti
sbs_example_4: santaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ byāpādaṃ atthi me ajjhattaṃ byāpādo'ti pajānāti, asantaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ byāpādaṃ n'atthi me ajjhattaṃ byāpādo'ti pajānāti.
sbs_example_5: n'āhaṃ aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā byāpādo uppajjati uppanno vā byāpādo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ paṭighanimittaṃ.

piya-apāyo hi pāpako,
ganthā tesaṃ na vijjanti,
yesaṃ n'atthi piy'āppiyaṃ

meaning_1: name of the people of Bengal; Bengalis
commentary: (MNa) aṅgesū'ti aṅgā nāma jānapadino rājakumārā, tesaṃ nivāso eko'pi janapado ruḷhīsaddena aṅgā'ti vuccati, tasmiṃ aṅgesu janapade.
example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā aṅgesu viharati āpaṇaṃ nāma aṅgānaṃ nigamo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: katamo ca, bhikkhave, anusotagāmī puggalo? idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kāme ca paṭisevati, pāpañ'ca kammaṃ karoti. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, anusotagāmī puggalo.
example_2: so vata, bhikkhave, aññatr'eva kāmehi aññatra kāmasaññāya aññatra kāmavitakkehi kāme paṭisevissatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno, sikkhaṃ appaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā, methunaṃ dhammaṃ patiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pi, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: sace āyasmato channassa n'atthi sappāyāni bhojanāni, ahaṃ āyasmato channassa sappāyāni bhojanāni pariyesissāmi. sace āyasmato channassa n'atthi sappāyāni bhesajjāni, ahaṃ āyasmato channassa sappāyāni bhesajjāni pariyesissāmi.
example_2: te iminā kāyena aṭṭīyamānā harāyamānā jigucchamānā satthahārakaṃ pariyesanti.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya satthahārakaṃ v'āssa pariyeseyya maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya maraṇāya vā samādapeyya
sbs_example_4: orena ce māso seso gimhānan'ti vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyeseyya, oren'addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāseyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: produces; generates; makes; gives birth to; lit. flows forth
example_1:
jayaṃ veraṃ pasavati,
dukkhaṃ seti parājito,
upasanto sukhaṃ seti,
hitvā jayaparājayaṃ.
example_2: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca puññaṃ pasavati.
sbs_example_3: yo kho, jīvaka, tathāgataṃ vā tathāgatasāvakaṃ vā uddissa pāṇaṃ ārabhati so pañcahi ṭhānehi bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ uddissa pāṇaṃ ārabhanti, taṃ samaṇo gotamo jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman'ti.
example_2: yam'pi so evam'āha, gacchatha imaṃ pāṇaṃ ārabhathā'ti, iminā tatiyena ṭhānena bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.
sbs_example_3: yo kho, jīvaka, tathāgataṃ vā tathāgatasāvakaṃ vā uddissa pāṇaṃ ārabhati so pañcahi ṭhānehi bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.
