example_1:
uttamaṃ dhammataṃ patto,
sabbaloke anatthiko,
ādittā'va gharā mutto,
maraṇasmiṃ na socati.
example_2:
socati puttehi puttimā,
gomā gohi tath'eva socati,
upadhīhi narassa socanā,
na hi so socati yo nirūpadhī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
yāya devā manussā ca, sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ, khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti, nirayamhi samappitā.
sbs_example_4: tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati. sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā. so dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) tareyyā'ti ettha tebhūmakavaṭṭaṃ samatikkamanto nibbānaṃ paṭivijjhanto taratī'ti paṭivedhataraṇaṃ nāma vuttaṃ.
example_1:
ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.
example_2:
eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,
anissito no visahāmi tārituṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ brūhi samantacakkhu,
yaṃ nissito ogham'imaṃ tareyyaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
yāya devā manussā ca, sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ, khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti, nirayamhi samappitā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: pañcakāmaguṇike rāge pariññāte n'atthi taṃ saṃyojanaṃ yena saṃyojanena saṃyutto ariyasāvako puna imaṃ lokaṃ āgaccheyya
example_2: sā ce tato cutā itthattaṃ āgacchati, sā yattha yattha paccājāyati dubbaṇṇā ca hoti durūpā supāpikā dassanāya, daliddā ca hoti appassakā appabhogā appesakkhā ca.
sbs_example_3: yāv'āhaṃ tesaṃ uddisitvā āgacchāmī'ti, udāhu vippalapan'tass'eva coraghātā sīsaṃ chindeyyun'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: jānāhi yadi vā taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ tathā santaṃ'y'eva saddo abbhuggato, yadi vā no tathā, yadi vā so bhavaṃ gotamo tādiso, yadi vā na tādiso. tathā mayaṃ taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ vedissāmā'ti.
example_2: puccheyyāma mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ kañci'd'eva desaṃ, sace āyasmā channo okāsaṃ karoti pañhassa veyyākaraṇāyā'ti. pucch'āvuso sāriputta, sutvā vedissāmā'ti.
sbs_example_3: yassa siyā āpatti so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ. tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni asante hārake. tato ce uttari hareyya, asante'pi hārake, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
example_2:
ye nāgarāje sahasā haranti,
dibbā dijā pakkhi visuddhacakkhū,
vehāsayā te vanamajjhapattā,
citrā supaṇṇā iti tesa nāmaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yassa bhavissati so harissatī'ti. ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ.
sbs_example_5: amhe jano harati vā ḍahati vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karotī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
jaheyya sabbasaṃyogaṃ,
kareyya saraṇ'attano,
careyy'ādittasīso'va,
patthayaṃ accutaṃ padan'ti.
example_2:
visenikatvā pana ye caranti,
diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,
tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra,
yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
yaṃ pubbe taṃ visosehi, pacchā te m'āhu kiñcanaṃ,
majjhe ce no gahessasi, upasanto carissasi.
sbs_example_4:
yathā'ssa passato rūpaṃ, sevato c'āpi vedanaṃ.
khīyati nopacīyati, evaṃ so caratī sato.
evaṃ apacinato dukkhaṃ, santike nibbānam'uccati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: overwhelms; assails; assaults; (comm) occurs; lit. walks all over
example_1: tassa mayhaṃ, āvuso, iminā vihārena viharato vitakkasahagatā saññāmanasikārā samudācaranti.
example_2: yattha cetā diṭṭhiyo uppajjanti yattha ca anusenti yattha ca samudācaranti taṃ n'etaṃ mama n'eso'ham'asmi na me so attā'ti
sbs_example_3: yaṃ papañceti tatonidānaṃ purisaṃ papañcasaññāsaṅkhā samudācaranti atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannesu cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ,
yadā kāyaṃ jahant'imaṃ,
apaviddho tadā seti,
parabhattaṃ acetanaṃ.
example_2:
disvāna rūpesu vihaññamāne,
ruppanti rūpesu janā pamattā,
tasmā tuvaṃ piṅgiya appamatto,
jahassu rūpaṃ apunabbhavāya.
sbs_example_3:
uyyuñjanti satīmanto, na nikete ramanti te,
haṃsā'va pallalaṃ hitvā, okam'okaṃ jahanti te.
sbs_example_4: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yā kāci mahānadiyo, seyyath'idaṃ gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī, tā mahāsamuddaṃ patvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni, mahāsamuddo'tveva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti
sbs_example_5:
jaheyya sabbasaṃyogaṃ, kareyya saraṇ'attano,
careyy'ādittasīso'va, patthayaṃ accutaṃ padan'ti.

meaning_1: enjoys; finds pleasure (in); takes delight (in); likes
example_1:
dhammapīti sukhaṃ seti,
vippasannena cetasā,
ariyappavedite dhamme,
sadā ramati paṇḍito.
example_2:
ramaṇīyāni araññāni,
yattha na ramatī jano,
vītarāgā ramissanti,
na te kāmagavesino.
sbs_example_3:
uyyuñjanti satīmanto, na nikete ramanti te,
haṃsā'va pallalaṃ hitvā, okam'okaṃ jahanti te.
sbs_example_4:
madhurañ'ca pavanti sabbaso,
kusumarajena samuṭṭhitā dumā,
paṭhamavasanto sukho utu,
ehi ramāma supupphite vane.
sbs_example_5:
abhittharetha kalyāṇe, pāpā cittaṃ nivāraye,
dandhañ'hi karoto puññaṃ, pāpasmiṃ ramatī mano.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: begins; starts; undertakes; arouses oneself (to); makes an effort (to)
example_1:
ārabbhatha nikkhamatha,
yuñjatha buddhasāsane,
dhunātha maccuno senaṃ,
naḷ'āgāraṃ'va kuñjaro.
example_2: kammaṃ kho pana me karontassa kāyo kilamissati. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti. so nipajjati, na vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
sbs_example_3: uppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ṭhitiyā asammosāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: enters; gets involved (with); engages (in); lit. approaches
example_1:
vadanti ve duṭṭhamanā'pi eke,
atho'pi ve saccamanā vadanti,
vādañ'ca jātaṃ muni no upeti,
tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñci.
example_2:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ,
anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi,
adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabban'ti.
sbs_example_3: upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.
sbs_example_4: so rūpaṃ upeti upādiyati adhiṭṭhāti attā me'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: falls down; falls forward; falls off; falls (into)
example_1: te jātisaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre abhisaṅkharitvā jarāsaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre abhisaṅkharitvā ... jātipapātam'pi papatanti, jarāpapātam'pi papatanti
example_2: evañ'hi, bhikkhave, tassa purisassa hoti, imaṃ c'āhaṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ papatissāmi, tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigacchāmi maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti
sbs_example_3: upakkhalitvā vā papateyyaṃ, bhattaṃ vā me bhuttaṃ byāpajjeyya, pittaṃ vā me kuppeyya, semhaṃ vā me kuppeyya, satthakā vā me vātā kuppeyyuṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi nāma kuñjaro saṭṭhihāyano gambhīraṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā sāṇadhovikaṃ nāma kīḷitajātaṃ kīḷati, evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ sāṇadhovikaṃ maññe kīḷitajātaṃ kīḷissāmi.
example_2: sa kho so, bhikkhave, kumāro vuddhim'anvāya indriyānaṃ paripākam'anvāya yāni tāni kumārakānaṃ kīḷāpanakāni tehi kīḷati, seyyath'idaṃ, vaṅkakaṃ ghaṭikaṃ mokkhacikaṃ ciṅgulakaṃ patt'āḷhakaṃ rathakaṃ dhanukaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
te kilesā pavaḍḍhantā, āvisanti bahuṃ janaṃ.
kīḷanti maññe bālehi, ummattehi'va rakkhasā.

example_1:
hīnaṃ dhammaṃ na seveyya,
pamādena na saṃvase,
micchādiṭṭhiṃ na seveyya,
na siyā lokavaḍḍhano.
example_2:
āthabbaṇaṃ supinaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ,
no vidahe atho'pi nakkhattaṃ,
virutañ'ca gabbhakaraṇaṃ,
tikicchaṃ māmako na seveyya.
sbs_example_3: tayo satipaṭṭhānā yad'ariyo sevati yad'ariyo sevamāno satthā gaṇam'anusāsitum'arahati, so vuccati yogg'ācariyānaṃ anuttaro purisadammasārathī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: believes (in); has faith (in); has confidence (in); has conviction (in)
example_1: idh'āvuso bhikkhu saddho hoti saddahati tathāgatassa bodhiṃ
example_2: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.
sbs_example_3: tassa so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā mittato'pi naṃ saddaheyya, suhajjato'pi naṃ saddaheyya, tasmiñ'ca vissāsaṃ āpajjeyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti
example_2: so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati paritassanā hotī'ti.
sbs_example_3: tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati. sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā. so dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ko nu kho, bhante, vedayatī'ti? no kallo pañho'ti bhagavā avoca, vedayatī'ti ahaṃ na vadāmi.
example_2: kiñ'ca, bhikkhave, vedanaṃ vadetha? vedayatī'ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā vedanā'ti vuccati. kiñ'ca vedayati? sukham'pi vedayati, dukkham'pi vedayati, adukkham'asukham'pi vedayati
sbs_example_3: tassa kismiñci'd'eva pasādanīye nimitte cittaṃ paṇidahato pāmojjaṃ jāyati. pamuditassa pīti jāyati. pītimanassa kāyo passambhati. passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedayati. sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (ANa) taṃ te mayaṃ paṭiggaṇhāmā'ti taṃ tava aparādhaṃ mayaṃ khamāma.
example_1: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā, yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, y'āhaṃ evam'akāsiṃ. tassā me, bhante, ayyo ānando accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā'ti.
example_2: tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū sampayojesuṃ, tatr'eko bhikkhu accasarā, atha kho so bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno santike accayaṃ accayato deseti, so bhikkhu nappaṭiggaṇhāti.
sbs_example_3: taṃ veraṃ n'ābhinandāmi, paṭiggaṇhāmi vo'ccayan'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ovadeyya-anusāseyya,
asabbhā ca nivāraye,
satañ'hi so piyo hoti,
asataṃ hoti appiyo.
example_2: ovadatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā, anusāsatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā, yaṃ mam'assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
tad'ahu pabbajito santo, jātiyā sattavassiko.
so pi maṃ anusāseyya, sampaṭicchāmi muddhanā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (ANa) namassantī'ti kāyena namassanti, vācāya namassanti, manasā namassanti, dhamm'ānudhammapaṭipattiyā namassanti, sakkaronti garuṃ karonti.
example_1:
tasmā hi ne namasseyya,
sakkareyya ca paṇḍito,
annena atha pānena,
vatthena sayanena ca.
example_2: no ce haritāni tiṇāni āmaseyyāsi, aggiṃ paricareyyāsi. no ce aggiṃ paricareyyāsi, pañjaliko ādiccaṃ namasseyyāsi
sbs_example_3: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, dhammaṃ namassāmi
sbs_example_4: arahante sītībhūte, katakicce anāsave nihacca mānaṃ athaddho, te namasse anuttare'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan'āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār'addhānamaggaṃ ime pañca nīvaraṇe appahīne attani samanupassati
example_2:
idha chinditamārite,
hatajānīsu kassapo,
na pāpaṃ samanupassati,
puññaṃ vā pana attano,
sa ve vissāsam'ācikkhi,
satthā arahati mānanan'ti.
sbs_example_3: so yad'eva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.
sbs_example_4: na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ. ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan'ti na pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī hoti.
sbs_example_5: “n'āhaṃ aññaṃ eka-dhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā byāpādo uppajjati uppanno vā byāpādo bhiyyo-bhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ paṭighanimittaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: katamā c'āvuso, suññatā cetovimutti? idh'āvuso, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā iti paṭisañcikkhati, suññam'idaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā'ti. ayaṃ vuccat'āvuso, suññatā cetovimutti.
example_2: so iti paṭisañcikkhati yassa khv'āhaṃ atthāya cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ so me attho abhinipphanno
sbs_example_3: so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā tathāgate saddhaṃ paṭilabhati. so tena saddhāpaṭilābhena samannāgato iti paṭisañcikkhati
sbs_example_4: sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yo kho, sabhiya, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṃ, ākaṅkhati upasampadaṃ, so cattāro māse parivasati.
example_2:
bhikkhu siyā jhāyī vimuttacitto,
ākaṅkhe ce hadayass'ānupattiṃ,
lokassa ñatvā udayabbayañ'ca,
sucetaso anissito tadānisaṃso'ti.
sbs_example_3: so sace ākaṅkhati, dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passeyyaṃ cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākamm'ūpage satte pajāneyyaṃ
sbs_example_4: sace ākaṅkhati, paṭikūlañ'ca appaṭikūlañ'ca tad'ubhayaṃ abhinivajjetvā upekkhako vihareyyaṃ sato sampajāno'ti
sbs_example_5: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vasī vitakkapariyāyapathesu. yaṃ vitakkaṃ ākaṅkhissati taṃ vitakkaṃ vitakkessati, yaṃ vitakkaṃ nākaṅkhissati na taṃ vitakkaṃ vitakkessati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ pajānāti evaṃ passati, ayaṃ vuccati, sot'āpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano'ti.
example_2: tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti
sbs_example_3: so idaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti
sbs_example_4: so sato'va assasati, sato'va passasati. dīghaṃ vā assasanto dīghaṃ assasāmī'ti pajānāti, dīghaṃ vā passasanto dīghaṃ passasāmī'ti pajānāti

meaning_1: brings (for); brings back (for); fetches (for); procures (for); lit. brings here
example_1: kathañ'ca, visākhe, mātugāmo sambhataṃ anurakkhati? idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattā āharati dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā taṃ ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, tattha ca hoti adhuttī athenī asoṇḍī avināsikā.
example_2: atha puriso āgaccheyya, ahaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ daḷhadhammānaṃ dhanuggahānaṃ susikkhitānaṃ katahatthānaṃ kat'ūpāsanānaṃ catuddisā kaṇḍe khitte appatiṭṭhite pathaviyaṃ gahetvā āharissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ vadeyya, alaṃ me, bho, tāya vīṇāya, tam'eva me saddaṃ āharathā'ti.

example_1:
sa ve indriyasampanno,
santo santipade rato,
dhāreti antimaṃ dehaṃ,
jetvā māraṃ savāhinin'ti.
example_2: tasmā te cakkhūni nassantu vā bhijjantu vā, buddhasāsanam'eva dhārehi, mā cakkhūnī'ti
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya

example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā ummaggaṃ gaṇhati, ubbaṭumaṃ rathaṃ karoti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho assadoso.
example_2: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave makkaṭo araññe pavane caramāno sākhaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca appamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otareyya. tam'enaṃ kiṭṭh'ārakkho nāsāyaṃ suggahitaṃ gaṇheyya.
sbs_example_4:
yathā balākayonimhi,
na vijjati pumo sadā,

gabbhaṃ gaṇhanti tā sadā.

meaning_1: (of meditation attainments or Nibbāna) experiences; reaches; attains; achieves; lit. touches
example_1:
bhāvehi jhānāni ca indriyāni ca,
balāni bojjh'aṅgasamādhibhāvanā,
tisso ca vijjā phusa buddhasāsane,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.
example_2: so abhijānanto ekaṃ dhammaṃ, parijānanto ekaṃ dhammaṃ, pajahanto ekaṃ dhammaṃ, sacchikaronto ekaṃ dhammaṃ sammāvimuttiṃ phusati.
sbs_example_3:
saritvā pubbake yogī, tesaṃ vattam'anussaraṃ.
kiñ'c'āpi pacchimo kālo, phuseyya amataṃ padaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
te jhāyino sātatikā, niccaṃ daḷhaparakkamā,
phusanti dhīrā nibbānaṃ, yogakkhemaṃ anuttaraṃ.

example_1:
gāme araññe sukhadukkhaphuṭṭho,
n'ev'attato no parato dahetha,
phusanti phassā upadhiṃ paṭicca,
nirūpadhiṃ kena phuseyyu phassā'ti.
example_2:
phasso nu lokasmi kutonidāno,
pariggahā c'āpi kutopahūtā,
kismiṃ asante na mamattam'atthi,
kismiṃ vibhūte na phusanti phassā.
sbs_example_3: samaṃ pādaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipati, samaṃ uddharati, samaṃ sabbāvantehi pādatalehi bhūmiṃ phusati.
sbs_example_4: ye te kāyaviññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā asamphuṭṭhā asamphuṭṭhapubbā, na ca phusasi, na ca te hoti phuseyyan'ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā'ti?

meaning_1: pulls up; pulls out; lifts up; raises
example_1:
appamādaratā hotha,
sacittam'anurakkhatha,

paṅke sanno'va kuñjaro.

meaning_1: puts down; places down; lays down; lit. throws down

meaning_1: considers as; takes as; regards as; lit. puts
example_1:
gāme araññe sukhadukkhaphuṭṭho,

commentary:
(MNa) paribhāsantī'ti tayā idañ'c'idañ'ca kataṃ, evañ'ca evañ'ca taṃ karissāmā'ti vācāya paribhāsanti.
(SNa) paribhāsissantī'ti kiṃ samaṇo nāma tvaṃ, idañ'c'idañ'ca te karissāmā'ti tajjessanti.
example_1:
yo buddhaṃ paribhāsati,
atha vā tassa sāvakaṃ,
paribbājaṃ gahaṭṭhaṃ vā,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.
example_2: evarūpo, bhikkhave, puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo. taṃ kissa hetu? akkoseyya'pi maṃ paribhāseyya'pi maṃ anattham'pi maṃ kareyyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: sace taṃ, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā akkosissanti paribhāsissanti, tatra te, puṇṇa, kin'ti bhavissatī'ti?

example_2: evarūpo, bhikkhave, puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo. taṃ kissa hetu? akkoseyya'pi maṃ paribhāseyya'pi maṃ anattham'pi maṃ kareyyā'ti.

example_1: yāvatatiyañ'ce samanubhāsiyamāno taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, icc'etaṃ kusalaṃ, no ce paṭinissajjeyya, saṅghādiseso.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, sace so puriso taṃ ādittaṃ tiṇ'ukkaṃ na khippam'eva paṭinissajjeyya tassa sā ādittā tiṇ'ukkā hatthaṃ vā daheyya bāhuṃ vā daheyya aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ daheyya
sbs_example_3: sace so gijjho vā kaṅko vā kulalo vā taṃ maṃsapesiṃ na khippam'eva paṭinissajjeyya, so tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigaccheyya maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti?

example_1:
anikkasāvo kāsāvaṃ,
yo vatthaṃ paridahissati,
apeto damasaccena,
na so kāsāvam'arahati.
example_2:
yo ca jānaṃ saṃyat'atto,
jānaṃ na bahu bhāsati,
sa munī monam'arahati,
sa munī monam'ajjhagā'ti.
sbs_example_3: sabhayo c'eso maggo sappaṭibhayo ca sakaṇṭako ca sagahano ca ummaggo ca kummaggo ca duhitiko ca. asappurisasevito c'eso maggo, na c'eso maggo sappurisehi sevito. na tvaṃ etaṃ arahasī'ti.
sbs_example_4:
yo ca vantakasāvassa, sīlesu susamāhito.
upeto damasaccena, sa ve kāsāvam'arahati.

example_1: añña'd'atthu, ayaṃ varāko idāni marissati, yaṃ yadeva hi ayaṃ padaṃ nikkhipati, tena tena santike maraṇassa hotī'ti taṃ jano karuṇāyati.
example_2: deva, idāni ṭhapetvā saccakiriyaṃ añño mama sakkhi n'atthi, sac'āyaṃ dārako tumhe paṭicca jāto, ākāse tiṭṭhatu, no ce, bhūmiyaṃ patitvā maratū'ti bodhisattassa pāde gahetvā ākāse khipi.
sbs_example_3: sabbe sattā maranti ca mariṃsu ca marissare, tath'ev'āhaṃ marissāmi, n'atthi me ettha saṃsayo

example_1: evaṃ vutte yasmiṃ samaye upeti, saññī tasmiṃ samaye hoti. yasmiṃ samaye apeti, asaññī tasmiṃ samaye hotī'ti. itth'eke abhisaññānirodhaṃ paññapenti.
example_2:
middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca,
niddāyitā samparivattasāyī,
mahāvarāho'va nivāpapuṭṭho,
punappunaṃ gabbham'upeti mando.
sbs_example_3:
rājā ca aññe ca bahū manussā, avītataṇhā maraṇaṃ upenti.
ūnā'va hutvāna jahanti dehaṃ, kāmehi lokamhi na h'atthi titti.
sbs_example_4:
jīranti ve rājarathā sucittā, atho sarīram'pi jaraṃ upeti,
satañ'ca dhammo na jaraṃ upeti, santo have sabbhi pavedayanti.

example_1: amutra mayā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahitā, mā kho tattha paṭiggaṇhī'ti. sace passitvā na ācikkhati, āpatti dukkaṭassa. sace ācikkhite paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
example_2: atthi, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo, taṃ tathāgato abhisambujjhati abhisameti, abhisambujjhitvā abhisametvā taṃ ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti.
sbs_example_3: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti, upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

example_1:
kathaṃ satassa carato,
viññāṇaṃ uparujjhati,
bhagavantaṃ puṭṭhum'āgamma,

example_1:

example_2:

meaning_1: keeps; stores; saves; sets aside; lays aside; lit. throws down
example_1: tam'enaṃ sāmikā gandhaparibhāvite karaṇḍake nikkhipanti. yo'pi'ssa hoti anusahagato ūsagandho vā khāragandho vā gomayagandho vā asamūhato, so'pi samugghātaṃ gacchati.
example_2: accekaṃ maññamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭiggahetvā yāva cīvarakālasamayaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ. tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_3: no c'assa pāripūri, māsaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā taṃ cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ ūnassa pāripūriyā satiyā paccāsāya. tato ce uttariṃ nikkhipeyya, satiyā'pi paccāsāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu! app'iccho so, bhikkhu, kulaputto. sante'y'eva attani kusaladhamme na icchati parehi ñāyamāne.
example_2:
kāmaṃ kāmayamānassa,
tassa ce taṃ samijjhati,
addhā pītimano hoti,
laddhā macco yadicchati.
sbs_example_3:
na paro paraṃ nikubbetha, n'ātimaññetha katthaci naṃ kiñci
byārosanā, paṭighasaññā, n'āññam'aññassa dukkham'iccheyya.

sbs_example_5:

example_1: sace te, bhaggava, agaru viharemu āvesane ekarattan'ti. na kho me, bhante, garu. atthi c'ettha pabbajito paṭhamaṃ vās'ūpagato. sace so anujānāti, viharatha, bhante, yathāsukhan'ti.
example_2: avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā, app'evama bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṃ anujāneyya
sbs_example_3: na jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjitabbaṃ. yo paribhuñjeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa. anujānāmi tikoṭiparisuddhaṃ macchamaṃsaṃ, adiṭṭhaṃ assutaṃ aparisaṅkitan'ti.

example_1: satt'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sapattakantā sapattakaraṇā kodhanaṃ āgacchanti itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā. katame satta?
example_2: kathaṃ byākaramānā ... dhammassa c'ānudhammaṃ byākareyyāma, na ca koci sahadhammiko vād'ānupāto gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti?

example_1:
appamādaṃ pasaṃsanti,
puññakiriyāsu paṇḍitā,
appamatto ubho atthe,
adhiggaṇhāti paṇḍito.
example_2:
saddhammapūjā'pi nesaṃ tath'eva,

example_1: yattha nu kho, bhante, na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, sakkā nu kho so, bhante, gamanena lokassa anto ñātuṃ vā daṭṭhuṃ vā pāpuṇituṃ vā'ti?
example_2: idaṃ niccaṃ, idaṃ dhuvaṃ, idaṃ sassataṃ, idaṃ kevalaṃ, idaṃ acavanadhammaṃ, idañ'hi na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, ito ca pan'aññaṃ uttari nissaraṇaṃ n'atthī'ti
sbs_example_3: kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ loko āpanno, jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca, atha ca pan'imassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa

example_1: dīgharattaṃ kho maṃ tvaṃ, devi, iṭṭhehi kantehi piyehi manāpehi samudācarittha, atha ca pana maṃ tvaṃ pacchime kāle aniṭṭhehi akantehi appiyehi amanāpehi samudācarasī'ti
example_2: tassa evaṃ hoti, yo kho my'āyaṃ puggalo iṭṭho kanto manāpo, taṃ pare iṭṭhena kantena manāpena samudācarantī'ti. so tesu pemaṃ janeti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pemā pemaṃ jāyati.
sbs_example_3: kathañ'c'ānanda, satthāraṃ sāvakā mittavatāya samudācaranti, no sapattavatāya?

example_1:
uttiṭṭhe nappamajjeyya,
dhammaṃ sucaritaṃ care,
dhammacārī sukhaṃ seti,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.
example_2:
kiṃ'su chetvā sukhaṃ seti,
kiṃ'su chetvā na socati,
kissa'ssu ekadhammassa,
vadhaṃ rocesi gotamā'ti.
sbs_example_3: kacci, bhante, bhagavā sukham'asayitthā'ti? evaṃ, kumāra, sukham'asayitthaṃ. ye ca pana loke sukhaṃ senti, ahaṃ tesaṃ aññataro'ti

meaning_1: comprehends; understands; recognises; distinguishes; is aware (of)
example_1: viññāṇaṃ viññāṇan'ti, āvuso, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, viññāṇan'ti vuccatī'ti? vijānāti vijānātī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā viññāṇan'ti vuccati.
example_2:

example_1: na kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, ettāvatā saupavajjo'ti vadāmi. yo kho, sāriputta, tañ'ca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, aññañ'ca kāyaṃ upādiyati, tam'ahaṃ saupavajjo'ti vadāmi.

sbs_example_3: yāva'd'eva ñāṇamattāya paṭissatimattāya anissito ca viharati, na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.

meaning_1: directly knew; understood experientially; realized; lit. completely knew
example_1: yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tam'ahaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ. taṃ tathāgatassa viditaṃ, taṃ tathāgato na upaṭṭhāsi.
example_2: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā'ti abbhaññāsi.
sbs_example_3: yato ca khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ evaṃ assādañ'ca assādato ādīnavañ'ca ādīnavato nissaraṇañ'ca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ

meaning_1: palms placed together (as a token of respect)
example_1: tena kuṭikārakena bhikkhunā kuṭivatthuṃ sodhetvā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evam'assa vacanīyo
example_2: tassa heṭṭhābhāgaṃ sodhāpetvā pākāraparikkhepaṃ kārāpetvā vālukaṃ okirāpetvā dhajapaṭākaṃ ussāpetvā vanappatiṃ alaṅ'karitvā añjaliṃ karitvā, sace puttaṃ vā dhītaraṃ vā labheyyaṃ, tumhākaṃ mahāsakkāraṃ karissāmī'ti patthanaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
sbs_example_3: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa
sbs_example_4: atha kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante paṭhame yāme, uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā tena-añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
dhamm'ārāmo dhammarato,
dhammaṃ anuvicintayaṃ,
dhammaṃ anussaraṃ bhikkhu,
saddhammā na parihāyati.
example_2: so tena ñāṇadassanena na majjati nappamajjati na pamādaṃ āpajjati, appamatto samāno asamayavimokkhaṃ ārādheti. aṭṭhānam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ so bhikkhu tāya asamayavimuttiyā parihāyetha.
sbs_example_3: veditabbam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā parihāyāmi kusalehi dhammehi'. parihānañ'h'etaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) dāy'ādā vindare dhanan'ti tassa dāy'ādā'pi dhanaṃ na vindanti.
example_1:
tesaṃ sampannasīlānaṃ,
appamādavihārinaṃ,
samma'd'aññā vimuttānaṃ,
māro maggaṃ na vindati.
example_2:
yañ'ca kho sīlasampanno,
bhikkhu ḍahati tejasā,
na tassa puttā pasavo,
dāy'ādā vindare dhanaṃ,
anapaccā adāy'ādā,
tāl'āvatthū bhavanti te.
sbs_example_3:
uṭṭhānakālamhi anuṭṭhahāno, yuvā balī ālasiyaṃ upeto,
saṃsannasaṅkappamano kusīto, paññāya maggaṃ alaso na vindati.

example_1:
yaṃ me kaṅkhitam'aññāsi,
vicikicchā maṃ tārayi namo te,
muni monapathesu pattipatta,
akhila ādiccabandhu sorato'si.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi, aññāsi vata bho koṇḍañño, aññāsi vata bho koṇḍañño'ti!
sbs_example_3: upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti, tadā'pi so vadhako'va. vadhakañ'ca pana santaṃ na aññāsi, vadhako me'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tāvataken'eva tuṭṭhiṃ āpajjeyyātha
example_2: evaṃ puṭṭhā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā na c'eva sampāyissanti, uttariñ'ca vighātaṃ āpajjissanti. taṃ kissa hetu? yathā taṃ, bhikkhave, avisayasmiṃ.
sbs_example_3: tassā puriso sotena vuyhamāno kāse ce'pi gaṇheyya, te palujjeyyuṃ. so tatonidānaṃ anayabyasanaṃ āpajjeyya.
sbs_example_4: katamo ca, brāhmaṇa, maraṇadhammo samāno bhāyati, santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassa?
sbs_example_5: api ca kho mātugāmassa ucchādanaparimaddananhāpanasambāhanaṃ sādiyati. so taṃ assādeti, taṃ nikāmeti, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati.

meaning_1: practices; engages (in); commits (to); does; lit. yokes near
example_1: so tāya dhammapariyattiyā na divasaṃ atināmeti, n'āpi riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, anuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bhikkhu dhammavihārī hoti.
example_2: sukhavinicchayaṃ jaññā, sukhavinicchayaṃ ñatvā ajjhattaṃ sukham'anuyuñjeyya.
sbs_example_3:
surāmerayapānañ'ca, yo naro anuyuñjati.
idh'evam'eso lokasmiṃ, mūlaṃ khaṇati attano.
sbs_example_4: katapuñño'si tvaṃ, ānanda, padhānamanuyuñja, khippaṃ hohisi anāsavo'ti.

meaning_1: harms; hurts; injures; (comm) hurts; kills; destroys
example_1:
sukhakāmāni bhūtāni,
yo daṇḍena na hiṃsati,
attano sukham'esāno,
pecca so labhate sukhaṃ.
example_2:
na tena ariyo hoti,
yena pāṇāni hiṃsati,
ahiṃsā sabbapāṇānaṃ,
ariyo'ti pavuccati.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi usabho chinnavisāṇo sūrato sudanto suvinīto rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ anvāhiṇḍanto na kiñci hiṃsati pādena vā visāṇena vā
sbs_example_4:
yo'dha koci manussesu, parapāṇāni hiṃsati.
asmā lokā paramhā ca, ubhayā dhaṃsate naro.

meaning_1: follows a path; undertake a journey; travels
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ek'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya antamaso gām'antaram'pi aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, dve jāyampatikā parittaṃ sambalaṃ ādāya kantāramaggaṃ paṭipajjeyyuṃ
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi puriso sadhano sabhogo kantār'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya. so aparena samayena tamhā kantārā nitthareyya sotthinā abbhayena, na c'assa kiñci bhogānaṃ vayo.
sbs_example_4: so tehi yācitakehi bhogehi purakkhato parivuto antar'āpaṇaṃ paṭipajjeyya.

example_1: so evaṃ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇ'ātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato ahosiṃ nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī day'āpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī vihāsiṃ.
example_2: tadanuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
sbs_example_3:
sabbe saddhammagaruno, vihariṃsu viharanti ca.
athā'pi viharissanti, esā buddhāna dhammatā.
sbs_example_4: rājamahāmatto vā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricārayamāno kāmataṇhaṃ appahāya kāmapariḷāhaṃ appaṭivinodetvā vigatapipāso ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto vihāsi vā viharati vā viharissati vā.

commentary: (MNa) pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharontī'ti dupadam'pi tipadam'pi catuppadam'pi pañhaṃ karonti.
example_1: sāmaṃ vā taṃ, ānanda, kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, yaṃpaccay'āssa taṃ uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ. pare vā taṃ, ānanda, kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharonti, yaṃpaccay'āssa taṃ uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ.
example_2: te suṇanti, samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo amukaṃ nāma gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā osarissatī'ti. te pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharonti, imaṃ mayaṃ pañhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchissāma.
sbs_example_3: rūpaṃ rūpattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti, vedanaṃ vedanattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti, saññaṃ saññattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
attanā hi kataṃ pāpaṃ,
attajaṃ attasambhavaṃ,
abhimatthati dummedhaṃ,
vajiraṃ'v'asmamayaṃ maṇiṃ.
example_2: nappaṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṃ, nikkhittamaṇisuvaṇṇā samaṇā sakyaputtiyā apetajātarūparajatā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
passa cittakataṃ rūpaṃ, maṇinā kuṇḍalena ca.
aṭṭhiṃ tacena onaddhaṃ, saha vatthehi sobhati.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, gahapati, puriso yācitakaṃ bhogaṃ yācitvā yānaṃ vā poriseyyaṃ pavaramaṇikuṇḍalaṃ.

example_1: atha puriso āgaccheyya ghamm'ābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito. so taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā nhātvā ca pivitvā ca paccuttaritvā tatth'eva rukkhacchāyāya nisīdeyya vā nipajjeyya vā.
example_2: tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ ṭhito? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ nisīdeyyan'ti. so nisīdeyya. tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ nisinno? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ nipajjeyyan'ti. so nipajjeyya.
sbs_example_3: nisīdati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanisīdati, nipajjati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanipajjati.

meaning_1: considers (to be); takes (as); regards (as); views (as); deems (as)
example_1:
yo ca sītañ'ca uṇhañ'ca,
tiṇā bhiyyo na maññati,
karaṃ purisakiccāni,
so sukhā na vihāyati.
example_2: tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsissanti na sotaṃ odahissanti na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti na ca te dhamme uggahetabbaṃ pariyāpuṇitabbaṃ maññissanti.
sbs_example_3:
madhu'vā maññati bālo, yāva pāpaṃ na paccati,
yadā ca paccati pāpaṃ, bālo dukkhaṃ nigacchati.

example_1:
pāṇimhi ce vaṇo n'āssa,
hareyya pāṇinā visaṃ,
n'ābbaṇaṃ visam'anveti,
n'atthi pāpaṃ akubbato.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.
sbs_example_3: idha, gahapati, ariyasāvako vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato. ayaṃ vuccati, gahapati, cāgasampadā.
sbs_example_4: tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, ubho kaṇṇasotāni āviñcheyyāsi, pāṇinā gattāni anumajjeyyāsi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yass'indriyāni samathaṅ'gatāni,
assā yathā sārathinā sudantā,
pahīnamānassa anāsavassa,
devā'pi tassa pihayanti tādino.
example_2: yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ sārathissa āvikattā hoti. tesam'assa sārathi abhinimmadanāya vāyamati.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāreti, yadi vā katapubbaṃ yadi vā akatapubbaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto suṇāti.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā tiṇhena govikantanena kucchiṃ parikanteyya, evam'eva kho adhimattā vātā kucchiṃ parikantanti.
example_2: so santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena so yena yen'eva pakkamati samādāy'eva pakkamati
sbs_example_3: hatthesu, bhikkhave, sati ādānanikkhepanaṃ paññāyati, pādesu sati abhikkamapaṭikkamo paññāyati, pabbesu sati samiñjanapasāraṇaṃ paññāyati, kucchismiṃ sati jighacchā pipāsā paññāyati.

meaning_1: attachment; taking as mine; appropriation; acquisition; sense of ownership; identification; lit. placing near
commentary: (MNa) upadhī hontī'ti khandhūpadhi kilesūpadhi abhisaṅkhārūpadhi pañcakāmaguṇ'ūpadhī'ti ime upadhayo honti.
example_1: upadhi dukkhassa mūlan'ti, iti viditvā nirupadhi upadhisaṅkhaye vimutto upadhismiṃ vā kāyaṃ upasaṃharissati cittaṃ vā uppādessatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
example_2: tass'eva kho pana pubbe aviddasuno upadhī honti samattā samādinnā. ty'āssa pahīnā honti ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
sbs_example_3: etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yad'idaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabba-upadhippaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo nirodho nibbānan'ti.
sbs_example_4: idh'ānanda, bhikkhu upadhivivekā akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānā sabbaso kāyaduṭṭhullānaṃ paṭippassaddhiyā vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

construction: vi > vy > by + ā + karo + ti
example_1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ek'aṃsena byākaroti, vibhajjabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na vibhajja byākaroti, paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na paṭipucchā byākaroti, ṭhapanīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ṭhapeti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.
example_2: tena hi, gāmaṇi, taññ'ev'ettha paṭipucchissāmi. yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
dv'āhaṃ sakkaṃ apucchissaṃ, na me byākāsi cakkhumā,
yāvatatiyañ'ca dev'īsi, byākarotī'ti me sutaṃ.

meaning_1: explain; defines; describes; lit. makes distinct
construction: vi > vy > by + ā + karo + ti
example_1: tena kho pana samayena bhagavā parito parito janapadesu paricārake abbhatīte kālaṅ'kate upapattīsu byākaroti
example_2: kathaṃ byākaramānā ... dhammassa c'ānudhammaṃ byākareyyāma, na ca koci sahadhammiko vād'ānupāto gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: āyām'āvuso, yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamissāma. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocessāma. yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.

example_1: atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
example_2: yadā kho, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ na abhininnāmi, atha siṅgālo kummamhā nibbijja pakkāmi, otāraṃ alabhamāno.
sbs_example_3: āyasmā ānando tā bhikkhuniyo dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkāmi
sbs_example_4: atha kho so, bhikkhave, mudumūsi gocarāya pakkāmi. tam'enaṃ biḷāro gahetvā sahasā asaṅkhāditvā ajjhohari.

meaning_1: may it be!; may there be!
example_1:
dhī taṃ jammi jare atthu,
dubbaṇṇakaraṇī jare,
tāva manoramaṃ bimbaṃ,
jarāya abhimadditaṃ.
example_2: asa'icc'etāya dhātuyā tussa vibhattissa tthuttaṃ hoti, dhātv'antassa lopo ca. atthu.
sbs_example_3: atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo sakapitu nivesane n'eva dānaṃ alattha na paccakkhānaṃ, añña'd'atthu akkosam'eva alattha
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: name of a prominent group of Khattiyas based in Vesālī
example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ. atha kho bhaddiyo licchavi yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.
example_2: ekacce licchavī evam'āhaṃsu, kiṃ so bhavamāno saccako nigaṇṭhaputto yo bhagavato vādaṃ āropessati, atha kho bhagavā saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa vādaṃ āropessatī'ti?
sbs_example_3: assosi kho āyasmā sāriputto sunakkhattassa licchaviputtassa vesāliyaṃ parisati evaṃ vācaṃ bhāsamānassa, n'atthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso.
sbs_example_4: ime, bhante, licchavikumārakā caṇḍā pharusā apajahā ... kul'itthīnam'pi kulakumārīnam'pi pacchāliyaṃ khipanti.

example_1:
yo ve uppatitaṃ kodhaṃ,
rathaṃ bhantaṃ'va vāraye,
tam'ahaṃ sārathiṃ brūmi,
rasmiggāho itaro jano.
example_2:
ehi sārathi gacchāhi,
rathaṃ niyyādayāh'imaṃ,
ārogyaṃ brāhmaṇiṃ vajja,
pabbaji dāni brāhmaṇo,
sujāto tīhi rattīhi,
tisso vijjā aphassayi.
sbs_example_3: arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yesañ'ca mayaṃ cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāma tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā
example_2: antamaso kus'aggena'pi anādiyitvā tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ navaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.

example_2:

example_1:

meaning_1: does not take delight (in); is not pleased (with); does not find pleasure (in)
example_1:

meaning_1: who takes pleasure in; who enjoys

commentary:
(SNa) jhāyī'ti dvīhi jhānehi jhāyī.
(SNt) dvīhi jhānehī'ti ārammaṇa-lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhāna-lakkhaṇehi dvīhi jhānehi.
example_1:

meaning_1: name of the 7th previous Buddha; lit. insightful; who sees distinctly

meaning_1: when you all; while you all

example_1: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.
example_2: ārocayāmi vo, bhikkhave, paṭivedayāmi vo, bhikkhave, mā vo sāmaññ'atthikānaṃ sataṃ sāmaññ'attho parihāyi, sati uttariṃ karaṇīye'.

example_1:
sabbe saddhammagaruno,
vihaṃsu viharanti ca.
athā'pi viharissanti,
esā buddhāna dhammatā.

example_1:
anuddhato acapalo,
nipako saṃvut'indriyo,
sobhati paṃsukūlena,
sīho'va girigabbhare.
example_2:
tapanīyakatā'va dhītikā,
vicarasi cittalat'eva accharā,
kāsikasukhumehi vaggubhi,
sobhasī suvasanehi n'ūpame.

example_1:
ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.
example_2: tasmā't'iha te, gahapati, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, āturakāyassa me sato cittaṃ anāturaṃ bhavissatī'ti. evañ'hi te, gahapati, sikkhitabban'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evaṃ vutte tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva ārabbha sati udapādi, aho nūna bhagavā, aho nūna sugato, yo imesaṃ dhammānaṃ sukusalo'ti. bhagavā, bhante, kusalo, bhagavā pakataññū abhisaññānirodhassa.
example_2: tassa mayhaṃ bhikkhave etadahosi, kimhi nu kho sati jarāmaraṇaṃ hoti kiṃpaccayā jarāmaraṇan'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tassa rūpaṃ ... vedanaṃ ... saññaṃ ... saṅkhāre ... viññāṇaṃ samanvesato yāvatā viññāṇassa gati, yam'pi'ssa taṃ hoti ahan'ti vā maman'ti vā asmī'ti vā tam'pi tassa na hotī'ti.
example_2: kiṃ pan'imassa mattaṭṭhakassa kāyassa taṇh'upādinnassa ahan'ti vā maman'ti vā asmī'ti vā? atha khv'āssa no't'ev'ettha hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ye santāne hīnā dhammā, yāva nibbānato mamaṃ nassantu sabbadā y'eva.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yañ'hi taṃ, āvuso, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti, mamaṃ taṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti.
example_2:
yo hoti bhikkhu arahaṃ katāvī,
khīṇ'āsavo antimadehadhārī,
ahaṃ vadāmī'ti'pi so vadeyya,
mamaṃ vadantī'ti'pi so vadeyyā'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: madassa ca pahānāya pamādassa ca pahānāya, atthi majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati
example_2: tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato yo yobbane yobbanamado so sabbaso vā pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti. idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca jarādhammo'mhi, jaraṃ anatīto'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, alaṃ nu kho tassa purisassa aññathattāyā'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: bhagavā etadavoca, bhadd'ekarattassa vo, bhikkhave, uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: it belongs (to); lit. it will be
example_1: ratanaṃ vā pana bhikkhunā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipitabbaṃ, yassa bhavissati, so harissatī'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

meaning_1: draws a conclusion; understands; takes as; lit. leads
example_1: iminā tvaṃ dhammena diṭṭhena viditena akālikena pattena pariyogāḷhena atīt'ānāgate nayaṃ nehi

meaning_1: (adds a question mark) surely?; does one not?
example_1: yo so, sāriputta, ariyasāvako tathāgate ek'antagato abhippasanno, na so tathāgate vā tathāgatasāsane vā kaṅkheyya vā vicikiccheyya vā'ti?

meaning_1: having the nature (of); characterized (by); marked (with); with the fundamental attribute (of)
example_1:
na tvaṃ bāle pajānāsi,
yathā arahataṃ vaco,
aniccā sabbasaṅkhārā,
uppādavayadhammino,
uppajjitvā nirujjhanti,
tesaṃ vūpasamo sukho'ti.
example_2:
byādhidhammā jarādhammā,
atho maraṇadhammino,
yathā dhammā tathā sattā,
jigucchanti puthujjanā.

meaning_1: will cause; will allow (to happen); lit. will give (a chance)
example_1: n'āhaṃ taṃ pamāṇaṃ atikkamitvā rajjan'ādivasena uppajjituṃ dassāmī'ti evam'ettha attho daṭṭhabbo.

example_1:
satiyā taṃ nibandhissaṃ,
payutto te damessāmi,
vīriyadhuraniggahito,
na yito dūraṃ gamissase cittā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye,
appamatto vihassati,
pahāya jātisaṃsāraṃ,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.
example_2:
etañ'hi tumhe paṭipannā,

akkhāto vo mayā maggo,
aññāya sallakantanaṃ.

meaning_1: name of a monk; Kāḷudāyi; lit. rising
example_1: evaṃ vutte āyasmā udāyī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, hatthim'eva nu kho, bhante, mahantaṃ brahantaṃ kāy'upapannaṃ jano disvā evam'āha, nāgo vata, bho, nāgo'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, asappuriso yo hoti parassa avaṇṇo taṃ apuṭṭho'pi pātu karoti, ko pana vādo puṭṭhassa! puṭṭho kho pana pañh'ābhinīto ahāpetvā alambitvā paripūraṃ vitthārena parassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
example_2: evaṃ saṃsaṭṭho āyasmā moḷiyaphagguno bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ viharati, sace koci bhikkhu āyasmato moḷiyaphaggunassa sammukhā tāsaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, ten'āyasmā moḷiyaphagguno kupito anattamano adhikaraṇam'pi karoti.

example_1: kathañ'hi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocessasi!
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ uddhaṃ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā tacapariyantaṃ pūraṃ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati
example_2: yathā pana aññe sattā mātukucchito nikkhamantā paṭikūlena asucinā makkhitā nikkhamanti, na evaṃ bodhisatto.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: puṇṇo nāma, āvuso, āyasmā mantāṇiputto amhākaṃ navakānaṃ sataṃ bah'ūpakāro hoti. so amhe iminā ovādena ovadati, upādāya, āvuso ānanda, asmī'ti hoti, no anupādāya.
example_2: amhākam'pi hi, bho gotama, gaṇakānaṃ gaṇan'ājīvānaṃ dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṃ, saṅkhāne.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: unordained person; who is not a higher-ordained; novice monastic or layperson; lit. not attained
commentary: (VIN 2.5.1.4) anupasampanno nāma bhikkhuñ'ca bhikkhuniñ'ca ṭhapetvā avaseso anupasampanno nāma.
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannaṃ padaso dhammaṃ vāceyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannena uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: with eyes; who can see; who has vision; gifted with sight; lit. having eyes quality
example_1:
maggān'aṭṭh'aṅgiko seṭṭho,
saccānaṃ caturo padā,
virāgo seṭṭho dhammānaṃ,
dvipadānañ'ca cakkhumā.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso āpāthagatānaṃ rūpānaṃ adassanakāmo assa, so nimīleyya vā aññena vā apalokeyya.
sbs_example_3: yo cakkhumā mohamal'āpakaṭṭho, sāmaṃ va buddho sugato vimutto, mārassa pāsā vinimocayanto, pāpesi khemaṃ janataṃ vineyyaṃ
sbs_example_4: tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.
example_2: pariccattaṃ kho rañño nāgassa jīvitaṃ. n'atthi dāni kiñci rañño nāgassa akaraṇīyan'ti.
sbs_example_3: yassa khv'āhaṃ atthāya cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ so me attho abhinipphanno. handa dāni paṭisaṃharāmi.
sbs_example_4: ñāṇañ'ca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi, akuppā me vimutti, ayam'antimā jāti, n'atthidāni punabbhavo'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_4: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ,
yadā kāyaṃ jahant'imaṃ,
apaviddho tadā seti,
parabhattaṃ acetanaṃ.
example_2:
dassanaṃ me atikkante,
sasaṅghe lokanāyake,
sayanā vuṭṭhahitvāna,
pallaṅkaṃ ābhujiṃ tadā.
sbs_example_3: upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti, tadā'pi so vadhako'va. vadhakañ'ca pana santaṃ na aññāsi, vadhako me'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: in the evening; at night; late at night
example_1: tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītithālipākasahassāni ahesuṃ, sāyaṃ pātaṃ bhatt'ābhihāro abhihariyittha.
example_2: atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atidhāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti.
sbs_example_3: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nigrodhakappo pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto vihāraṃ pavisati, sāyaṃ vā nikkhamati aparajju vā kāle
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tena vattabbo, passasī'ti. āma passāmī'ti. āyatiṃ saṃvareyyāsī'ti
example_2: iti kho, ānanda, kammaṃ khettaṃ, viññāṇaṃ bījaṃ, taṇhā sneho. avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ hīnāya dhātuyā viññāṇaṃ patiṭṭhitaṃ evaṃ āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti hoti.
sbs_example_3: tassa me, bhante, bhagavā accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṁvarāyāti.
sbs_example_4: yathā ca pahīnāya vicikicchāya āyatiṃ anuppādo hoti tañ'ca pajānāti.
sbs_example_5: sace so assutavā puthujjano āyatiṃ punabbhavāya ceteti, evañ'hi so moghapuriso suhatataro hoti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: who has gone beyond; who has crossed over
example_1:
yaṃ manussā namassanti,
sabbadhammāna pāraguṃ,
devā'pi taṃ namassanti,
iti me arahato sutaṃ.
example_2:
muñca pure muñca pacchato,
majjhe muñca bhavassa pāragū,
sabbattha vimuttamānaso,
na punaṃ jātijaraṃ upehisi.
sbs_example_3:
tasmā jantu sadā sato, kāmāni parivajjaye,
te pahāya tare oghaṃ, nāvaṃ sitvā'va pāragū'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yo'pi hetu yo'pi paccayo cakkhuviññāṇassa uppādāya, so'pi hetu so'pi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī. aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ cakkhuviññāṇaṃ kuto niccaṃ bhavissati!
example_2: Ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yaṁ tiṭṭhateva nibbānaṁ, tiṭṭhati nibbānagāmī maggo, tiṭṭhati bhavaṁ gotamo samādapetā
sbs_example_3: taṃ kissa hetu? tathārūpānaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena vūpakaṭṭho viharati, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.
sbs_example_4: asādhāraṇena ca ñāṇena samannāgato bhavissāmi, hetu ca me sudiṭṭho bhavissati, hetusamuppannā ca dhammā.
sbs_example_5: aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, hetū aṭṭha paccayā ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāya appaṭiladdhāya paṭilābhāya, paṭiladdhāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattanti. katame aṭṭha?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: entire; whole; complete; lit. having everything quality
example_1: n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti
example_2: iti uddham'adho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabb'attatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā viharati.
sbs_example_3: samaṃ pādaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipati, samaṃ uddharati, samaṃ sabbāvantehi pādatalehi bhūmiṃ phusati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā
example_2: añña'd'atthu, ayaṃ varāko idāni marissati, yaṃ yadeva hi ayaṃ padaṃ nikkhipati, tena tena santike maraṇassa hotī'ti taṃ jano karuṇāyati.
sbs_example_3: puññassa-idāni katassa yān'aññāni katāni me, tesañ'ca bhāgino hontu satt'ānant'āppamāṇakā
sbs_example_4: tattha purimesu catūsu kiccesu idāni suriy'ālokassa atthitāya n'atthi, aparāni tīṇi bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ jānantehi bhikkhūhi katāni pariniṭṭhitāni honti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: speaker (of); who tells (about); who speaks (about); who expresses (about)
example_1:
tumhehi kiccam'ātappaṃ,
akkhātāro tathāgatā,
paṭipannā pamokkhanti,
jhāyino mārabandhanā.
example_2:
akkheyyañ'ca pariññāya,
akkhātāraṃ na maññati,
tañ'hi tassa na hotī'ti,
yena naṃ vajjā na tassa atthi.
sbs_example_3: pisuṇaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: evil; wicked; malevolent; lit. having evil quality
example_1: luddo'ti kho, bhikkhave, mārassetaṃ pāpimato adhivacanaṃ. papatā'ti kho, bhikkhave, lābhasakkārasilokassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. suttakan'ti kho, bhikkhave, nandirāgassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
example_2: na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipannā
sbs_example_3: maññamāno kho, bhikkhave, baddho mārassa, amaññamāno mutto pāpimato.
sbs_example_4: ayaṃ vuccati ariyasāvako akaraṇīyo mārassa akaraṇīyo pāpimato'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: who has perfect knowledge; who has complete understanding
commentary:
(MNa) catumaggañāṇasaṅkhātehi vedehi akusaladhammānaṃ gatattā vedagū hoti, viditattā'ti attho.
(THa) vedagū'ti vedena gato maggañāṇena nibbānaṃ gato adhigato, cattāri vā saccāni pariññā-pahāna-sacchikiriyā-bhāvan'ābhisamayavasena abhisamecca ṭhito.
(SNa) jātu vedagū'ti ahaṃ ek'aṃsen'eva vedagū, vedasaṅkhātena ñāṇena neyyesu gato, vedaṃ vā gato adhigato, paṇḍito'ham'asmī'ti attho.
example_1:
sukhino vata ye akiñcanā,
vedaguno hi janā akiñcanā,
sakiñcanaṃ passa vihaññamānaṃ,
jano janasmiṃ paṭibandhacitto.
example_2:
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ,
maññāmi taṃ vedaguṃ bhāvit'attaṃ,
kuto nu dukkhā samudāgatā ime,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca bhikkhu vedagū hoti? vidit'āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, saṃkilesikā, ponobbhavikā, sadarā, dukkhavipākā, āyatiṃ, jātijarāmaraṇiyā
sbs_example_4:
na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā,
sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so,
na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo,
anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.
sbs_example_5:
sa ve samm'addaso bhikkhu, parijānāti vedanā.
so vedanā pariññāya, diṭṭhe dhamme anāsavo.
kāyassa bhedā dhammaṭṭho, saṅkhyaṃ n'opeti vedagū'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
kadā nu'haṃ pabbatakandarāsu,
ekākiyo addutiyo vihassaṃ,
aniccato sabbabhavaṃ vipassaṃ,
taṃ me idaṃ taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.
example_2: samanuggāhīyamāno'ti yaṃ vatthu paṭiññātaṃ hoti tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ samanuggāhīyamāno, kin'te adhigataṃ, kin'ti te adhigataṃ, kadā te adhigataṃ, kattha te adhigataṃ, katame te kilesā pahīnā, katamesaṃ tvaṃ dhammānaṃ lābhī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
kadā nu rūpe amite ca sadde,
gandhe rase phusitabbe ca dhamme,
ādittato'haṃ samathehi yutto,
paññāya dacchaṃ tad'idaṃ kadā me.
sbs_example_4: kadā nu'haṃ dubbacanena vutto, tatonimittaṃ vimano na hessaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: learned; well-studied; educated; initiated; lit. having heard quality
example_1: tatra, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho eta'r'ahi rūpena khajjāmi. atītam'p'āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam'eva rūpena khajjiṃ, seyyathā'pi eta'r'ahi paccuppannena rūpena khajjāmi
example_2: idha, gahapati, sutavā ariyasāvako ariyānaṃ dassāvī ariyadhammassa kovido ariyadhamme suvinīto sappurisānaṃ dassāvī sappurisadhammassa kovido sappurisadhamme suvinīto na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati
sbs_example_3: evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmim'pi nibbindati, vedanāya'pi nibbindati, saññāya'pi nibbindati, saṅkhāresu'pi nibbindati, viññāṇasmim'pi nibbindati.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: tiṭṭhanti kho pana, bhikkhave, tatth'eva pañc'indriyāni. ath'ettha sutavato ariyasāvakassa avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: having stamina; strong; powerful; firm; lit. having strength quality
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāya thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.
example_2: āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.
sbs_example_3: thāmavā hoti yāva jīvitamaraṇapariyādānā thāmaṃ upadaṃsetā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: Himalayas; Himalayan mountains; lit. having snow quality
example_1:
dūre santo pakāsenti,
himavanto'va pabbato,
asant'ettha na dissanti,
rattiṃ khittā yathā sarā.
example_2:
sa ve accaruci nāgo,
himavā'v'aññe sil'uccaye,
sabbesaṃ nāganāmānaṃ,
saccanāmo anuttaro.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: fulfilled; completed; finished; perfected; epithet of an arahant; lit. having lived quality
notes: see PED vusita for discussion on etymology
example_1: yo so, bhante, bhikkhu arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojano samma'd'aññāvimutto, so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti
example_2: sattaṭṭhānakusalo, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividh'ūpaparikkhī imasmiṃ dhammavinaye kevalī vusitavā uttamapuriso'ti vuccati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: iti'pi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) vattā'ti odhunanavattā. bhikkhūnaṃ ajjhācāraṃ disvā, ajja kathessāmi, sve kathessāmī'ti kathāvavatthānaṃ na karoti, tasmiṃ tasmiṃ yeva ṭhāne ovadati anusāsatī'ti attho.
example_1: so h'āvuso, bhagavā jānaṃ jānāti, passaṃ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto, vattā pavattā, atthassa ninnetā, amatassa dātā, dhammassāmī tathāgato
example_2: āraddhavīriyo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vattā, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vacanakkhamo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. codako, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. pāpagarahī, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: beautiful; good-looking; lit. having appearance quality
example_1:
yathā'pi ruciraṃ pupphaṃ,
vaṇṇavantaṃ agandhakaṃ,
evaṃ subhāsitā vācā,
aphalā hoti akubbato.
example_2: na, bhikkhave, nevāpiko nivāpaṃ nivapati migajātānaṃ, imaṃ me nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ migajātā paribhuñjantā dīgh'āyukā vaṇṇavanto ciraṃ dīgham'addhānaṃ yāpentū'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: who has heard about; lit. having heard quality
example_1: evaṃ abhisaddahati, ime kho te dhammā ye me pubbe sutavā ahesuṃ, ten'āhaṃ eta'r'ahi kāyena ca phusitvā viharāmi, paññāya ca ativijjha passāmī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: having heartwood; lit. having essence quality
example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, puriso sār'atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkamm'eva mūlaṃ, atikkamma khandhaṃ, sākhāpalāse sāraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ maññeyya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: friendliness; collaboration; mutual assistance; good relationship; lit. holding together
example_1: cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, saṅgahavatthūni. katamāni cattāri? dānaṃ, peyyavajjaṃ, atthacariyā, samānattatā, imāni kho, bhikkhave, cattāri saṅgahavatthūnī'ti.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca, ayam'pi dhammo sāraṇīyo piyakaraṇo garukaraṇo saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: inclusion (in); encompassing; grouping (of); lit. holding together
example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, yāni kānici jaṅgalānaṃ pāṇānaṃ padajātāni sabbāni tāni hatthipade samodhānaṃ gacchanti, hatthipadaṃ tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati yadidaṃ mahantattena, evam'eva kho, āvuso, ye keci kusalā dhammā sabb'ete catūsu ariyasaccesu saṅgahaṃ gacchanti.
example_2: so evaṃ pajānāti, evañ'hi kira imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ saṅgaho sannipāto samavāyo hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yo ubho'nte viditvāna,
majjhe mantā na lippati,
taṃ brūmi mahāpuriso'ti,
so'dha sibbinim'accagā'ti.
example_2:
mūlaṃ papañcasaṅkhāya,
mantā asmī'ti sabbam'uparundhe,
yā kāci taṇhā ajjhattaṃ,
tāsaṃ vinayā sadā sato sikkhe.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: master; lord; boss; employer; lit. supporter
example_1: sa kho so, bhikkhave, paṇḍito byatto kusalo sūdo sakassa bhattu nimittaṃ uggaṇhāti, idaṃ vā me ajja bhattu sūpeyyaṃ ruccati, imassa vā abhiharati, imassa vā bahuṃ gaṇhāti, imassa vā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
padumaṃ yathā kokanadaṃ sugandhaṃ,
pāto siyā phullam'avītagandhaṃ,
aṅgīrasaṃ passa virocamānaṃ,
tapantam'ādiccam'iv'antalikkhe'ti.
example_2: atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atidhāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (of fire) worships; attends (to) looks after; lit. walks around
example_1:
yo ca vassasataṃ jantu,
aggiṃ paricare vane,
ekañ'ca bhāvit'attānaṃ,
muhuttam'api pūjaye,
sā'y'eva pūjanā seyyo,
yañ'ce vassasataṃ hutaṃ.
example_2: no ce allāni gomayāni āmaseyyāsi, haritāni tiṇāni āmaseyyāsi, no ce haritāni tiṇāni āmaseyyāsi, aggiṃ paricareyyāsi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: attends (to); looks after; tends (to); lit. walks around
example_1: etañ'hi, āvuso, sāvakassa patirūpaṃ yaṃ satthāraṃ paricareyya manāpen'eva, no amanāpena. anupavajjaṃ channo bhikkhu satthaṃ āharissatī'ti, evam'etaṃ, āvuso sāriputta, dhārehī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchābhūmakā kamaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā aggiparicārikā udak'orohakā soceyyāni paññapenti, tes'āhaṃ soceyyāni rocemī'ti
example_2: brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udak'orohakā aggiparicārakā. te mataṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yathā pure tathā pacchā,
yathā pacchā tathā pure,
yathā adho tathā uddhaṃ,
yathā uddhaṃ tathā adho.
example_2: so tayā evaṃ ovadīyamāno evaṃ anusāsīyamāno ummaggaṃ gahetvā pacchāmukho gaccheyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco, maṃsaṃ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṃ vakkaṃ, hadayaṃ yakanaṃ kilomakaṃ pihakaṃ papphāsaṃ
example_2: āraddhavīriyo viharati, kāmaṃ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsalohitaṃ, yaṃ taṃ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṃ, na taṃ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa saṇṭhānaṃ bhavissatī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ime kho, bhikkhave, dve sukkā dhammā lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti vā.
example_2: etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (of a talk) speaker; lit. doer; maker
example_1: tatra bhikkhu vivekaninnena cittena vivekapoṇena vivekapabbhārena vivek'aṭṭhena nekkhamm'ābhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ'y'eva kathaṃ kattā hoti
example_2: ko nu kho, bhikkhave, jātibhūmiyaṃ jātibhūmakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ evaṃ sambhāvito, attanā ca app'iccho app'icchakathañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā, attanā ca santuṭṭho santuṭṭhikathañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (MNa) kattā nimmātā'ti lokassa kattā ca nimmātā ca, pathavī-himavanta-sineru-cakkavāḷa-mahāsamudda-candima-sūriyā ca iminā nimmitā'ti dīpeti.
example_1: eso hi, bhikkhu, brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto añña'd'atthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṃ.
example_2: sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sed'āvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi imāni cattāri pattakammāni kattā hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: who has psychic powers; possessing supernatural ability; lit. having power quality
example_1: mahantasmiṃ kho pana lokasannivāse santi samaṇabrāhmaṇā iddhimanto dibbacakkhukā paracittaviduno. te dūrato'pi passanti, āsannā'pi na dissanti, cetasā'pi cittaṃ pajānanti.
example_2: bhūtapubb'āhaṃ, bhante, rohitasso nāma isi ahosiṃ bhojaputto iddhimā vehāsaṅ'gamo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: abhibhuṃ abhibhūto sañjānāti, abhibhuṃ abhibhūto saññatvā abhibhuṃ maññati, abhibhusmiṃ maññati, abhibhūto maññati, abhibhuṃ me'ti maññati, abhibhuṃ abhinandati. taṃ kissa hetu? apariññātaṃ tassā'ti vadāmi.
example_2: eso hi, bhikkhu, brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto añña'd'atthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary:
(VIN 2.5.2.5) seyyaṃ nāma bhisi, cimilikā uttar'attharaṇaṃ, bhūm'attharaṇaṃ, taṭṭikā, cammakhaṇḍo, nisīdanaṃ, paccattharaṇaṃ, tiṇasanthāro, paṇṇasanthāro.
(ANa) seyyā'ti mañcapallaṅkādisayanaṃ.
example_1: so ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bavhābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato vā, na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyā-āvasatha-padīpeyyassa.
example_2: bhavissanti, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ licchavī sukhumālā mudutalunahatthapādā te mudukāsu seyyāsu tūlabimbohanāsu yāvasūriy'uggamanā seyyaṃ kappissanti.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya anāpucchā vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: could go; would move; would walk
commentary: (MNa) yaṃnūn'āhaṃ saṇikaṃ gaccheyyan'ti kiṃ me iminā sīghagamanena, saṇikaṃ gacchissāmī'ti cintesi.
example_1: pathaviyā'pi ummujjanimujjaṃ kareyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi udake, udake'pi abhijjamāno gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pathaviyaṃ, ākāse'pi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pakkhī sakuṇo
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso sīghaṃ gaccheyya. tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ sīghaṃ gacchāmi? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ saṇikaṃ gaccheyyan'ti. so saṇikaṃ gaccheyya.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya anāpucchā vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: so tayā evaṃ ovadīyamāno evaṃ anusāsīyamāno ummaggaṃ gahetvā pacchāmukho gaccheyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: complete comprehension (of); full understanding (of); comprehensive knowledge (of)
example_1: evaṃvādiṃ kho maṃ, bhikkhave, evam'akkhāyiṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, samaṇo gotamo na kāmānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, na rūpānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, na vedanānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpetī'ti.
example_2: katamā ca, bhikkhave, pariññā? rāgakkhayo, dosakkhayo, mohakkhayo, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, pariññā
sbs_example_3: yesaṃ pariññāya dharamāno so bhagavā evaṃ bahulaṃ sāvake vineti
sbs_example_4: sabb'upādānapariññāya dhammo cakkhuñ'ca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṃ. tiṇṇaṃ saṅgati phasso.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: confidence (in); assurance (in); conviction (in); lit. putting heart
example_1: tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi saddhā, mayhaṃ'p'atthi saddhā, na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi vīriyaṃ, mayhaṃ'p'atthi vīriyaṃ
example_2: alam'eva saddhāpabbajitena kulaputtena vīriyaṃ ārabhituṃ
sbs_example_3: ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā assaddhā jīvik'atthā na saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitā saṭhā māyāvino ketabino uddhatā unnaḷā capalā ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: could be; may be; might be; should be
example_1:
kāmesu n'ābhigijjheyya,
manas'ānāvilo siyā,
kusalo sabbadhammānaṃ,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.
example_2:
padumaṃ yathā kokanadaṃ sugandhaṃ,
pāto siyā phullam'avītagandhaṃ,
aṅgīrasaṃ passa virocamānaṃ,
tapantam'ādiccam'iv'antalikkhe'ti.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
sbs_example_4:
attā hi attano nātho,
ko hi nātho paro siyā,
attanā hi sudantena,
nāthaṃ labhati dullabhaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
atta'd'atthaṃ par'atthena, bahunā'pi na hāpaye,
atta'd'attham'abhiññāya, sadatthapasuto siyā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave makkaṭo araññe pavane caramāno sākhaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati
example_2:
purimaṃ pahāya aparaṃ sitāse,
ej'ānugā te na taranti saṅgaṃ,
te uggahāyanti nirassajanti,
kapī'va sākhaṃ pamuñcaṃ gahāyaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ saṃkaḍḍhitvā, kullaṃ bandhitvā, taṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttareyyan'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: way; path of progress; path of practice
example_1:
ucc'āvacā hi paṭipadā,
samaṇena pakāsitā,
na pāraṃ diguṇaṃ yanti,
na'y'idaṃ ekaguṇaṃ mutaṃ.
example_2:
akittayī vivaṭacakkhu,
sakkhidhammaṃ parissayavinayaṃ,
paṭipadaṃ vadehi bhaddante,
pātimokkhaṃ athavā'pi samādhiṃ.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho bhikkhave dukkhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi.
sbs_example_4: api c'āhaṃ, āvuso, imasmiṃ'y'eva byāmamatte kaḷebare sasaññimhi samanake lokañ'ca paññāpemi lokasamudayañ'ca lokanirodhañ'ca lokanirodhagāminiñ'ca paṭipadan'ti.
sbs_example_5: sabbamaññitasamugghātasāruppaṃ vo, bhikkhave, paṭipadaṃ desessāmi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) sikkhā karaṇīyā'ti tividhā'pi sikkhā kātabbā. yog'ādīsu yogo'ti payogo. chando'ti kattukamyatākusalacchando. ussoḷhī'ti sabbasahaṃ adhimattavīriyaṃ.
example_1:
sv'āhaṃ idha pañca sikkhā karitvā,
paṭipajjitvā tathāgatassa dhamme,
dvepatham'agamāsiṃ coramajjhe,
te maṃ tattha vadhiṃsu bhogahetu.
example_2: parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
sbs_example_3: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth'etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: attā me uppajjati ca veti cā'ti icc'assa evam'āgataṃ hoti. tasmā taṃ na upapajjati, cakkhu attā'ti yo vadeyya. iti cakkhu anattā.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, sammukhā m'etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan'ti.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
abalā naṃ balīyanti,
maddant'enaṃ parissayā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
nāvaṃ bhinnam'iv'odakaṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sāmuddikāya nāvāya vettabandhanabaddhāya vassamāsāni udake pariyādāya hem'antikena thalaṃ ukkhittāya vāt'ātapaparetāni vettabandhanāni.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udak'aṇṇavaṃ … na c'assa nāvā santāraṇī uttarasetu vā apārā pāraṃ gamanāya.

example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yā kāci mahānadiyo, seyyath'idaṃ gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī, tā mahāsamuddaṃ patvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni, mahāsamuddo'tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti

example_1: so kupito anattamano sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ūmibhayassa bhīto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvatto.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī cātumahāpathe nikkhittā assa. atha cha purisā āgaccheyyuṃ byābhaṅgihatthā. te yavakalāpiṃ chahi byābhaṅgīhi haneyyuṃ. evañ'hi sā, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī suhatā assa chahi byābhaṅgīhi haññamānā.
example_2: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchā laṅghati, kubbaraṃ hanati, tidaṇḍaṃ bhañjati. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo assadoso.

meaning_1: name; label; concept; idea; notion; impression; representation; symbol
example_1:

example_2: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.

meaning_1: wisdom; knowledge; understanding; insight; distinctive knowledge
example_1:

hirī īsā mano yottaṃ,
sati me phālapācanaṃ.
example_2:

meaning_1: name of the Buddha's chief female disciple, foremost female donor to the Saṅgha; lit. April-May
commentary: (AN 1.259) etad'aggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvikānaṃ upāsikānaṃ dāyikānaṃ yadidaṃ visākhā migāramātā.
example_1: idha, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakamm'anto hoti, saṅgahitaparijano, bhattu manāpaṃ carati, sambhataṃ anurakkhati.
example_2: atha satthā navahi māsehi cārikaṃ caritvā puna sāvatthiṃ agamāsi. visākhāya-api pāsāde kammaṃ navahi māsehi niṭṭhitaṃ
sbs_example_3: catūhi kho, visākhe, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo idhalokavijayāya paṭipanno hoti, ayaṃsa loko āraddho hoti. katamehi catūhi?

meaning_1: gnosis; spiritual insight; enlightenment; final knowledge
example_1: katame satta phalā satt'ānisaṃsā? diṭṭh'eva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti. no ce diṭṭh'eva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, atha maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti.
example_2:
jhāyiṃ virajam'āsīnaṃ,
katakiccaṃ anāsavaṃ,
pāraguṃ sabbadhammānaṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
aññāvimokkhaṃ pabrūhi,
avijjāya pabhedanaṃ.
sbs_example_3: anaññātañ'ñassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ
sbs_example_5: iti kho, bhikkhave, yāvatā saññāsamāpatti tāvatā aññāpaṭivedho

example_1: idh'āvuso, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa bhikkhuno kāmacchando pahīno hoti, byāpādo pahīno hoti, thīnamiddhaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, vicikicchā pahīnā hoti
example_2: tassa evaṃ yoniso manasikaroto tīṇi saṃyojanāni pahīyanti, sakkāyadiṭṭhi, vicikicchā, sīlabbataparāmāso. ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā dassanā pahātabbā
sbs_example_3: vicikicchaṃ pahāya tiṇṇavicikiccho viharati akathaṃkathī kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchāya cittaṃ parisodheti
sbs_example_4: ayoniso, bhikkhave, manasi karoto anuppannā c'eva vicikicchā uppajjati uppannā ca vicikicchā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati

meaning_1: end; finish; conclusion; perfection; lit. stand down
example_1:
niṭṭhaṅ'gato asantāsī,
vītataṇho anaṅgaṇo,
acchindi bhavasallāni,
antimo'yaṃ samussayo.

example_2: paribbājikā nāma bhikkhuniñ'ca sikkhamānañ'ca sāmaṇeriñ'ca ṭhapetvā yā kāci paribbājikasamāpannā.

meaning_1: (in debate) procedure; mode of conduct; rules of engagement
commentary: (ANa) paṭipadāya saṇṭhātī'ti gehe nisīdāpetvā yāgukhajjak'ādīni datvā yāva bhattaṃ niṭṭhāti, tasmiṃ antare nisinno pañhaṃ pucchati. sappi'ādīni bhesajjāni aṭṭhavidhāni pānakāni vatthacchādanamālāgandh'ādīni vā ādāya vihāraṃ gantvā tāni datvā divāṭṭhānaṃ pavisitvā okāsaṃ kāretvā pañhaṃ pucchati. evañ'hi vattaṃ ñatvā pucchanto paṭipadāya saṇṭhāti nāma.
example_1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhāti parikappe na saṇṭhāti aññātavāde na saṇṭhāti paṭipadāya na saṇṭhāti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: would be reborn (in); would re-arise (in); lit. could go towards

example_1: evam'eva kho, mahārāja, idh'ekacco puggalo akusalaṃ kammaṃ cetanāya cetayitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyya.
example_2: bhagavā pana, bhante, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pahoti tathā kātuṃ yathā sabbo loko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti?

meaning_1: to gnosis; to spiritual insight; to enlightenment; to final knowledge
